author: {'steamid': '76561198015803341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1664667468}
review:
Horrific writing and annoying characters spoil what could be a good game. 
Wittiness along the lines of "No YOU!" abounds.
Battle mechanics are smooth and interesting enough.

review:
Me gustan su por sus bromas, diversidad de enemigos y su estilo de diseÃ±o me atraen mucho. El echo de los personajes no se tome asÃ­ mismo enserio hace que el juego sea divertido para pasar el rato, es fÃ¡cil en temas de combos, puzzles y busqueda de items (aunque algunos no te vas a esperar que estÃ©n en ese lugar).
Aunque su dificultad es "DifÃ­cil" si no sos de este tipo de juegos pero tampoco es nada del otro mundo, vale la pena su compra si esperas divertirte y que no tengas la necesidad de farmear por 1 hora una zona para intentar ganarle a un jefe.
Hay juegos mucho mas difÃ­ciles pero este puede dar una experiencia mas relajante y divertida, aunque su historia no es nada del otro mundo.

review: Came back to this many years later, after playing it few times on ArmorGames. For those with the question of whether or not it's worth it--paying for a game they can play for free on a flash website: I say yes! With the amount of content that comes with EBF4 not found in a free-to-play source comes what is in fact a full-blown video game with hours upon hours of content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110344533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 2650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2637, 'last_played': 1589397946}
review:
Turn-Based RPG game with no annoying ambushes and no time limits or whatever in battles. Humor on point, lots of 4th wall breaking, silly plot and characters. Most of the battles you can win without any fancy tactics and strategies on lower difficulties, but it pushes you to think a lot more when you advance in the game. 
Overall I liked this game, but it had some annoying issues:
1) Frame drops when in battles. Doesn't affect gameplay at all tho.
2) Some secrets are hidden in walls without any hints. It's kinda annoying when you have to walk around the whole map, check every frame and press space, which often leads to accidental dialog skips.
3) Good luck remembering all those chests you can open when finally getting that key item, because map doesn't provide you with the location. Gets real boring exploring all previously explored areas 5x throughout the game.
4) Worst of all - When I finally made it to the final boss and nearly finished it after 20-30 minutes of struggling, for the first time - game crashed.   

I recommend it because of the humor, combat and vibe this game brings, but free roaming could be better.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198075061111', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1600841526}
review:
3.5.2020.									Game #120

I understand that this is an old game but for the sake of this review, letâ€™s pretend like it had just come out.

[h1] So imagine that you work in a school as an RPG teacherâ€¦. [/h1]

You have a class full of bright young minds who all want to create great RPGs. You teach them about turn-based, action, Japanese, western â€¦ and all other kinds of RPGs. Eventually, you give a final test to your students. They each need to make their own RPG and submit it to you by a certain date.

Seeing how these are students, your expectations arenâ€™t high. You think that most of them will just use a fancy engine and create a generic RPG that looks pretty or a really short one. Well, the assignments start coming in and itâ€™s just as you expected. Most of the RPGs were made in the Unity engine with free assets, some of them are ok, some of them arenâ€™tâ€¦ just like you were expecting. Then itâ€™s Mattâ€™s turn. Now, Matt, is a student that you really like but Matt is also a rebel. He likes to challenge your knowledge every time he gets a chance and while you find it irritating, you also canâ€™t help but feel proud that Matt has a mind of his own about RPGs. 

So Matt turns in his work and immediately you roll your eyes. 

[h1] What is this, Matt? (you ask with an annoyed tone) [/h1]

Matt notices that you have an annoyed look which makes him nervous but he is still keeping a confident look. He reassures you to take a look at his RPG before you dismiss it. You roll your eyes again and sigh because it is your job as a teacher to grade every single assignment fairly. You start looking at Mattâ€™s work and as you are looking, these are the sounds you make (in this order).

[h1] Sigh. Silence. Silence. Chuckle. Hmm. Hmmmmmm. Aha. Cute. Nice. Interesting. Really?! Wow! [/h1]

Finally, you take a look at Matt and ask him what you have wanted to ask him since you started looking at his RPG.

[h2] Matt, did you make this all by yourself?![/h2]

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a really well-made turn-based RPG, however, itâ€™s really easy to dismiss it because of its looks. Yes, we all judge a book by its cover and honestly, I was ready to dismiss this one after about 10 minutes, but MAN, that would have been a waste.

[h1] Please donâ€™t dismiss this game before trying it [/h1]

Basically, one look at this game, and you will set your expectations really low. This game was made in Flash Player (if I am not mistaken) which is almost non-existent in todayâ€™s modern gaming world. Because of this, the graphics are really primitive. They are bright and very much two-dimensional. The entire game looks like paper cut-outs that went out to have an adventure. It also doesnâ€™t help much that the game makes it clear very early on that it doesnâ€™t take itself seriously. 

[h1] A generic story thatâ€™s very much aware of how generic it is [/h1]

The story follows four heroes that go out into the world to recover precious magic stones that have been stolen by bad guys. The characters are really generic and are basically parodies of every other JRPG heroes weâ€™ve seen a million times BUT, and this is a big BUT, they are all very much aware of their roles, as well as, that they are all inside a video game and they take full advantage of this. You wonâ€™t be blown away by the narrative but at least you will be laughing through it. The characters will spew one-liners about common RPG tropes and gaming culture. If you have played a few JRPGs such as Final Fantasy
 https://store.steampowered.com/app/312750/FINAL_FANTASY_IV/ 
or Dragon Quest https://store.steampowered.com/app/742120/DRAGON_QUEST_XI_Echoes_of_an_Elusive_Age__Digital_Edition_of_Light/, then you will undoubtedly find some of these really funny, I sure did.

[h1] A simple, yet effective, battle system [/h1]

While it looks like the most basic turn based battle system it has a lot of quality of life improvements that really made my time spent with this game more enjoyable. There are no random encounters and grinding is kept to a minimum. You can control three party members at once and they each have a unique class and unique weapons. You do have your very standard melee and ranged attacks and elemental strengths and weaknesses but you also have an SP meter. The SP meter fills out after every single attack you hit or miss and once you accumulate enough SP, you are able to summon a monster to your aid. Also, you donâ€™t even have to summon them, sometimes, they will just summon themselves, free of charge, just to help you out. Characters also have limit breaks which can unleash some devastating attacks or a really strong buff to the party. 

The characters level up by gaining XP, as is expected, but they also gain AP. AP (Ability points) are nothing new, and you get to assign them to each party member on what you want. I was really happy that you could use AP to power up your basic attack, as if the game was saying: â€œHey, if you donâ€™t want any of these abilities, just buff up your attack, pal!â€. I can really appreciate this.

[h1] The soundtrack BLEW MY MIND [/h1]

Can we just talk about how awesome the music is in this game? I mean, my GOD, I was not expecting such a simple game to have such catchy and adrenalin-pumping tunes. They are all really simple looping tunes but MAN, do they make me want to fight something. I especially loved the over-world theme of the first forest area. Itâ€™s way too epic for its own good.

[h1] Lots of other bells and whistles that matter [/h1]

So, as I was playing through this game, and enjoying myself, I kept noticing new things that just made me go â€œWait, the game has THIS TOO?â€. The game has quests (mostly, fetch quests), a bestiary, an endless battle mode, achievementsâ€¦ Look, I know that this is standard stuff in todayâ€™s games, but, you have to understand: this game really looks like it doesnâ€™t have much and it is the complete opposite. The engine is really limited but the developer took full advantage of everything he knew about RPGs and squeezed it in there while adding his own flavor with a generous dash of silliness. 

[h1] Playing this game feels like visiting your home where you grew up and having that home-made dinner you canâ€™t have anywhere else [/h1]

Again, I urge you not to dismiss this game because of how it looks. Yes, itâ€™s old. Yes, it doesnâ€™t look impressive. Yes, it is a game that doesnâ€™t take itself seriously but itâ€™s also reallyâ€¦ wellâ€¦ epic. If you are a fan of JRPGs such as the ones I mentioned above, give this game a try. You might be pleasantly surprised. I know I was.

Also to note, you can totally play this game while you are doing something else, which is a huge plus for me who needs something to do while working. So, Epic Battle Fantasy 4, I'll see you at work.

Next game: Epistory â€“ Typing Chronicles
https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198075061111/recommended/398850/

[h3]If you liked my review, feel free to follow my curator group. Iâ€™m trying to review every single game in my library. Seeing and interacting with fine folks, like you, keeps my motivation up. 
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/RevAMG [/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561198043434509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1589077117}
review:
Solid RPG, decent humor. Pleasantly challenging even for minibosses and some optional normal fights, though that may be because I'm playing on Epic difficulty. Volume's a bit high, but perfectly adjustable - I never went over 25% in the settings. I do miss EBF5's ability to control with mouse AND keyboard at once, but it's not hard to change. And since it can be 100% mouse controlled, this is excellent for use with Steam Link.
The biggest drawback is that I get a lot of slowdown/stutter and an eventual crash if I play in Windowed Mode for a couple hours. Works just fine in Fullscreen.

Definitely recommend, though the sequel is certainly better.

review: "I agree, let's do that."

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1584286046}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#323 out of 612)... it's time for Epic Battle Fantasy 4.

Part adventure game, part JsRPG, all parody. I lost interest in Epic Battle Fantasy 4 pretty quickly (how did this thing wind up in my Library in the first place?). The reason why? Navigation is a pain in the ass. The art design is a bit grating and each map screen is very cluttered. Simply moving around from place to place felt tedious and annoying, and the full-on parody narrative did nothing to encourage me to keep with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026900478', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 2297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2297, 'last_played': 1583806075}
review: I don't even know how I purchased this game, in a bundle somewhere. Had no expectations, but proved to be way better than expected. Light, funny and casual. Will play the sequel someday.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998120102', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4996, 'last_played': 1583970932}
review: I bought this just to support the incredibly polished free versions of Epic Battle Fantasy that have been coming out for years; even without the added dungeon and mode, EBF4 is an amazingly fun and polished game. I love the old-school JRPG feel without old-school difficulty (unless you want it!), and finding all the secrets and finishing sidequests is super fun. The biggest downside is the edgy internet humor (lol feminists are zombies!!) marring the entertainingly goofy world; in addition, some of the battles are so long as to be tedious. Besides that, I'd highly recommend this and the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995285816', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1582149946}
review:
Had high expectations, but starting out I was given no indication what I was doing, why I should care, how to play or why any of the characters mattered. This may come down the line, but I didn't see a lot of promise in the game and it quickly seemed it wasn't for me.

Probably not a flaw if you're coming from earlier games in the series or looking for something more sandboxy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212769343', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 2546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2546, 'last_played': 1583088751}
review: Don't be fooled by the amateurish art style, this is a great RPG with loads of contents, a fun story, lots of parody from other games and a very decent difficulty progression. This one of the few games you want to complete everything. If you like JRPG you will most likely enjoy this game. The characters are very memorable and you will probably want to play the next game. This was a carefully designed game, not just a rushed cash grab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060199698', 'num_games_owned': 1617, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1487001894}
review: Makes it feel like you are playing old classic flash games on the web-browser. Well actually this game did originate from the old web browser game, so it does make sense for it to. It does have that turn based classic Final Fantasy feel with a twist, an action timer. The game does have a sort of replayability feature built in, as in explore newer areas you couldn't from the start. I do recommend this game because it brings nostalgic feelings from the past.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068981865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1581286013}
review:
I dont remember buying this, but I installed it just to play something light a couple days ago, and wow does this game deliver!  The fight mechanics and progression system are tight, and what the game lacks in polish it more than makes up for with terrible puns.

I haven't had such a simple rpg hook me in like this since I played "Dust" for the first time.  So after I 100% this im probably getting #5.  I've had so much fun playing through this silly silly game

author: {'steamid': '76561198149852513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2261, 'last_played': 1578516380}
review:
One of the last games of the Epic Battle Fantasy series I played back on the flash game websites, much more enjoyable on steam. Sure there's a price tag to this game, but it's worth it. There are plenty of hours of gameplay and a good many of things to learn/upgrade. Plus with the addition of the new character, Anna, you now have more customization of personal team composition and strategy.

I definitely recommend this game, but if you are not sold, then I suggest you download and play EBF3. If you find you enjoyed EBF3 and would like to see more of the characters and just generally more content, then go ahead and invest in EBF4!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044653396', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2729, 'last_played': 1577548059}
review:
I beat the game
8.5/10

At first I thought this game was going to be pretty basic and maybe not too fun. When I started to play, the controls were just point and click and the graphics were a bit poor compared to big box games. The dialog windows are very basic and the interface is big and boxy.
But then I played for a few hours and all that went away as I got used to the graphics. And suddenly it didn't really matter because the actual game play is great and the story is much deeper than I expected.

As you travel around the world map, you discover blocks you can't yet break, lily pads you can't yet walk across, bridges with gaps you can't cross, and so on. Later in the game you come across the items you need to travel back and accomplish those tasks, which typically give you more loot.

Fighting enemies involves strategy as you discover their weakness and strength and plan your attack and defense accordingly. If you have ever played an old Final Fantasy tactics game, then you will already be comfortable with the fighting style this game offers.

If you're on the fence about getting this game, go ahead and search Steam for Epic Battle Fantasy 3, which is free and is very similar to what you will get here. And keep in mind that Epic Battle Fantasy 5 is now available on Steam as well. If this information was helpful, go ahead and click the appropriate button below. =P

author: {'steamid': '76561198054216330', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 2516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2516, 'last_played': 1577465074}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Wer bereits vorangegangen Teile der Reihe gespielt hat, wird vieles wiedererkennen. Der Macher ist nicht all zuweit von seinem Erfolgsrezept abgewichen.

[b][u]Willkommen in der kunterbunten Welt blutiger KÃ¤mpfe[/u][/b]
Man bewegt sich via Mausklick durch die kunterbunte Welt und kann durch anklicken mit allerlei NPC und Objekten interagieren. [b]NPCs[/b] geben einem oft Quests, die eigentlich immer darin bestehen, bestimmte Objekte zu sammeln. Nach getaner Arbeit wird man recht oft mit noch wertvolleren Objekten belohnt wie etwa AusrÃ¼stung. 
Um mit [b]Objekten[/b] zu interagieren werden nicht selten besondere Items benÃ¶tigt wie der Hammer, um GerÃ¶ll zu entfernen oder die Axt um BÃ¼che zu entfernen. Oft verstecken sich in den ehemaligen Hindernissen GegenstÃ¤nde oder durch deren Beseitigung tun sich neue Pfade auf. Etwa zu [b]Schatztruhen[/b], die man aus anderen Genrevertrern ja kennt.

[b][u]Die wahr gewordene Fantasie epischer Schlachten[/u][/b]
Interaktion mit [b]Gegnern[/b] fÃ¼hrt generell zum Kampf. Diese sind auf der Weltkarte fast immer sichtbar und sind nicht selten ein Hindernis, das beseitigt werden muss, um im Spiel weiter zu kommen oder um an SchÃ¤tze zu kommen.
[b]KÃ¤mpfe[/b] laufen runden weise ab und manchmal muss pro Kampf mehr als nur eine Gegnertruppe dran glauben, bevor man die verdienten Erfahrungspunkte und Loot bekommt. 
Hierbei haben einige Gegner entweder zusÃ¤tzliche Gimmicks wie die BeschwÃ¶rung anderer Gegner oder andere FÃ¤higkeiten, die ihrer Seite helfen. Und wir sind noch nicht ein Mal bei den [b]Bossen[/b], denn diese verdienen ihren Rang im Gegensatz zu denen in diversen anderen Spielen durchaus. Einige von ihnen machen es auf hÃ¶heren Schwierigkeitsgraden sogar notwendig im Kampf die AusrÃ¼stung zu wechseln, was den Zug eines Charakters aufbraucht, aber je nach Wahl den Kampf entscheidend abkÃ¼rzen kann. 
[b]Taktik[/b] ist also keineswegs optional (es sei denn man ist Ã¼berlevelt oder spielt auf leicht). 

[b][u]Dress Up Game?![/u][/b]
Ein wesentlicher Faktor des Spiels ist die Vielzahl an [bAusrÃ¼stungsgegenstÃ¤nden[/b], die der findige (und fÃ¼ndige) Abenteurer im Verlauf seines Abenteuers ansammelt. 
Diese besitzen oft besondere Eigenschaften wie die ZufÃ¤llige AuslÃ¶sung eines bestimmten Skills oder die Belegung von Gegnern oder Spielercharakteren mit mehr oder minder hilfreichen ZustÃ¤nden. Zudem steigern oder senken fast alle von ihnen die Resistenzen gegen Elemente und ZustÃ¤nde. 
Durch das [b]Upgraden[/b] verstÃ¤rken sich die Eigenschaften der GegenstÃ¤nde noch. Zudem ist der Statusbonus, den die GegenstÃ¤nde liefern stets prozentual, was sie Ã¼ber das ganze Spiel hindurch sinnvoll macht. AuÃŸerdem sehen viele von ihnen ziemlich gut aus.

[b][u]Magiiie[/u][/b]
Neben AusrÃ¼stungsgegenstÃ¤nden kÃ¶nnen die Charaktere eine Vielzahl von [b]Skills[/b] erlangen, die zum Teil relativ frei vergeben werden kÃ¶nnen. Sprich: der Spieler entscheidet, wer Skill XY bekommt. Genau wie bei der AusrÃ¼stung haben Skills oft mehr als nur den Effekt, Schaden zu verursachen und sie kÃ¶nnen [b]verbessert[/b] werden. 
Das erfolgt mittels Skillpunkten, die man neben Erfahrung durch KÃ¤mpfe erlangt. Durch Upgrades werden Skills stÃ¤rker und ihre Begleitffekte (negative ZustÃ¤nde, Buffs etc)treten hÃ¤ufiger und stÃ¤rker auf. Sollte man seine Wahl ein Mal bereuen, kann ein Charakter einen bereits erlernten Skill wieder vergessen 
(investierte Skillpunkte gibt es allerdings nicht erstattet)

Genau wie AusrÃ¼stung kann man Skills auch in Kisten finden oder als Questbelohnung erhalten.

[h1]Grafik, Soundtrack[/h1]
Die Grafik ist kunterbunt, passend zum teils schrÃ¤gen Humor der Serie und liefert auf den ersten Blick vielleicht einen falschen Eindruck Ã¼ber den spielerischen Anspruch der Reihe. 
Die Zwischensequenzen sehen aus, wie aus einem Bilderbuch und wie aus Tonpapier ausgeschnitten, was ziemlich gut aussieht. 

Der Soundtrack ist eigentlich durchgehend gut umgesetzt und durchaus hÃ¶renswert.

[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]

[b]Pro:[/b]
[list]
[*] taktisch tiefgehende KÃ¤mpfe
[*] vier Schwierigkeitsgrade (Leicht, Mittel, Schwer und Episch)
[*] viele AusrÃ¼stungsgegenstÃ¤nde mit unterschiedlichen Eigenschaften
[*] Arenamodus
[/list]

[b]Kontra:[/b]
[list]
[*] "Ich bin kein Negativpunkt, ich putz hier nur."
[/list]

[b]Fazit:[/b]
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 ist ein Spiel, das sich an HardcorejÃ¼nger des JRPG-Genres richtet, die bei Genrevertretern oft kritisieren, dass KÃ¤mpfe zu leicht wÃ¤hren. GrundsÃ¤tzlich ist es auch fÃ¼r Casualgamer interessant, wenn sie sich nicht scheuen auf Leicht zu spielen.
Auf jeden Fall habe ich mit dem Spiel viel SpaÃŸ gehabt und vergebe daher eine vorbehaltslose Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167460183', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5682, 'last_played': 1708875733}
review:
The game is a great way of learning how to strategize and plan ahead, predicting moves that are lethal and not so lethal and giving that feeling of satisfaction or dissatisfaction after every battle and defeat, giving motivation to the player.
I played almost all of the ebf series and it does seem repetitive at some point but theres always something new in the upper games that makes it different, whether its status change or elemental difference.

tl:dr, this game is a really cool and smooth rpg with meta jokes and references that are real goofy :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198158058289', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3174, 'last_played': 1604411724}
review:
Used to play the flash version of this game, loved it. Got this version during the sale and the extra battle mountain is certainly a treat!

The artstyle is pretty neat and the combat system is easy to understand.

The only few cons I'd give is that since the combat is a bit simple, strats for most of the early game usual become repetitive until you get to harder sections like boss rush and etc. Oh! This game is a bit old too so the jokes in here might be a bit out of date but hey! It's adorable to see them.

Anyways, if you want a simple RPG game with neat art and cute characters, this should be a great game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017079884', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4213, 'last_played': 1572406831}
review: "25 hours of gameplay" is a little misleading; if you're one to do sidequests and item upgrades like me, it'll probably take longer depending on the difficulty you have set (I bumped it up to Epic difficulty fairly early on in the game, and it's taken me about 70 hours to get to the final boss fight.) Other than that, I'd say it's pretty great. Some off-color jokes, but also some legit videogame humor and more importantly, earnest tactical gameplay (refreshing in the era of "click to win this fight" mobile gameplay). With difficulty readily adjustable on the fly, and Epic difficulty providing an earnest challenge while still only requiring just a smidge of grinding IME, this game is well worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1461896843}
review:
If you want to do some "JRPG-ing" just for the sake of doing it, EBF4 might be your sort of game. Additionally, if you are after a bit of parody concerning the genre, it does an alright job, though it is the thing it's parodying, so I wouldn't say it's particularly brilliant satire nor did I find it riotously funny. It's pleasant enough, though.

Since it is the thing it's parodying, one may as well simply play a full-on JRPG. It's not as though the "real deal" don't already have both deliberate and inadvertent comedy already built into them. If you dislike the genre enough to really want someone to crack down on it - as I said - you won't get that here since it [i]is[/i] what it's parodying. And if you really like the genre, unless you've played all the JRPG-style games you can get your hands on - and there are a [b]lot[/b] of them, those are games with more story/mechanics/character depth/visuals per mile than this game has to offer, and I would instead suggest playing those.

I'm on the knife's edge of whether to recommend it or not. It's not a bad game, and although it's not one I intend to finish, I am going to *not* recommend it as I was never really enjoying much of anything about it. To me, it's okay at best. If I'm going to recommend a game I am not going to finish, I would prefer it at least be a game that I would finish if I didn't have hundreds of other games pulling me away from this one. Instead, however, I stopped playing this game simply because I wasn't really delighted by it in any way, and there are so many other JRPGs I could try out for the first time or play again that I loved instead. If there was a middle/meh rating, I'd go with that instead. Until then, not recommending is all I can go with and be sincere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416430881', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1704462416}
review: What i mostly loved about this game was that there was finaly more use of new elements in the game like summons. Nearly every one were good and realy usefull but mostly why i loved the game were becouse of one new playable character. Yes i am talking about Anna the fricking nature green head girl. First thing that i love about her is the spells she became stronger every lvl up of skill and the best thing about it her damage is insane. I managed finish whole game without using lance ONCE in the game since i felt like he is useless for the first time in my life actualy and same goes in EBF 5 lance is still useless for me. Also lets not forget the amazing songs by Phyrnna that realy fits into the fights and even places where you are. What i didn't liked about game is sometimes more walking than you would want to and it realy makes the game longer but if you consider the fact of that the game makes you adicted like to drugs i think its fine to say overall that i actualy would say its worth to buy this game not to play it on like browser support a bit Matt in his hard work. In the end without him there won't be any EBF in the first place so he deserves it. In short buy EBF 4 if you want support Matt in his work and we might even get EBF 6 sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025204938', 'num_games_owned': 2984, 'num_reviews': 489, 'playtime_forever': 1302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1302, 'last_played': 1565703189}
review:
Not terrible for the price.  This game aims to be very cutesy, and succeeds.   A watered down RPG focused more on the turn-based battles than anything else (hence the name?).  The skills/specials system seemed a bit weird to me...all skills are unique to one character but certain specials can only by learned by certain characters, and if one of the four learns it nobody else can?  Seems arbitrary.

This would be a good game for a younger kids getting into RPGs for the first time.  There are a couple of odd sexual references (several characters seem to obsess over one's breasts) that seem out of place to me.  Aside from that, though, this would make a great game for someone who loves the turn-based battle system of old-school RPGs, but not necessarily the drawn out storylines.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129137447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1859, 'last_played': 1565907589}
review:
EPIC BATTLE FANTASY 4 - 10/10 - Excelente


O jogo Ã© um rpg com grÃ¡fico simples, mas estÃ¡ recheado de referÃªncia, bom humor e apresenta um grau razoÃ¡vel de desafio. O jogo nÃ£o Ã© linear, possibilitando que o jogador volte  para Ã¡reas antigas. Com o progresso novas formas de exploraÃ§Ã£o sÃ£o descobertas e coisas novas podem ser achadas nos mapa jÃ¡ explorados (quase um metroidvania kkk) 

Eu me diverti bastante, indico esse jogo para fÃ£s de rpgs.



- GUIA BÃSICO PARA O JOGO- 

- Inicialmente vocÃª comeÃ§a apenas com a arqueira chamada Anna.Com o tempo o time fica completo: Natalie (maga), Matt (guerreira) e Lance (atirador).O time pode ter no mÃ¡ximo 3 jogadores ao mesmo tempo, o quarto fica na reserva.

O seu personagem possui um ataque bÃ¡sico, que varia de acordo com a arma equipada. AlÃ©m disso existem magias  que consomem MP do personagem.

Especiais sÃ£o magias diferentes, podem estar disponÃ­veis para mais de 1 personagem, mas dois personagens nÃ£o podem adquirir o mesmo especial. Ã‰ uma questÃ£o de escolha.

PETS = ApÃ³s derrotar um chefe, vocÃª pode invocar-lo  consumindo a barra de SP. O SP aumenta quando inimigos sÃ£o eliminados.

LIMIT BREAK! = Habilidade poderosa que pode ser utilizada quando a barra vermelha estÃ¡ cheia. Essa barra aumenta quando o personagem perde vida.

Equipamentos = vocÃª vai achar equipamentos durante  o gameplay, cada um tem atributos e feitos diferentes. FaÃ§a seu prÃ³prio estilo de jogo. Equipamentos podem ser melhorados com recursos.

Itens = Alguns itens raros aumentam os stats permanentemente. Escolha em quem usar.

Comidas = Comida curam, retiram efeitos ou fortalecem seu aliados. As principais comidas sÃ£o:

CafÃ© = Ressucita um aliado (salvou a minha vida varias vezes)
Chips = Cura 25% da vida de todos  aliados
Fritas = Cura 50% da vida de todos os aliados
Chocolate = Cura 300 MP de todos os aliados
Molho Chili = enche a barra vermelha de um personagem (comida boa, mas rara)

Enfrentar monstros garante,itens, dinheiro, AP, EXP e comida.

EXP faz o nÃ­vel do personagem aumentar. Ã‰ necessÃ¡rio um pouco de  grind (matar muitos monstros para passar de nÃ­vel para poder passar  um chefe e ter acesso Ã  outra Ã¡reas do jogo.

O AP possibilita aumentar as habilidades, especiais e limit breaks.


Pontos negativos: 

O jogo possui uma sÃ©rie de status: amnÃ©sia, condenaÃ§Ã£o, veneno,  paralisia,etc. Sinceramente, sÃ³ o veneno e queimadura funcionam de forma eficaz, inclusive sÃ£o Ã³timas contra inimigos com muita vida porque podem ser acumuladas vÃ¡rias vezes.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

JÃ¡ que vocÃª leu atÃ© aqui, uma dica do faraquito: 

Algumas armaduras dobram os efeitos de magias e itens de cura. Sendo assim as chips irÃ£o curar 50% e as fritas 100%. Ã‰ uma boa estratÃ©gia para usar um aliado como curandeiro secundÃ¡rio caso o principal seja paralisado ou quando enfrentar inimigos  que coloquem o status de amnÃ©sia.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

author: {'steamid': '76561198055994365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 2639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2639, 'last_played': 1528498931}
review:
Even though it is more of a parody of old classic RPGs, the combat is fantastic and in itself enough reason to recommend it. The dialogs are funny, very well written and full of references. IMO it is the best game of its series.It is quite long (25h) for its price and overall a very enjoyable experience.

So u come for the humor and stay for the gameplay!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076290934', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 2053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2053, 'last_played': 1564360684}
review:
Cuarta entrega de la saga, la cual trae un nuevo personaje y varias novedades.

DespuÃ©s de aguantar las travesuras de Matt el ladrÃ³n comedoritos, Natalie la gruÃ±ona pechugona, Lance el flamer/rager/tÃ³xico/nazi/etc, ahora Anna se une al escuadrÃ³n de gamberros con la excusa de que alguien ha robando las gemas de Diosgato, la deidad de su pueblo (porque el cristianismo ya quedÃ³ muy mainstream).

Dejando de lado las bromas, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 da un gran paso adelante en la saga por sus notorios cambios y a la vez no pierde su esencia de ser un juego de rol por turnos muy friendly para el jugador (esto lo explico mÃ¡s adelante).



En esta entrega, tenemos una nueva mecÃ¡nica que son las mascotas.
Ahora cualquiera de los cuatro personajes pueden invocar una mascota que ofrece una habilidad Ãºnica la cual gasta una serie de puntos que se van recuperando matando enemigos.

Las primeras mascotas son muy bÃ¡sicas pero muy efectivas a nivel bajo y gastan poquito, mientras que las mÃ¡s avanzadas gastan muchos puntos pero ofrecen habilidades muy poderosas que pueden cambiar el ritmo de la partida.

Otra de las novedades es que ahora que hay 4 personajes. 3 hay en combate y 1 se queda de reserva.
Esto lo he visto un poco OP, ya que el personaje de reserva se encuentra "a salvo", por lo que si un jefe poderoso lanza su Limit Break sin que lleves defensas, el personaje de reserva los revivirÃ¡ a todos. De todas formas me sigue gustando esta mecÃ¡nica ya que asÃ­ da mÃ¡s estrategia porque el personaje de reserva es invencible pero tampoco hace nada en la pelea.



Dejando de lado estas novedades, hablemos del juego en profundidad:
Si no habÃ©is jugado a los anteriores, tenÃ©is que saber que EBF 4 es un juego de rol por turnos que puede parecer muy genÃ©rico pero en realidad tiene mucha personalidad.

Por ejemplo, os acordÃ¡is que decÃ­a que el juego era muy friendly?
Cuando digo que el juego es "friendly", es porque hay pocas penalizaciones a diferencia de otros juegos del mismo gÃ©nero, lo que lo hace mÃ¡s cÃ³modo y disfrutable. Por ejemplo, aquÃ­ puedes abandonar cualquier combate sin problemas y los enemigos no tienen habilidades para que no huyas, ni hay posibilidades de no-huir. De hecho, puedes abandonar incluso peleas contra jefes.

AdemÃ¡s, otra de las novedades es que los personajes se regeneran automÃ¡ticamente, por no decir que existen fuentes para restaurar la vida y el manÃ¡ al instante. Esto hace que ya no tengas que consumir comida o buscar un lugar para dormir (o lo que hacia yo era curar a todos con Natalie antes de terminar un combate).

Todo esto hace que el juego parezca fÃ¡cil pero, al igual que el anterior, es muy fÃ¡cil al principio y muy difÃ­cil al final. Tiene una de las mejores curvas de dificultad que yo he visto nunca.



Y hablando de cosas guays: Â¡EBF 4 tiene post game!

A diferencia del anterior, este juego tiene contenido extra para cuando acabas la historia principal, aunque se puede jugar incluso al principio (no se recomienda ya que ahÃ­ no ganas ni dinero ni experiencia).

Son una serie de desafÃ­os muy divertidos donde los enemigos se adaptan al nivel del jugador y los jefes son aÃºn mÃ¡s poderosos. AdemÃ¡s de tener unas buenas recompensas exclusivas al superar ciertos retos (armas, armaduras y accesorios).



Pero si hay algo malo que tengo que decir, es los crashes.

Â¿De verdad? Tengo una 1080ti, me va perfecto cualquier juego a 4k Ultra de 70 napos comprado en Steam verde. Â¿De verdad este juego me ha crasheado 6 VECES? Â¿PERO ESTO KE EEEEES?

No, ya en serio. El juego va bien de rendimiento, pero creo que hay un problema con la pantalla completa que hace crash y molesta bastante, en especial cuando estaba a punto de perder contra un jefe y perder igualmente mi progreso. Â¡Que desperdicio!





Resumen:

*LO BUENO
- Sigue siendo un buen juego de rol por turnos con mucho contenido y exploraciÃ³n.
- Sigue teniendo una buena historia con personajes carismÃ¡ticos y mucho humor.
- Sigue siendo muy friendly con el jugador. Muy fÃ¡cil al principio y muy difÃ­cil al final.
- Personalmente, tiene la mejor BSO de los 5 Epic Battle Fantasy.
- Muchas novedades como las mascotas o el personaje de reserva.
- Contenido post-game.
- EstÃ¡ en espaÃ±ol, yupi!!!

*LO MALO
- Crashes constantes a pantalla completa.



Ya habiendo dicho todo lo que querÃ­a decir, recomiendo EBF 4 a todos los que les gusten los juegos de rol por turnos, el Ã¡nime, los gatos, los perros, las cocodrilos, los dinosaurios rockeros y la pizza.

Aunque les recomiendo jugar antes a la tercera entrega, que es gratis. La 1Âª y la 2Âª no las recomiendo tanto porque son solo combates y no estÃ¡n en Steam, aunque las pueden buscar por Internet y probarlas.

Le scÃ©nario est relativement simple, il s'agit de sauver le monde des dÃ©esses fÃ©lines et de leurs sbires sans pattes. review:
From someone who had never played any turn-based RPGs, I tried EBF3. And it was awesome. And, I decided to buy 4. Cause, why not?
And I can say confidently that it is better than 3.
A definite recommend if you like turn-based RPG. The story is simple  but fun and it surprisingly doesn't ever get grindy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113937504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1555286678}
review:
If I've got my history right, Matt Roszak was a guy who made animations on Newgrounds and stuff. They were pretty funny and had some cool fight scenes, too. Then he made a video game, and it was called "Epic Battle Fantasy". It was really only a parody game and it wasn't meant to be taken very seriously. I mean, the final boss was a freaking zombie Goku for Christ's sake. However, it was still fun, and had some funny bits in it too. Then he made another one, a direct sequel to Epic Battle Fantasy. Still mostly a parody game. But then he made a third game, and this one wasn't as much of a parody game. It had a good story and it was the first to actually have an open world. It was decently long, too. Then came Epic Battle Fantasy 4. This was his first attempt at making a game big enough and good enough to be sold as an actual game, and not just some browser flash game. And let me tell you, he did an AMAZING job at it. Like the other games, it's a pretty basic turn-based combat system. It has a very long story this time, and definitely tells the best story of them all. Big world with several different environments, each with their own boss at the end. Lots of sidequests. A fuck ton of different weapons and armor sets to find, each with their own unique look and effects. Throughout playing all of the games, I've fallen in love with the characters (but trust me, you don't need to play the first three games to fall in love with the characters). They all have hilarious personalities and say funny stupid shit all the time. There's also a 5th game out now, but I'm not writing a review for that yet because I'm not even close to finishing it yet. I like it so far though, so I absolutely recommend you buy both games.









Matt for Smash

author: {'steamid': '76561198446463553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 9332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1611190246}
review:
Un juego hecho con amor, cariÃ±o y mÃ¡s que nada, GANAS.

EBF4 es al igual que el 3 un juego donde no te da un reto a menos que quieras aumentar la dificultad o hacer los jefes en el mapa de retos por beneficios extra, pero lo principal es risa, un buen rato y tener buenos recuerdos si has jugado clÃ¡sicos del estilo RPG.

Estoy seguro que mÃ¡s de uno habrÃ¡ jugado Ã©ste juego en una pÃ¡gina de juegos flash antes que en Steam, y creanme, vale la pena comprarlo aunque el creador tuviera el corazÃ³n de poner el 90% del juego gratis por ahÃ­ en Newgrounds y mÃ¡s allÃ¡.

Ã‰sta saga realmente es como un anime de comedia y aventura con todo muy bien hecho. Personajes divertidos, buena musica, muy buen diseÃ±o que puede ser un anime cualquier dÃ­a de la semana, humor negro, referencias del mundo del anime a patadas, chistes sexuales, machistas y una historia que aunque estÃ¡ ahÃ­, es decente y sigue la linea argumental del juego anterior. 
Como dije, no es un juego para partirte la cabeza, (aunque tenga algunas secciones de puzzle y de tener objetos MUY escondidos) es un juego que estÃ¡ hecho con la intenciÃ³n de que te lo pases bien con unos personajes muy divertidos que a medida que avances, te vayas riendo y encariÃ±ando con ellos, siendo por ver quÃ© mÃ¡s pasa entre ellos la razÃ³n de que prosigas.

El sistema de batalla estÃ¡ ligeramente mÃ¡s pulido que el de la entrega anterior, pero sigue siendo el mismo, clÃ¡sico, accesible y sencillo sistema que estÃ¡ hecho enteramente de los RPG de la vieja escuela que resultarÃ¡ imposible el confundirte lo mÃ¡s mÃ­nimo.

En sÃ­, Ã©ste juego o mÃ¡s bien, la saga, lo vale totalmente. Si quieres reirte, pasarlo bien, recordar los viejos y geniales RPG y tener el logro mÃ¡s gracioso y sensual posible, compralo. 
Si disfrutas del anime, los viejos RPG y chistes de toda indole, te apuesto lo que quieras a que te vas a divertir.

(TambiÃ©n estÃ¡ la opciÃ³n de censurar escotes y chistes sexuales para gente sin sentido del humor)

En cuanto a lo malo ... nada, quizÃ¡s el traje de ninja que en la versiÃ³n Â´Â´chibiÂ´Â´ del personaje, se ve otra cosa, pero por lo demÃ¡s, si le encuentras un error, seguro es porque estÃ¡ programado para que te lo encuentres, porque el juego tambiÃ©n rompe la cuarta pared con chistes de errores informaticos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014383949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1553922061}
review:
Entertaining combat with quite a bit of depth and gorgeous animations and humorous details. Fun lightweight dungeon navigation, with a slight "metroidvania" or Zelda-like touch to the unlocking of areas.

Figuring out which character gets which special skill is annoying though, since only one can get each one of them, and only three out of four characters are in the party at any given time. There's no way to respec, so this can lead to agonizing decisions which go against the otherwise lightweight and fun overall spirit of the game.

Reading the elemental resistances on all enemies can get tedious, too. Some quicker way to see at a glance what the various enemies are most vulnerable to would've been appreciated. Also in the usability department, you can see what upgrade requires which material, but you can't look at a list of materials to know where to find them and which upgrade they can be used for, you have to look at every monster description in the encyclopedia and every upgrade for that. An elaborate crafting system like this one desperately needs a cross-reference, something the Legend of Heroes: Tales in the Sky series understood.

Oh yeah. And this is a JRPG without controller support. In <insert current year here>? Mouse and keyboard only. My RSI thanks you.

Verdict: very flawed, but addictive and good fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023474251', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2146, 'last_played': 1549965984}
review:
A charming parodic JRPG, which means it has self-aware/tongue-in-cheek humor. EBF4 has plenty of shout-outs/references to other games, anime, etc. You don't particularly need to play EBF1-3 to understand the story, as there is a small recap at the beginning. Although you can, since they're still technically free games hosted on Kongregate/Armor Games (Personally, I've played EBF1 and 2). The gameplay is solid (not unique, per se, since there's literally hundreds of JRPGs out there), the characters are unique, and the music is awesome (composed by Phyrnna/Halcyonic Falcon X)

This game is firmly in the mold of turn-based JRPG, so it does become a bit samey after about 30 hours. Whether that's a positive or negative is up to you. However, one thing I can say is that my PC could not get this game running at a consistent framerate, even with all settings turned down. Now whether that's due to being made in Flash (this series was originally played on web browsers, in the era of Adobe Flash) or my system memory/CPU being lazy, I don't know. But it definitely should not have had framerate issues on this game if it wasn't made in Flash and with my current system specs.

Regardless of the performance issues, I still enjoyed EBF4. If you like JRPGs, you'll probably find something enjoyable about this game. $12 is a hard asking price, especially if the free version is available, but if you have the cash, consider supporting this dude. EBF5 is also a good buy (currently enjoying it as I'm writing this review).

Number score if you care about that sort of thing: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198164793141', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1627899307}
review:
The Epic Battle Fantasy franchise is something I have a personal attachment to. I remember when the third game wass current, I remember playing it to completion on Kongregate and needing a walkthrough for some hidden stuff. I remember the hype I felt when I saw this game was available on the site's then-new Beta feature. I remember looking at the teaser (as I could not access Betas) and wondering what the game would be, since the only screenshot I could see was one of the cutscene art. I will never in my life say this is a bad game.
However, now that I bring myself to writing this, I realize the game itself has little to write abbout. It has JRPG systems (HP and mana, Turn-Based Combat, Limit Breaks) we all know, and they work well here. The plot's actually original, though I've little memory of it.
To me, what shines is the HUMOR - The game is FULL of references, and only going through the series again in preparation for EBF5 did I catch just how many references there were.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206101415', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2530, 'last_played': 1451066735}

author: {'steamid': '76561198388660255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 70, 'playtime_at_review': 2519, 'last_played': 1712266617}
review:
Very fun turn based RPG. Highly reccomend buying it; it is worth every coin. 

I've played Matt's EBF games in the past and they are extremely addicting. Even without the story, it was easy to love the characters.
EBF4 is probably my favorite game in the series, beating even EBF5 (this review has been updated). The art is excellent, the gameplay is simple, the story is well written and humorous, and the mechanics offer a lovely challenge. Bonus: the music is awesome.

Protip: scan every enemy and find what they're weak to both elementally and statistically.

EDIT: I forgot to leave numbers on this review. 9.5 / 10.

review: Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a fantastic, light hearted, and self aware RPG, and it is very cheap. I highly reccomend you pick it up at your earliest convenience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071618508', 'num_games_owned': 1987, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1544973129}
review: The Epic Battle Fantasy series may be only one of three franchises that has seen continued success after it left its browser form. Along with the Creeper World and Bloons franchises, EBF has actually been purchased and allowed its developer some level of financial return on their years of work. At its core EBF is a simplistic RPG and is altogether rather repetitive, however the cute art style and writing full of references to bygone memes and some new ones is a refreshing take on the genre. I finally played through EBF4 after the release of EBF5 and one warning I have to give about this series is that they should not be played or replayed one after the other. You have to give yourself a month to refresh or else you're going to be bored, as each game in the series has its share of repetition, although that does not mean I recommend them any less.

If you're into games that are filled with "oh jesus christ why did I put this on the hardest difficulty" and "jesus christ this is so much fun" then you should probably play this. Otherwise, you have no taste.

review:
[h1]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/h1]


Hace tiempo hice una reseÃ±a del EBF3 donde hare un pequeÃ±o resumen, cuando era niÃ±o o cuando yo estaba en la primaria, llegaba a casa a jugar EBF3 en una pagina de juegos flash llamado [url=https://armorgames.com/]Armorgames.com[/url]. 

Cuando yo aun no conocia steam me la pasaba jugando en esa pagina, y despues de buscar juegos nuevos me encontre EBF4 y me lo llegue a completar. Cuando ya conoci Steam, decidi buscar si ambos juegos estan en la plataforma, alli mire que el EBF3 esta gratis como en Steam y en flash, pero el EBF4 es de paga, pero en su version flash es gratis (la version de Steam o paga es porque aÃ±ade mas contenido que la version flash). Aunque ya me lo habia completado en la version flash, decidi pagar para volverlo a jugar, pero esta vez en Steam.

A diferencia del EBF3, este juego es mas conocido que el anterior, tiene varios cambios como la calidad de los dibujos, puedes jugarlo gratis o puedes pagar para tener mas contenido (que si no recuerdo mal, aÃ±ade lo que seria piezas de armas, armaduras, mas enemigos, bosses y una zona). Si te gustan los juegos de Rpg por turno, entonces compratelo cuando este en rebajas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297414013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1544272893}
review:
I'm honestly just not enjoying this game.

It lacks controller support for no good reason... I understand it's a port of a flash game, but if you're going to port it, maybe make that little extra effort. This game is insufferable on a laptop with a touchpad, and I don't often have a place to use a mouse, so a controller would be ideal.

It throws a LOT at you right out of the box, including instant-death attacks very early on, keeping you constantly micro-managing your party's well being even in some trash fights.

It requires almost constant micro-management of gear, since the fights are often very mixed and resists/vulnerabilities need to be shuffled, but also penalizes you for swapping gear mid-fight.

Because of the above, even short farming or grinding fights are unnecessarily long, and fights against strong "trash" enemies like dragons take for-friggin-ever.

All in all, this game is mostly boring, with a regular stream of barely-funny trope references that I suppose are to make it... charming? You spend a lot of time doing a tedious amount of micro-management every few fights, or you'll quickly fall behind, and the game doesn't really do much to show you what you should be doing (upgrading gear, skills, specials, what the differences are, etc), so you'll just kind of suffer along.

Maybe this game would be more enjoyable if I'd been following the series, but, as a stand-alone, it's a let-down. I'm glad I got it on sale, but I still would rather have the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096919270', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2890, 'last_played': 1683421338}
review:
Easily one of my favorite RPGs. Beautiful writing, beautiful characters, and beautiful artwork. The gameplay is good, comparable to the old Final Fantasy games, with a little more depth to the out-of-combat aspects, like weapon forging and equips. Also features all the common RPG tropes: block puzzles, backtracking, and semi-pointless NPC quests. The areas are interesting, although for the first third of the game, you just equip gear with the proper elemental resistance and you're good. At the second boss, though, the game steps it up and keeps you on your toes strategically. In terms of difficulty, Normal is a cake walk, and Epic is either a grindfest or a brain teaser, depending on your playstyle. I'd say that Hard is the way to go if you want a challenge with decent progression. All in all, though, I wouldn't say that's the main draw with the game (At least not for me personally). The best part of this game is the writing. Let's start with the characters. Each of the four characters has a distinct personality that, at a surface level, seems to fit into a common RPG trope. The dialogue between the party members, and the party members and the NPCs/world around them, is phenominal. Witty, crisp, and that elusive perfect amount of deviant, it keeps the game fresh and fun and keeps me wanting to see more of these vagabonds travelling the world, killing things and making wisecracks as they do. The story is interesting overall, but the game seems to lack focus on it.

Final score: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034666883', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 3819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3819, 'last_played': 1439795382}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070363958', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2977, 'last_played': 1497986888}
review: Since EBF5 dropped i thought i might leave a review here. First of all, as a kid, i enjoyed playing EBF, EBF2 and EBF3 on my web browser and loved literally every second of it. Instead of being just a copycat that rips off popular games, these games managed to reference them in a way that made me smile every time i understood a reference and this one is no exception. The battle system is very well thought out, puzzles are sometimes hard, but not frustrating to solve. Overall the story is interesting, if you have played EBF3 and maybe even EBF2, especially because of the two Godcats. The music is fantastic, as well as the visuals not only in the overwold, but also in fights. I love this game and am looking forward to playing more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088553474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1575262022}
review:
The game doesn't evolve too much from it's predicessors, but if it ain't broke, why fix it? Around the late game, where battles get much longer, it became A good game to play in the background while watching a livestream or movie. Plus you can run it on basically any PC as long as flash is supported.
Also, let me save you some time: Most of the negative reviews are from people who didn't read the game's description. What's in the description and trailers is what you get. Nothing less, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056350187', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 429, 'playtime_forever': 5552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2033, 'last_played': 1710420951}
review:
Pros:
-I like the menu interface. Everything I need is right in front of me and itâ€™s easy to get to with a click
-Anne is a good character, with some good healing and one target attacks and learns wind magic by default.
-Summons. While I didnâ€™t use all of them, these can be game changers  in though fights. Or you can just summon Slime bunny and get the Regan status.
-I upgraded my equipment more often in this one and the effects are really something. I was dying a good few times during the second boss and the winter townâ€™s optional boss and when I upgraded my equipment for the third boss, it was way easier. A party member died but it was easier.
-Speaking of bosses, the battle mountain has some pretty though and brutal bosses which are a joy to take down. Sure they start spamming helpers every turn near the end but I really enjoyed those fights.
I donâ€™t hate fighting monoliths now.

Cons:
-I may have missed something but I wish there was a way to know what the elements symbols mean. I thought Light was wind for a good while.
-I had to go down to easy to fight the final boss. Even on easy these guys are not pushovers.
-Can get boring after a while.
9/10

review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 Ã© um jogo RPG muito divertido de se jogar e por isso estou fazendo essa anÃ¡lise, irei falar sobre o porque vocÃª deve comprar esse jogo:

1-o jogo contÃ©m uma sÃ©ries de desafios (desafios mais hardcores do que as do ZÃ³io) que envolve matar bosses na dificuldade Ã‰pica o que faz com que algumas batalhas exiga muita extratÃ©gia para se vencelas, desafios perfeitos para pessoas TRUE HARDCORE GAMERS!!!!

2-PIADAS, sim, isso mesmo, o jogo contÃ©m piadinhas durante a gameplay,

3-Variedades de ataques normais e magicos desde uma pancada atÃ© uma desturiÃ§Ã£o mundial entre outras...

4-Musicas Ã³timas, principalmentes as dos bosses, para se encaixar com a adrenalina no momento 

5-Armas, Armaduras e AcessÃ³rios, um ponto positivo e que nunca vi em outro jogo de RPG Ã© que quando vocÃª a equipa ela aperece durante as batalhas e no mapa.

Bem essa foi minha anÃ¡lise, espero ter lhe convencido de ter a vontade de jogar esse game incrivel.

review:
Es un juego muy divertido y gracioso. ContinÃºa la historia donde la dejÃ³ EBF3, y mete como nuevo personaje jugable a una arquera.

Contiene una gran variedad de armas y armaduras (divididas en arcos, espadas, bÃ¡culos, armas de fuego, armaduras masculinas, armaduras femeninas e insignias) que se pueden mejorar para conseguir pasar esos monstruos que tanto cuesta vencer.

Otro detalle a destacar: contiene diÃ¡logos rompiendo la cuarta pared y comentarios graciosos. Y quizÃ¡ lo mejor: traducido por completo al espaÃ±ol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052387260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1541739775}
review:
I played this game when it was free and hosted on a popular flash game site.  We all know the one, no need to mention it.  When I saw the game on Steam, I immediately purchased it as support for Matt.  His stuff has always been great, funny and with excellent game play.  
I purchased it for my son as well and he had a blast.  If you are looking for a fun story, good game play and witty banter between your party members, go for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072169113', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1650647746}
review: An absolute gem of a JRPG, the only one I actually like (mostly because it's a bit of a piss-take). Admittedly, I do have the nostalgia goggles on, seeing as how I played both EBF games prior to their release on steam, but it's still gets laughs out of me, just like when I first played it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035305667', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 3305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3125, 'last_played': 1541974871}

author: {'steamid': '76561198253534355', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1773, 'last_played': 1540695325}
review: I havenâ€™t played that many RPGs in the past, but this game is very fun! Thereâ€™s a lot of freedom of strategy in this game, thereâ€™s a lot of equipment and weapons to use, and some spells you get to pick who learns them, leading to lots of different strategies that you can use. I highly recommend playing the game on epic difficulty unless you are very new to RPGs and strategies in general, because I think the other difficulties ended up being too easy and essentially just being a game of hitting an enemy until it dies. However epic difficulty I feel is the best way to play, because it means you are forced to use more of the mechanics like switching team members or equipment sets or using various buffs and debuffs without being so hard as to be overwhelming. If you are interested in this game I also highly recommend EBF5 which I feel is an improvement of every aspect of this game (don't worry about missing story either, as 5 is a sort of reboot)

author: {'steamid': '76561198271888115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2086, 'last_played': 1584521857}
review: Never have I seen a game where you summon mammoths, tanks, and sword wielding kittens all at the same time. The sheer nonsense that goes on during combat is truly astonishing. You will see hilarious commentary, and tons of game references when you travel with this cast of muscle headed idiots. This is a great game to play and play again in my opinion there is a lot of hidden treasure for you to discover and a bunch of hilarious achievements to unlock, truly a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051007182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1612777864}
review:
This is one of my favorite RPGs.  The game is charming, hilarious, provides plenty of play time, and has very satisfying and strategic combat.  I grew up playing the classic 'Final Fantasy' titles, and I find this game to be more enjoyable.  In this game, the gear is all useful and plays into strategy and style of play, and you can't rely on equipment and XP level alone to sorely outmuscle your opponents as in a lot of RPGs.  You can also play it one handed with a mouse, which can be really useful if you like to do other things while you play games.  When my wife was pregnant and had sore feet, I could rub her feet with the hand I wasn't using.

Believe the scores of reviews; this is a great game.  Support the dev so he can afford to keep it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192980079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2277, 'last_played': 1703991834}
review:
This is a game that a casual, or the super hardcore can play.  The combat is probably the best most in-depth system in any turn based battle game ever (Disclaimer:  I have not played every turn based game ever).  I played this game on normal the first time (enemies have 100% hp and attack).  It was challenging and fun.  Then I played on the hardest difficulty (200% enemy hp and attack) and had only marginally more trouble.  This is because there are, say, 10 mechanics (random number) that are important to understand to improve your game.  To win of normal, you need to understand 2 of them (I should get fire defense against fire enemies and attack them with water).  Harder difficulties just make it so you have to start using buffs and statuses that you could ignored on normal.  My latest playthrough (first on on the steam version) I am playing on Epic without killing any enemy twice (no grinding) and just beat the Rafflesia while under leveled by an average of 2 levels.  So while the game is extremely complex and has an absurd skill ceiling, but you can just kinda ignore that complexity and have fun too.  That is the core of the game.  Additionally, the art style is fantastic, the animations are fluid, and the story and quests provide comic relief.

However, this is an indie game, and while the living God who made it pretty much by himself is incredable, the game does not even support 1920 by 1080.  I have a 4k monitor.  Since stretching sub HD to 4k is a bit of a strain on my processor (4 cores 3.4 hz), to play in full screen without lag, I need to turn the settings down to nothing.  So if you have a 4k monitor, be warned.  HD you will be fine though.  Unlike Epic Battle Fantasy 3 (which is free on Steam and will give you an idea of what this game is like), there is a lot of back tracking, and there are no acheivements for getting all the treasure in an area, so you may end up missing some equipment.  If you have OCD like me, this is bothersome.

Despite all of this, I regret nothing, and you won't either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189476526', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6723, 'last_played': 1543435754}
review:
Very solid RPG, with many hours worth of content (My playtime is from completely 100%ing it and a bit more, but just beating it on lower difficulties should take at least 10-15  hours?) and difficulties that enable both experienced RPG players and those new to the genre to enjoy. 
The characters don't really take themselves seriously, and -whilst some jokes are quite dated at this point-, they're enjoyable to see interact with the situation and each other.
Enviroments and the enemies they host are fun to explore and varied, requiring different equips and smart tactics to deal with effectively on harder settings.
New weapons, armour and flairs are fun to find and try out their effects.

Overall, a very enjoyable experience worth the price of admission in my opinion.
You CAN find the game for free in flash form online, but the steam version has no ads, gives you more bosses to beat, equipment to find and medals to earn etc.

If you're unsure if you'd have a good experience or are hesitant to shell out money for an expansion of a flash game, I think it's worth waiting for a sale- I think it goes quite cheap at Christmas. A few pounds/dollars/whatever is a steal for the amount of content available.

I really love this series; can't wait for the fifth game to come out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198260835437', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4184, 'last_played': 1562706140}
review:
I'm gonna start off by saying that I absolutely love this game and all the other games in this series. The epic battle fantasy 2 was one of the first games I ever played, all those years ago when even flash games were impressive. From then on I followed the series and loved every new addition to it. My journey capped off at this game, when I finally got enough money to buy the full version on steam. Even though I could play most of it for free online, I was not disappointed. The extra content and cloud saving was worth it. I was even more thrilled to learn that the surge of people playing this game on steam led to the developer starting work on a fifth game in the series. This game, and the other ones in the series, were my childhood, and I am proud to say that I have been following this series from the start.

Get this game. It's affordable, and it contains hours of content. I have beaten it many times over, both in the online flash version and on steam, and I still keep coming back every time I want to play a solid game with characters that I have grown to care about. 10/10. (the third game is free on steam, check that one out too, it is a good preview of the amazingness the fourth one is)

author: {'steamid': '76561198141594524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1671989304}
review:
First of all, keep in mind you can play a free version online. You won't get the extra area (which is honestly 1/3 of the game)
There is more than enough content for the price you get, hard but (mostly) fair, it looks great, there's a ton of skills and even more equips to change up the gameplay a bit and most importantly, the music is absolutely badass. 
I recommend playing on Epic for the main game as it makes you utilise the buffs, debuffs and status effects more, maybe turn it down (yes, you can change difficulty on the go). It's also not that hard if you fight every encounter in the game (there are no random ones)
Only gripes are that the area exclusive to this version is too hard at times for cheap reasons (enemies spamming limit breaks), the backup system is a bit janky because a character will be unbuffed, and making a bad choice in spreading stat boots and skills might mean wasting time grinding later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148444410', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3396, 'last_played': 1531931035}
review:
This game is a journey about 4 wildly different dudes that must find in them the power to prevent a terrible catastrophy and save the world, blablabla, you've heard it all before, it's your typical JRPG backstory, and will almost certainly not be the reason you will love this game. 
You will love this game because this is NOT your typical JRPG. The game is oozing with personality, be it in the art or in the dialogue, in the characters and in the foes, wherever you look, there is something special about it. Combat mechanics are simple and fun, and very naratively apropriate considering the fact the game does not take itself very seriously. But even on top of all that, it still presents a nice little bit of challenge on it's boss fights, specially on the extra bosses in the side content, if you chose to play on harder difficulties. And just to top it off, a phenomenal soundtrack to accompany all the epic moments you are going to have here.
Definitely an easy buy for anyone looking for some old school turn based RPG action

author: {'steamid': '76561198081436529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1453608073}
review: One of those games you can play over and over again, plenty of content and youre always looking forward to the next fight and gear upgrade, you constantly feel like your making progress and every step adds up to make your characters stronger and more defined in their roles

author: {'steamid': '76561198353215065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1519071685}
review:
Since Matt so politely asked us to make a review of this game on Facebook, I'll kindly obliged.
The game itself is what you'd expect from a turn base RPG system with some quirks and mechanics with the summon and SP function. The game is overall enjoyable with some tid bits of easter eggs, jokes and references and is an overall enjoyable experience as you go along with the story of the four quirky dorks and their adventure to defeat some kind of cat or whatever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067959547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3218, 'last_played': 1701671518}
review:
I very much enjoyed this game. The gameplay is rewarding and the bosses well designed, although I never was able to beat the final boss on epic, the music is very nice, and the comedy, whilst not always successful, is entertaining more often than not. All in all, this is a very solid game, definitely worth its price tag. The free version has most of the features, but lacks the DLC area, which is probably the best designed and most fun area of the game. In particular, the Dark Bosses (which are DLC only) are a far more enjoyable fight than any of the vanilla battles. However, it may be wise to try the free version first before purchasing this game, or maybe try the third game which is always free and also on Steam.

I would recommend this game fairly strongly, rating it at maybe an 8/10. It's better than most games on this website, but it's not groundbreaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082352632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4020, 'last_played': 1710287144}
review: This was the game that got me into turn based RPGs.  The combat is interesting due to the amount of equips and elements available.  I really enjoy it and I have been replaying it recently because the 5th game is coming out soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083504604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6587, 'last_played': 1661988638}
review:
Do you remember the golden days of flash games? This game fully embodies exactly what that feeling was back then. 
A solid fantasy-RPG with genuine charm and crafted with a whole lot of love is Epic Battle Fantasy. 
One of it's best features is in the customization; multiple equipment, spells, and weapons change up how you play, changing it's multiple elemental properties, letting you decide which one to really focus on.
The animation is amazing, characters, environments, enemies, bosses, attacks, and even specials (especially Natalie) are all unique. There are achievements too, if you're into that.

Can't wait for the sequel, go buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093347752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 19436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14308, 'last_played': 1693245118}
review:
Definitely the best indie game I have ever played! Donâ€™t be fooled by it being the fourth, you can play it first without having ever even heard of the others (I actually started on this one and went back to play all of Kupo's other games). Iâ€™ve sunk so many hours into this game both here and on Kongregate, smashing foes, claiming loot, and earning badges! Itâ€™s like a better, funnier, cuter, less grind-y version of traditional Final Fantasy. The humor is very tongue-in-cheek, poking lighthearted fun at stuff you see every day, either around you or in the news, and the art is an adorable anime-esque style you can't help but love. And there are. So. Many. Easter eggs. Easter eggs for days. And the text changes depending on who you have in the front!

The game is entirely planned, designed, written, and developed by one guy who has what makes games actually fun in mind, and with an ear turned to his fans. The music is done by Phyrnna, and is both catchy and fitting, while the sound effects are satisfying. And at only $12, now, it is a steal for some easy fun, plus you get the awesome soundtrack included! So get in there, beat up some adorable monsters, steal your way to riches, and make yourself the most morally gray and dysfunctional team of heroes around!

to;dr 100/10, would adventure again, and again, and again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047433759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1509316779}
review:
One of my favourite games. Bought it after playing the free version online a bunch, which you can try first if you're not certain of buying. Buying gives you extra content which isn't canon, but is very fun. (You have to replay the story mode if you want to access the extra content though).
The main two pluspoints of this game are 
+ its absolutely solid turnbased gameplay paired with a fun equipment-system
+ the humorous, pop/internet-culture referencing dialogue

Something that I personally liked less than its predecessor ebf3, is the pacing of walking through the overworld: that part is quite a bit slower. Also, just a heads up, though I think it works well for the game: for an RPG, its story isn't actually a very strong focus point.

I absolutely recommend anyone remotely interested try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049968706', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1809, 'last_played': 1547553882}

This game is so good! I remember playing on web, then after it got released on steam, I bought it and played it again.
This is one RPGs that I won't forget. Every aspects is just so good, world-building, gameplay, attacks and skills and many more that other reviews have said. Heck, if you are not interested, play it for the jokes that resides in the story! Lots and lots of jokes to keep you entertain. Even when I played the second time, the jokes still get me laughing. (Or you could just play it for Natalie--- *cough Cough*)

author: {'steamid': '76561198061519611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 3754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3754, 'last_played': 1538674579}
review: Epic Battle Fantasy 4 shows that turn based RPGs can still work. No "mash the attack button" in this game and each battle takes some strategy by focusing on enemy weaknesses. There isn't much of a story at all and the ending is kind of lame, but the battle system made up for the shortfalls. This game takes about 30 hours to "do everything" on your first playthrough. To get all the achievements you need to play the game 3 times which does get a bit repetitive, but the later playthroughs are faster since you already have all your gear.
