review:
Review zu "Epic Battle Fantasy 4"


Gespielte Zeit Ã¼ber 44 Stunden , weil ich alles mache was geht , und einige zusÃ¤tzliche Sachen eine Herausforderung sind , und Spiel abgeschlossen auf Normal von Anfang an bis Ende , ein paar Erfolge sind noch Ã¼brig die kommen auch noch.


Eine ErklÃ¤rung zur Nummer im Namen , sah das Spiel "Epic Battle Fantasy 4" in Steam gefiel mir gut aber ich Kaufe alles nur mit Rabatt nicht jeder ist reich und kann alles immer zu Vollpreis Kaufen , dann kam es irgend wann mal in einen Bundle wo dieses und auch andere Spiele noch waren , und Kaufte das Bundle , fing mit Spielen an , bevor ich am Ende ankam sah ich noch nach gibt es den noch einen VorgÃ¤nger da es immer wieder mal was so angedeutet wurde das da noch ein Teil davor geben kÃ¶nnte , und ja es gibt noch einen aber mit 3 im Namen , also und das Spiel gefÃ¤llt mir auch , und wo ist 1 und 2 und dann fiel mir auf in 3 sind 3 Charakter und in 4 genau diese Zahl auch an Charakter , und jetzt wo es 5 im Namen gibt wo es 5 Charakter gibt ist es klar die Zahl bezieht sich rein auf die Charakter.

"Epic Battle Fantasy 3" , "Epic Battle Fantasy 4" , "Epic Battle Fantasy 5"

Es ist bei dieses Spiel im Gegensatz zu anderen eher schwer zu Schreiben wie gut oder schlecht etwas ist , bisher viel mir so eigentlich nicht negatives auf , und es ist verstÃ¤ndlicher fÃ¼r mich da es Deutsch gibt..

Aber man kann ja auch "Epic Battle Fantasy 3" mal Spielen , das auch Kostenlos ist , um zu sehen wie das einen gefÃ¤llt , auch wenn es Englisch ist , wenn einen der Teil gefÃ¤llt dann sollte einen "Epic Battle Fantasy 4" und "Epic Battle Fantasy 5" gefallen.

Also von mir her gefallen mir diese Spiele sehr Gut.

review:
This game was everything I was searching for. Simple rpg where you can
- Upgrade your characters (no limit)
- Has healing abilities (i want to say sort of support role, but at the end they all do so much dmg haha)

- Good simple skills system
- Easy to follow story line

Amazing game, great replayability.
10/10 would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162368960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1537343063}
review:
Â¿Buscas un juego verdaderamente difÃ­cil, en donde cada batalla sea un reto por sÃ­ misma, lleno de secretos, armas, crafting, habilidades y bosses que te pondrÃ¡n a sudar? EstÃ¡s en el lugar correcto.
Que no te engaÃ±e su aspecto de juego Flash: es un RPG en toda regla, adictivo, divertido y con mucho, mucho reto. Tiene una innumerable cantidad de objetos coleccionables, entre armas, medallas, Ã­tems de stats, etc. 
Es un tÃ­pico juego de combates por turnos, en donde el tipo elemental es crucial, tienes a una ranger, un tanque, una healer etc. Nada muy nuevo en ese aspecto, las armas y armaduras se forjan, usas AP para subir habilidades y todo eso. 
La dificultad nunca es injusta, no te hace rabiar ni nada, y no son batallas realmente azarosas: si pierdes, es culpa tuya. 
El juego es una parodia de los RPG convencionales, lleno de referencias a la cultura popular y easter eggs, rompiendo todo el rato la cuarta pared y con diseÃ±os de personajes graciosamente ridÃ­culos y kawaii. De hecho todo en el juego intenta ser ridÃ­culo: invocas a un gato llamado Sin Patas, usas Lays y Monsters para subir tus stats y el HP, atacas con una guitarra Gibson, puedes usar una tr*fuerza y un p*kachu... 
Todo el ambiente parÃ³dico no le quita la buena jugabilidad y el continuo reto que representa el juego, mÃ¡s si lo intentas en dificultades avanzadas. Dale una oportunidad.


Pros: 
-Mucho reto y mucha estrategia en cada batalla.
-Crafting, habilidades, muchas armas y armaduras. 
-Batallas opcionales (no encuentros aleatorios).
-DiseÃ±os muy lindos y requisitos mÃ­nimos para jugarlo.
-Mundos temÃ¡ticos. 
-Aprox. 20 horas de juego, que por el precio no estÃ¡ mal.
-Post-game.
-El boss final no te va a decepcionar. EstÃ¡ tremendo.
-Juego en espaÃ±ol, un espaÃ±ol absolutamente neutro y sin regionalismos de EspaÃ±a (Â¡uf!).

Cons:
-A veces el humor es un poco bobo/clichÃ© (los personajes intentan emular al otaku estereotÃ­pico).
-Mucho diÃ¡logo basado en chistes sexistas (excesivo humor de pechos, Natz es sÃ³lo un fanservice sexoso, etc), aunque un pelo mÃ¡s moderado que EBF3.
-Misiones que consisten en llevarle a un NPC ciertos objetos y ya.
-Historia mÃ¡s bien absurda. 


PD. Es el "4", pero honestamente no necesitas haber jugado ninguno de los anteriores (Ã©ste tambiÃ©n fue mi primer EPF), le pescas enseguida el rollo e igual tampoco es que tenga un amplio lore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124256299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3630, 'last_played': 1585623031}
review:
Are you tired of RPGs taking themselves too seriously? Are you tired of so many over-the-top designs and intense artwork for everything? Are you in the mood for a game that makes you feel like a kid again because of all its humor, its art style, and general feel? Do you want to play an RPG game where the battle mechanics work really well, and upgrading equipment and special moves and such isn't too much of a hassle? How about an RPG with a well designed overworld filled with enemies, beatiful assets and puzzles.  How about a brilliant extra area to test your skills and such after you've progressed through the game a bit?  Or better yet, how about tons of equipment and attacks that reference some other nice games out there?
Or do you wanna just stare at the wizard's boobs the entire game?  I don't judge.
If you've answered yes to a couple of these questions, this game is for you.
Brilliant music, a fair price, a lovely art style, and honestly there's quite a bit of replay value with the multiple difficulty settings, allocation of specials, the extras area...so on and so forth.
Also the characters in this game are so damn hilarious.  Trust me, unless you're a speed runner, you won't wanna skip a single cutscene, or bit of dialouge.  Unless you've already seen it a hundred times.
And if you can't be bothered to care about all that, there are two girls in the game you can play dress up with.  Make em cowgirls, nuns, whatever the game gives you.  There's also two guys for that as well, if you're into that sort of thing.
10/10 I love this game.  And I will probably love the 5th game two.  So...stop reading this review and buy the game already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015890349', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1546728491}
review: Matt Roszak's latest creation, so far. But EBF5 is on the way. It's promising on it's trailer, just as how great EBF4 has become years ago. I like the series eversince I played it's first game online on a random flash game website around 2010. Rich in humour and adventure. It has a complete story with Matt and Natalie at the beginning of the franchise. The monsters and bosses are really challenging depending on what difficulty you play. Additionally, the franchise gets new characters, equips, items, skills on each new episode of the series. It has the cute, creative, cartoonish factor and some unbelievably odd pets like No Legs which is unique to the game and it's genre. I recommend you to at least, support the developer with payment for what he provided to all of us till now. The price of this product is natural and worth to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847074624', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1627, 'last_played': 1567975750}
review:
Me gusta, es un juego RPG de aventura que conozco desde su versiÃ³n web y he llegado a jugar las 4 sagas de la serie EBF a excepciÃ³n de sus spin-offs.

El juego es bastante bueno y entretenido. La mÃºsica es maravillosa y la jugabilidad estÃ¡ muy bien hecha. Las habilidades y hechizos son geniales. los objetos y el diseÃ±o de los equipamientos son variados. El arte de fondo y de las cinemÃ¡ticas es muy lindo y el diseÃ±o de los enemigos es original. El juego te ofrece la libertad de explorar el mundo y descubrir todos sus secretos, ademÃ¡s estÃ¡ lleno de referencias a videojuegos y anime.

No es perfecto, la trama puede ser divertida, pero no es la mejor del mundo y carece de un buen desarrollo de personajes por lo que difÃ­cilmente puedes encariÃ±arte con los protagonistas, aunque no por eso deja de ser una historia interesante y entretenida. El humor estÃ¡ presente en todas las lÃ­neas de dialogo de los personajes y sin duda te sacara mÃ¡s de una risa.[

TambiÃ©n tiene muchos logros, estos no influyen en la jugabilidad, pero te motivan a continuar con la aventura y pondrÃ¡n aprueba tus habilidades como jugador, los jefes pueden representar un verdadero desafÃ­o dependiendo de la dificultad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009486712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1598, 'last_played': 1533013194}
review:
I'm not into indie stuff really, but this is actually a surprisingly amusing game. 

It's no secret that the story is a bit weak, but the story that's there I actually enjoyed. The combat mechanics were really fun, outside of the way the 4th player is implemented... I found that a bit awkward, and spent most of the game ignoring one party member. It was playable that way, but I'd have prefered an easy way to use everyone without constant member swaps. 

Still. I definitely had good fun for my dollar on this. I think the one before this in the series is free (or used to be, at least). The game changed up a bit between this and that, but check out the free one if you're unsure. I suspect you'll enjoy it enough you'll want to grab this one after.

5 is coming out shortly now, and I'm totally ready for it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145307099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1869, 'last_played': 1710312728}
review: Having played this game when it first came out as a free flash game online years ago, I was unsure if I should pay $12 for this.  After purchasing it, I was blown away all over again. The combination of all the premium content being included,  as well as the soundtrack as a free addon, made it one of the best purchases I've made on Steam. The writing is absolutely hilarious, the graphics and environments are stunning, and the music is in a league of it's own. If you're unsure whether to buy this, give the third game a try. It's free on Steam, and this game only adds to the greatness of the third.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007611823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1889, 'last_played': 1561905869}
review:
the battle sytem is quite reasonable, and you don't need to spend too much time on fighting monsters.
the background music of each kind of scene are also very distinctive, some kind of brainwashing (in the good meaning) :D
the graphic style seems a little non-mainstream of these year, but also quite cute, and most of the monster characters are lovely.
also the story is quite interesting, and the English language is very easy to understand.

overall, it is rather good a game and worth playing for players of all ages.

not sure if the developper ever considered of launching Chinese & Japanese versions.
it they have interest, I'd like and that will be a great pleasure to help them on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080267493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1301, 'last_played': 1533694870}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 takes what was great about 3, brings it over and pretties it up, then adds in even more great content. It's another worthy sequel in a fine indie series, and I would happily recommend the new one to anyone - even the paid version.

If you missed the others in the series, Epic Battle Fantasy is a JRPG series in the vein of the old Final Fantasies, but with much more streamlined gameplay, a flash graphics systems, and dialogue that will keep you coming back for the laughs. Changes-wise from the other games, you gain access to quite a few spells that the players normally only gained through items, you get a fourth character (that unfortunately needs to tag in with one of the other three), and the story/areas are somewhat longer. There are many more secrets, enemies, and limit breakers, and it all works great.

The game, even though it doesn't keep the music from the last one, still keeps many of the elements: art style is still the same anime-esque (there's a fun word to use at parties) one, and characters return. The script is hilarious all around, and is not afraid of taking shots at other series, or even itself.

EBF4 is a worthy sequel to the series, adding onto the already great portions of the series with new and expansive content. It has secrets galore, and generally great quality for such a small budget series. Support the little guy! 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042586930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1531883519}
review:
Game's highest resolution is < 1080p.  Enough said.  It also runs very jittery/laggy which is ludicrous given my specs and other games which run fine.  I got about 15 minutes into it, and it broke the 4th wall like 5 times already.  I get it, geezus.  You're self-aware.  Also there's no voice acting at all from what I could tell, so you might as well sit down and read a book for 20 some-odd hours that it advertises.  

I do not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113881719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1504803518}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4

Overview
This game is simply a parody of JRPG plots. It represents the unoriginal fan-service, defeat the bad guys using characters that are flawed and often a nuisance. Nonetheless, it was enjoyable. I played the game on hard until the very end when I faced the final bosses; had to turn it off due to the ridiculous one-shots that were happening. I surmise that too is reminiscent of JRPGâ€™s that have ridiculous spikes when you play in hard mode.

I further want to give appreciation for references to well-liked anime characters. As mentioned at the end of the story, characters needed further development in order to get an idea of their backgrounds BUT, this is exactly what the developers wanted to highlight. 

Overall, the game is enjoyable. Lemme just check how much I paid for it to see if the price was rightâ€¦..
I got it on sale when it was $3.95. The $12.00 that they are asking for is ridiculously high for what the game offers, I would recommend the purchase if it is on sale.

Happy playing
MoonlightQuerida

La Suite directe d'Epic Battle Fantasy 3 oÃ¹ on dÃ©couvre un nouveau personnage jouable, l'archÃ¨re Anna!
Comme le prÃ©cÃ©dent opus, il s'agit d'un RPG classique Ã  l'humour omniprÃ©sent, que ce soit dant le chara-design, les dialogues, les succÃ¨s steam (oui, moi aussi j'ai molestÃ© un poulet ou mÃªme plusieurs, dans ce jeu) ou l'histoire elle-mÃªme.
Jouable au clavier et Ã  la souris, ou Ã  la souris uniquement (merci!!!!!), disponible en FranÃ§ais, Anglais, Allemand, Espagnol ou Portugais du BrÃ©sil. Et, de plus, la musique est encore meilleure que dans le prÃ©cÃ©dent... mais il est pas gratuit...
Je recommande car il est encore meilleur que le 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104732194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1702, 'last_played': 1710178410}
review:
in short this game is FUN, not too short not too long, aestheticaly beautifull and replayable.
It brings to mind the oldschool Final Fantasy rpgs. Lots of diferent gear, lots of enemies, lots of bosses. There is depth if you  wanna dig deep and crunch numbers at gear/ equipment and enemy resists, but you can also enjoy it by mindlessly smashing creeps. Game works both ways.
i think i;ve played the whole bunch of this series at armor games. I enjoyed every one of them. I can't wait for 5.
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018567646', 'num_games_owned': 5344, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1490764251}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080596499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4920, 'last_played': 1710357767}
review:
10/10 ~~ I find myself coming back to this game way too often.

Fantastic game, with challenging encounters and great replayability to try all sorts of silly builds, plus the dialog does not get old (mostly because there is so much of it, you are unlikely to remember all of them in the first 100 runs), for this alone I think most JRPG fans will be more than pleased.

Another great thing about this game is the soundtrack, they are all made by Phyrnna a literal angel of music, you can check the song "Under My Skin" or my personal favorite "Wings" if you don't believe me.

The Con I have is that once you learn resurrection management the "New Game Plus" and "New Game PlusPlus" loses its edge because playing the optimal build gets mechanical. So unless you are into speed runs playing for massive pwnege is only exciting once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049427471', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1575019430}
review:
Started as a dumb game about a healer with big boobs on Newgrounds, ended up as a self aware parody of the turnbased party RPG genre with genuinely enjoyable gameplay framed by an amusing story about ancient cat gods.

Also, there's an achievement for clicking the healer's boobs a bunch. So, y'know. Same game as the first one really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168852540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1733, 'last_played': 1588829975}
review:
I love this game. Completed the browser version on Epic difficulty 3 times. It's just wonderful.
The soundtrack made by The Great Angel of Musical Instrument Phyrrna.
Great story.
Lots of equipment that you often swap to counter enemy.
Touching Natalia chest will get you an achievement.
Collecting panties for achievement or someone's quest.
Matt Rozsak is a great guy, made a great game. 
Love how the world is connected.
If you hesitate, you can go check Epic Battle Fantasy 3 free on steam, or go to Armour Games and play the browser version of Epic Battle Fantasy 4.
I love this game, i love the soundtrack, i love the story, i love everything this game has. Buy, yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 2005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2005, 'last_played': 1486409571}
review:
[h1] Game Summary: [/h1] 
Starting off, for any who might have reservations about trying this game out, you can always play the game before this one, Epic Battle Fantasy 3, for free on Steam.  It's like playing a demo, but better.  Earlier titles than that can be found on game-hosting websites, where this series all started out in the first place.  It's been years since I've played them, but from what I can recall, the earlier games play pretty similarly to this one.  I suppose that'd be for you to determine if that's good or bad, but I've found enjoyment from them.  


[h1] Pros: [/h1] 
â€¢	Considering the basic graphics for the game, there's a urprising amount of content and playtime.  I'm very surprised I've played this for more than 30 hours.  I'd also admit that the same can be said for the difficulty, as this game will chew you up and spit you out, if you try the hardest difficulty unprepared.
â€¢	The game makes references and utilizes elements from popular RPGs.  The Final Fantasy limit break is a simple example.  Pulling in various ideas and throwing them together won't always work out, but it blends together well in this game.  
â€¢	The game has a wide assortment of equipment to level up, all of which grant specific effects and benefits.  Characters also have several spells and special abilities to unlock and level up, granting a decent degree of customization.  
â€¢	I appreciate the light-hearted, none too serious tone.  Whether you LOL or not is another matter.
â€¢	Included with the main story mode are enemy and boss rush modes.


[h1] Cons: [/h1] 
â€¢	One thing I dislike about leveling up the abilities and skills is that the game is designed so that many of these can be applied to more than one character, but only one character can learn it.  It makes balancing your party more time-consuming and cumbersome, when that's already quite the task.  The customization is nice, but each character being pre-designed and balanced would have resolved this.  It would be less flexible, but since each character has their own style and motif, I think it'd be more fitting overall.
â€¢	There's a considerable amount of equipment shuffling necessary with all the various elements, enemy types, and weaknesses in order to maximize damage and ensure you aren't killed off easily.  This isn't as necessary on easier difficulties and when battling weaklings, but changing out your equipment frequently is essential on higher difficulties and for boss fights.
â€¢	Since the story-line added an additional character, increasing the party from three to four, it'd have been nice to fight with four people instead of only three.  The game would have to be rebalanced completely, but it'd have been a nice upgrade from the previous games.  
â€¢	The game is designed with the mindset that you would play through the entire game three times.  This seems like overkill to me, especially since nothing significant changes with subsequent playthroughs.


[h1] Conclusion: [/h1] 
Frankly, there's too much well-made content in the game, with signs that a significant amount of effort was put into the process, for me to dislike this game.  I do think it suffers from some unfortunate design choices, but there's no fatal flaws that ruin the experience, only make it less than ideal.  These mainly revolve around increasing the time needed to do things, such as having to swap equipment around to deal with a specific enemy type from one battle to the next.  The fifth game in the series has been released, and it seems like a worthwhile sequel to this title.  Eventually I'll get around to it, and I'm hoping it'll be just as epic as this one, if not more so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082870002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6252, 'last_played': 1562045498}
review: Do NOT judge a book by it's cover...while it may seem like a kid's RPG, it has way more to it then that. With colorful visuals, a good sense of humor, and a HUGE amount of ways to customize everyone to fit your needs and playstyle, this is one RPG that i can truly recommend playing. I even have a video or 2 on this game on my youtube channel and i plan to stream it soon in the future. Trust me when I say, this is one RPG I am sure you will enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996568862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1527212767}
review: This game clearly was never meant to be a retail release.  It starts out with no tutorial and drops you into a screen with four characters and no direction.  You'll learn which is yours fairly quickly when you click somewhere and one moves, but the game explains itself poorly enough that I found the bonus challenge zone before I found the main story.  It also has a horrible menu system that displays a lot of things in a poorly organized manner and won't tell you what your equiment's stats do.  In addition to this the menus didn't even seem to be consistent, with me finding permanent stat buff items in the consumables folder instead of the permanent stat buff item folder.  As far as combat goes, I couldn't say as I quit before I reached any.  If I were to say anything positive, it would be that the music seemed like it might be decent if I spent more time on the game, but I don't plan to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054048330', 'num_games_owned': 2263, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1644, 'last_played': 1526102133}
review:
A surprisongly great RPG experience. EBF4 offers a satisfying JRPG experience that should be accessible to most players. Design choices are all logical and the game progresses quickly enough to keep you engaged. 

Developing your charecters is done in two main ways, upgrading skills and equipment. Both tasks are easy to understand and getting yourself geared up for battles/dungeons is never a chore.

The graphics are very colourful and other than an occasional adult bewb joke, the whole experience is pretty kid friendly. I was put off slightly by the charecter design of humans, which looks a little cheap to me, but once I got over this I had an absolute blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087343874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1522081695}
review:
You can explore intricately crafted map in search of treasures. You can play it casually with disregard to any expectations it has for you.  You can beset NPCs for their stories or side quests. You can master it and complete all the challenges. Or you can sit in front of a clickable object, switch your party members and laugh as they crack jokes and generally have fun, as I did. But no matter what your approach is, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is cute and fun game you can play to unwind after a long day.

Aside from perfectly balanced fighting system or challenging difficulty curve (starts easy, gets harder), or even the exploration, or unlocking new gear, the biggest asset it can offer is pure fun and atmosphere of the childhood times when [b]You[/b] spent all your days outside with your friends throwing fireballs, fighting dragons or capturing enemy bases. And coming home after all this fun with not a single care in the world. 

Ok, let's get to some serious reviewing. EBF4 is rather simple game with much depth to it. Letâ€™s see to the most prominent aspects of the game.

[h1]The fighting system[/h1]
Molded into a fashion of a JRPGs (if you are not familiar with this term, think of games like Final Fantasy VII or, my personal favorite, Child of Light; if this still does not ring any bells, think of a game where fighters stand in two rows facing each other and take actions in turns, but do not change their position), fights base on very simple principle of being resistant to certain attacks and susceptible to others. It is playerâ€™s task to figure out what attack suits best. Fights get progressively harder as enemies and characters unlock new skills and gear. Nature of every opponent is indicated by its distinct look and behavior, so, even without scanning them with skill, it is fairly easy to figure out the tactics. 

[h1]The difficulty[/h1]
Perfectly balanced. At the beginning I was worried, that the game will not be challenging enough. But as the story progressed, I found myself looking for new tactics, testing most effective skills combination and buying items that would give me advantage in combat. At the end I even felt that the game is too hard. I did not kill the last boss, but that was rather because of the accumulation of real-life events, than its actual difficulty.

[h1]The story and the characters[/h1]
Story is rather simple, but it is only an excuse to present interactions between main heroes. With distinct personalities they are both likable and fit the game perfectly. All in all the game maintains the atmosphere of a pen-and-paper RPG session, with characters being aware they are inside the game, which adds another layer of meta-humor to their jokes. I must admit that I anticipated with restlessness every piece of dialog between fights. There are some lewd jokes but not even once do they cross the point of bad taste.

[h1]The World[/h1]
When I have first seen the map, my only thought was: wow, thatâ€™s small. But in fact it is incredibly well designed. It encourages exploring, there are secrets hidden all around and the right amount of back-tracking makes the game all the more so entertaining.

[h1]The art style[/h1]
Cutscenes are the cutest thing I have seen, maybe ever. The overall art style is pleasing and coherent.

Ok, thatâ€™s it for this review. If you donâ€™t feel convinced, let me tell you one last thing. You can click on boobs. We need that in more games :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198141655958', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1526904802}
review:
Un maravilloso juego de nuestro querido Matt Roszak, jugue la versiÃ³n gratuita en su momento y no llegue a acabar el juego (guarde una nueva partida encima sin querer) y he disfrutado cada minuto de juego. Combate por turnos con una gran cantidad de habilidades, armas y trajes; una historia que, si es cierto que no brilla por ser espectacular, pero que no se hace pesada ni aburrida. Personajes muy carismaticos, tanto los protagonistas Matt y Natalie como nuestro amado Lance que se nos une en EBF3 y nuestra nueva compaÃ±era Anna. 
Te reiras con cada referencia y pullas al mundo y las roturas de la 4a pared que hacen los NPC (recomendadisimo leer cada una de las conversaciones). Muy recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561198261171187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1747, 'last_played': 1541733167}
review:
For a game that makes fun of itself and has a ton of references and little easter eggs to other, more popular games and series, I would highly recommend this game because of how much honest fun there is to have. You can customize your party by giving certain skills to one character, and the amount of strategy you can find in what could otherwise be simple cookie-cutter battles is fascinating.

I was already a fan of Matt Rozniks work from playing both of his major epic battle fantasy games (as well as his bullet hell series), and I'm glad that I got to support his work by purchasing this game on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960868941', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5166, 'last_played': 1524856607}
review:
This game is a great way to relive traditional RPG gameplay.

You can pick it up, play for a few hours, put it down for a week and come back to it still knowing what's happening and where you are headed next.

The encounters are challenging later in the game and that forces you to think before simply attacking. 

I've sunk many hours into this game and I feel like it's been well worth the time investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137974703', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1638892545}
review:
I've been a fan of the series since I discovered EBF3  a few years ago. And while that part was great this game has improved alot on that foundation.  After I played through the free version (avaible on most gaming websites and easy to find) I figured it was time to buy the game and support the creator. 
Core of the game is clearly the combat system, which allows many strategies thanks to the amount of learn-/findable skills and the elemental system. 
The bonus content (additional area called battle mountain which allows fighting stronger versions of the campaigns bosses and even new bosses, while also providing new equipment) that is exclusive to the steam release is nice and offers a lot of fun and more experimentation with the fighting system, but the NG+ really feels to add more. While on your first playthrough you are handicapped in the way that you always need a specific skillset and have to focus your resources on getting it, on your second and third playthrough you are free to use advanced combos or experiment, while enemies continue being a challenge thanks to being scaled to your level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139870067', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1522701379}
review:
A rant of a lore lover freak, ignore it if you dont care about characters as strongly as me.
[spoiler] As someone who 100% enjoyed EBF3 (ill play EBF2 soon) i just cant stand having 4 characters on a party but just using 3 on combat. I dont care about balance, i dont care about strategy (buth instant KO all party wipeout atacks!!), i just simply CANNOT ignore the fact that the game throws a new character at me and now it forces me to choose between 3 beloved characters and another new one. 
As someone who loves stories and characters its painful for me to choose wich ones will i play. Will Matt be left on the bench forever? No, he is a cool dude with a sword. Will this Natalie that is different to EBF3 Natalie left behind? No, she is OG magician girl. Will Lance be on backup? No, he has GUNS and he is badass. So?
What should i do then?

Forcing a character choice because of limited slots is fine on some games like Fire Emblem. But on a game that puts so much focus on the characters like EBF forcing you to leave just 1? I would have even acepted a 2/2 division that would force me to play 4 characters.
But making me choose to ignore 1 character forever? That's mean. I will still recommend this game but this is a big pile of bs for me.	[/spoiler]

I recommend this game 100% as its an incredibly well made funny RPG (coming from someone who is really picky with RPG games).


[spoiler] P.D: [b]I left Natalie behind.[/b] I'll pretend that Akron killed her on the end of EBF3 and now she doesnt exist anymore.	
edit: I will need her revive later since i play on Hard. 
Well it's really sad that Lance sacrificed himself against Akron on the end of EBF3 to let Matt and Natalie live a happy life.
I guess he wasnt such a bad guy deep inside and he cared about his friends :D[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198332621937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10199, 'last_played': 1710070418}
review:
I loved EBF1-3 and this game didn't disappoint me either, so far this is my all-time favorite game. Can't wait for EBF5!

Although the story isn't very complex, I still think it makes the game interesting. Plus I love all the references for other fandoms and fourth wall breakings.

The logic of the game, the puzzles, quests are also great. The dozens of medals make it even more exciting and challenging, getting all of them is not easy.

The battles & completing quests require more strategy than in the previous games, I like that it became more complex.

The graphics are also good, I like this style, it suits this game.

review: This game was very entertaining and fun. I am skeptical about how much i love playing this game, though i don't regret playing it especially after the previous game. The story was exciting, challenging, and even hilarious. I would reccomend everyone to play this game including the ones that love RPG games like Final Fantasy or Chrono Trigger. If necessary, i would say you should play Epic Battle Fantasy 3 first before spending your money on this one so you can have a natural feel to the game, its controls, the characters, and the story (Do i need to mention its also free on steam?). I'm SO looking forward to the 5th game when it's launched.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374106505', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1657076622}
review: Despite it's look and yes I know it looks like a bad flash game (it originally was) you are looking at what I believe to be one of the single handedly greatest RPG games of alltime and yes I have played FF7. The game unlike a lot of other RPG games has great comedy appeal. With one scene being a full on conversation about one of the protaganist breast size and how they are the size they are. The final boss is a cat god for gods sake (no pun intended) I would like to make it known that anyone who plays this game WILL enjoy it, it has difficulty, comedy, and you get get use to it very fast 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198117704794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 7393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3411, 'last_played': 1637774369}
review:
This game is amazing in every way.

As for pros:
Its music is incredible, one of my favourite game soundtracks of all time and I still listen to it to this day.
Its art, while not as great as some of the other stuff that this game does, always does exactly what it tries to do.
The gameplay, holy crap the gameplay. As one of the best strategy games I've ever played period, its turn-based comat system is (while it doesn't do anything particularly original) really fun to play with and never seems to do anything wrong. 
All while being one of the deepest RPG combat systems I've known of.
The upgrades are some of the best managed I've seen in RPGs, having to decide what you want to do with the skill points and resources rather than just grind for ages and max everything instantly is something I love to see in this sort of game.
As for difficulty, the game is spot on. Having the four difficulties (easy, normal, hard and epic) is very nice, and Battle Mountain is a nice touch for true masochists (I have yet to beat it).
The game's story, while kind of simple, I love the thing about the cats, the characters are very fun, and its sense of humour is fantastic.
Small, largely unimportant things like UI and even the minigame on the language select screen all help the experience.

So now that I'm done bashing everything I love about the game into anyone patient enough to read it,

Here are the cons:
OHKO moves are dumb because using them relies solely on luck, so it always feels like a wasted turn or an unfair victory, and for enemies using them it's the same luck-based thing but there's also no way to outplay them.
 
And that's basically it!

In conclusion, absolute masterpiece turn-based RPG with a good learning curve and skill cap, very deep combat, good music and art and a fun sense of humour that does very little wrong that most RPGs typically would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150548649', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5205, 'last_played': 1694261583}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993567513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1518223576}
review:
A pretty casual/easygoing RPG with a good amount of things to collect and upgrade. Very shallow story, you just go from one area to the next but there are a lot of one liners/quips to keep things going along.

As a warning, the humor is occasionally random/edgy-for-no-reason. I didn't care for some crude/sexual humor, the use of the word ret*ded, and some other things. But at least it's in small doses (a line here and there) and it doesn't push too far into that territory.

The gameplay for me was like this:[list]
[*] Enter a screen.
[*] Search for a cursor change to see what is clickable (Loot isn't only hidden in chests; it's often in random objects).
[*] Battle enemies (which often block areas/treasure chests), collect loot (in the form of XP/gold/equipment/upgrade components/skill points), upgrade/unlock skills/equipment.
[*] Move to the next screen.[/list]

There are some mostly-optional pushing/sliding-block puzzles, the occassional switch/key puzzle and optional simple minigames. It's pretty obvious where you can backtrack for loot (for example, a rock blocking off a treasure chest that you can't break until later) so there's not a big amount of pressure to remember it all or write it all down.

If you play on harder difficulties (or if you don't like battling enough to where you're too strong for it to matter) the key thing is to pay attention to enemy elemental & status weaknesses/resistances and what they do to you. You collect a bunch of equipment & skills that have elemental/status damage and resists so picking the right skills & equipment make the battles that much easier.

As a side note, Epic Battle Fantasy 1-4 were released free on flash websites and EBF3 is also free on Steam. I probably played the first one/two on Newgrounds but remember nothing about them.

You can play the free version of EBF4 (which has the base story but lacks end/post-game content like NG+/Boss Rush/Survival, a side area supplementing the game (Battle Mountain), and other things) as a demo to figure out if you'll like this game. It's available on flash sites like Kongregate/Newgrounds/Armor Games and you can manually transfer over the save file to the Steam version but the Steam achievements won't be unlocked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044863558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8888, 'last_played': 1561720030}
review:
If you are a fan of classic, turn-based JRPG games like Final Fantasy and Golden Sun, then you cannot go wrong with purchasing this game!
It features pretty much all the desirable aspects the genre has to offer, whilst perfecting them with a strong sense of balance and diversity, as well as a very approachable selection of difficulty modes.

[h1]Presentation:[/h1]

Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is light-hearted RPG with a great variety of environments, equips, abilities, mechanics and enemies to fight.
Throughout the adventure you will be playing with a party of 4 characters:

- Matt, the warrior, focused on endurance and in powerful, single-target, physical moves;
- Natalie, the mage, who wields a great variety of spells, both offensive and defensive;
- Lance, the gunner, a mixed attacker, more focused on defeating mobs of enemies;
- and Anna, the archer, a mixed attacker as well, being more inclined towards physical moves and status effects.

As you play, you will explore many areas, fight lots of increasingly strong foes, collect equips and learn new skills.
Along the way, there will be frequent and comedic interactions between the characters, that break up the action pretty nicely.
There are also interactions like that even during battle.

That being said, however, the dialogue sometimes uses "internet" dialect and references memes or outdated topics (there is even an Occupy Wall Street joke in it!). Fortunately, this doesn't come up too often, so, even if you do not appreciate it, this should [b]NOT[/b] be a reason to not play this game.

[h1]Gameplay and Difficulty:[/h1]

There is a big variety of weapons, armor, skills and summons to collect and upgrade. The progression system was balanced so that nearly every ability and piece of equipment is perfectly usable even in late game areas.
During battle, you will always have 3 of the 4 characters at the front, but you can switch in the backup character at every moment. Along with the ability to choose the order your characters attack, you have lots of freedom in terms of strategy.

You are given 4 difficulty modes to choose from and you can change at any time outside of battle. The game defaults to "Normal", but I reccomend switching to "Hard" on your first playthrough before deciding which mode is right for you.
"Epic" mode requires good knowledge of game mechanics and enemy behaviour in order to beat, so I don't recommend it on your first playthrough.

[h1]Visuals and Soundtrack:[/h1]

The visuals are good-looking. Not particularly impressive, but it's nice how every enemy and battle background in the game is fully animated.
The EBF series' art-style is heavily inspired by anime, but it has it's own unique appearence, without trying to copy the typical anime aesthetics.

The OST is the one aspect that wasn't made by Matt Roszak, but by independent composer, [url=https://www.youtube.com/user/HalcyonicFalconX]Phyrnna[/url]. These songs are nice and catchy, and I recommend checking them out, even if you end up not buying the game.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]

There are a few small things that I want to point out:
- The game plays at 30FPS, but it's turn-based, so who cares.
- The game's performance isn't well optimized. My PC is far from being a high-end one, but I get some weird frame drops if there are more than 3 enemies on-screen, without even playing on max settings.
- No pause feature (my biggest gripe). Not a problem if you are playing the browser version, but I don't like having my games keep running whennever I get interrupted.
- The menus are ratter cluttered, although this should stop being a problem once the player gets used to it.

As you can see, my complaints are very minor, because the quality of the core game is just that good.

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]

As I mentioned before, this is a must play for any classic RPG fan, as well as a fine example of what modern turn-based RPGs should be like.
The gameplay keeps itself engaging and fun throughtout the whole experience, since the first town to what is one of my favourite final bosses in any game in the genre.
The game takes about 30+ hours to beat (depending on difficulty), with the optional area adding about another 15 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136450477', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1766, 'last_played': 1684790001}
review:
I had played this game on kongregate, looooooooooong ago...

STEAM SALE.

Okay, boys and girls, this is hands down - HANDS DOWN, I REPEAT - the best possible JRPG to be created in recent times. It has everything one could love: silly dialogues, annoying enemies, funny animations, did I say silly dialogues?

AND SLIMES. MANY. SLIMES.

I don't like to say 10/10 for RPG's, because it's mostly unfair, as I really love a nice good'ol classic JRPG, but damn....

This game is 9,9999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999 / 10

Why not perfect? BECAUSE DARK MONOLITHS STILL EXIST. GOD HELP US.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321735879', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 24149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3045, 'last_played': 1703823411}
review: As an avid fan of turn based RPGs, this is easily one of the best I can find on the market today. The music by Pyhrrna, an indie music developer, is legendary, The game is both very merciful and hardcore at the same time, allowing you to run away from battles at any time, (With some rare exceptions) but requires plenty of planning and of course, heavy strategy to beat most enemies on harder difficulties. The combat is complex and it lets you upgrade the characters how you see fit via equipment and skills, making each leg of your journey easier or harder depending on your decisions. I've never felt frustrated, confused or cheated at any point in the game. It has an easy to understand story line, and the popculture references are a nice touch, especially since this game was originally made from an indie flash game made by Matt Roszak. I can't wait to see what he has in store for EBF5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201106913', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1480, 'last_played': 1486063467}
review:
Si os gustan los JRPG, teneis que probarlo. Pilladlo en ofertas de Steam si no quereis pagar 10â‚¬, pero probadlo. 
Un juego con un humor, un juego que te saca una sonrisita con algÃºn comentario que hace cualquier personaje. Con cualquier easter egg el cual estÃ¡ lleno.Al principio la verdad que parece sencillo al igual que algo tonto el juego. Pero tiene muchas cosas que hacer, puedes ponerte a farmear para mejorar tu equipamiento, puedes explorar una zona anterior tras conseguir "X" item que te permite hacer "X" cosa en esa zona. 
Hay hechizos que me parecen Ãºnicos, los personajes son Ãºnicos e incluso un gatito que puedes invocar es Ãºnico. 
Hay momentos en el cual tienes que pensar contra que estas peleando y que puedes usar para contrarrestarlo. Equiparte "X" armadura, usando "X" hechizo. Esto viene muy bien para los bosses.

En general, un juego bueno, un muy buen rato y un juego que simplemente teneis que probarlo y darle una oportunidad.

Y si habeis probado los anteriores Epic Battle Fantasy en su dia en el navegador, este juego os va a traer buenos recuerdos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001400215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1453929962}
review:
When I started this game, I had really low expectations due to the art. I thought I'd just check it out so I could say I'd played it and then delete it.

Well, almost 30 hours later, and here I am... 

This game has a surprisingly great battle system, and the varied skill trees of all the characters give you a ton of options to make characters geared towards your playstyle. I found the combat to be at JUST the right level of challenging, too, where boss fights were tough and frustrating but that much rewarding to beat. 

The huge amount of customizable equipment offers great visual flair to the party, and the ridiculous costumes go perfectly with the joking tone of the game. 

More than anything else, this was just FUN. Once I started this game, I basically put everything else I was playing on pause until I beat this because the gameplay was so addictive.

Just a really solid, fun, light-hearted RPG. Definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054996447', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1514446540}
review:
(Tbh this is my first time writing a review so pardon me for any spelling/grammar errors and whatnot)

TL;DR this game is worth buying if you're into these kinds of things.
I mean, you can get turned into a slime, get eaten by a disgusting worm thing, whoop two feline God asses, destroy entire ecosystems, see cats with no legs and have the girls interact with lewd/hilarous situations. Also, Natz is overall best girl. Prove me wrong ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°)


                                                                            [ More under the cut here ]


I'll be honest with you, ever since I found the whole series, I was skeptical at first as to how they would play out. Quite surprisingly, I've fallen in love with it entirely, from the quirky antics that the group always gets themselves in, to the in-depth lore that the creator (Matt Roszak. Bless his soul) has put into. 

Gameplay wise, it would play out as what you would expect from an RPG-esque like game. Statuses, buffs, debuffs, elemental weakness, spell levelling and so forth. And with four different characters to play around with, though you can only have three of them at one go, it can get kind of hectic at times. Not to mention the plethora of equipment that each of them use. Despite the numerous spells/equipment and such, you can go whatever playstyle you like. From a brute dmg build to more of a casual runthrough. Though I recommend building around enemies weaknesses and strength on the higher difficulties cos they would be hitting you really hard. 

Design wise, I enjoy it. It's whacky, colourful and sets the theme of every location just nicely. The design that the creator used for the story is also very cute. The game doesn't take itself too seriously at times, given the numerous times the group would idly talk about. Heck, even the initial casts of some of the spells make it seem like they don't take things too seriously. And despite some small gripes about the group, they're all really well made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198434020200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1710544699}
review: Despite it not having very well developed characters or plot, Epic battle fantasy 4 is one of my favourite games. Why? The amount of strategy needed is amazing, with 10 elements and various buffs and debffs to take into consideration, making the gameplay well-developed rich, and deep. The music is amazing, too. The graphics arent anything special, but are decent. 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030792061', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1645, 'last_played': 1550250051}
review:
Un RPG que se rÃ­e de los RPGs.

Este juego es 100% mecÃ¡nica (mecÃ¡nica RPG, claro), es decir, su sistema de combate es complejo pero no difÃ­cil, su arbol de habilidades estÃ¡ equilibrado pero no exige que farmees exageradamente, y es 100% mecÃ¡nica porque todo lo demÃ¡s da igual.

A ver, que un juego en el que tus personajes dicen: "Â¿Por quÃ© estamos siguiendo a esta tipa?" y que 'esa tipa' responda:
"Salgo en la portada del juego, asÃ­ que debo ser la protagonista", deja muy claro por dÃ³nde van ir los tiros.
Un juego divertidÃ­simo para los amantes de los RPGs con multitud de referencias tan exageradas y ridÃ­culas que hacen gracia.

Y es que al final del dÃ­a, he de admitir que me lo he pasado muy bien con este juego e incluso, de alguna manera, me he sentido mal de que terminara...

author: {'steamid': '76561198061249750', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1512069874}
review:
Ohhhh, EBF. Playing this series is the best kind of nostalgia for middle school me. Flash games may be near-death nowadays, but I remember playing the second and third game in this series on Kongregate back in its heyday. 

The best way to describe EBF4 is that it's a love letter old school RPG's while creating it's own unique identity. While the humor is wildly dated now, and never the drawing point in the first place, what really makes me love this gem is the intricate combat systems and heavy-tactic battles that it's nailed time and time again. There are numerous skills, elements and systems built into this game, and for someone starting out fresh it can be a bit overwhelming. Overlooking a single system, such as changing your equipment for battle or forgetting to cast debuffs at the beginning can make or break later fights. This game has no definition of "cheese;" you earn your victories from beginning to end, because it's the enemies that are overpowered. There are confrontations in this game (specifically in the steam-exclusive challenge areas) that can take upwards of an hour to defeat, with a single misstep spelling defeat. It's thrilling, and a bit draining.

While it is called the fourth one, you do not need to play the first three to enjoy this one. The original games were definitely fun, but they are rough flash games that provided the basis for this one. This is the culmination of those games in it's own charming way, and it's improved in every possible light...except for the writing. Please be aware that the humor is insanely grating, childish and mind-numbingly sexist at certain points, but that is not where the value is. It is not a perfect game, and if you are looking for an RPG with any actual story, I highly doubt this will satisfy you. While the story structure isn't inherintly bad, and the paper cut out cutscenese a treat, the characters and general dialogue are filled with outdated memes and middle school level sex jokes that gave me the worst kind of nostalgia. If this is a dealbreaker, I completely understand.

As far as a game goes, however, there is some serious meat on this beast. I'm a bit irritated that steam does not keep hour logs when playing offline, but my play count for this is easily towards the 40-50 hour range. There are so many secrets and collectibles, with a varied, intricate vania-style unlock system that there is always new equipment and abilities to find and try out. Even after beating the game, I was still finding new secrets things, although my enjoyment had waned at this point. The artstyle is surprisingly cute, and there is an insane variety of enemies and bosses. I cannot emphasize enough how gratifying the challenge areas are, as they actualize everything you have learned to that point, and can be tackled at any time without reprocussion. The concept that the enemies scale to your level means it will always be difficult, but balanced if you go in with some forethought. 

All in all, this game has aged phenomenally well, aside from the elements previously mentioned. It's been almost five years and the new one is on it's way, so it was a treat to revisit. I will most definitely be trying out EBFV, but in the meantime, this game is absolutely worth playing. Keep an eye out for a sale is my best suggestion, or if you want to see if it's your cup of tea, the base version is still available to be played for free online. Hope this helped!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994799155', 'num_games_owned': 1534, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 1818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1579, 'last_played': 1512935851}
review: One of the best RPGs available on Steam. There is a wealth of content: a 20+ hour campaign; a huge number of enemy types, weapons, armour, accessories and skills that must be dynamically swapped at all times to stay on top of the enemies' weaknesses and resistances; for the first time in the series, you now control four players, allowing one to remain on the 'back bench' to be tagged in at any time, even replacing a downed ally; the story is light and full of silly references and humor - just the kind of thing we need these days, especially when a lot of other RPGs are going for the gritty, emotional stories (and you don't even need to have played previous games - though they're all free, and EBF3 is also on Steam, so you might as well); plus a save function in the menu and no random battles, so it's extremely easy to pick up and play for short--or long--amounts of time. Highly recommended - don't let the Flash graphics put you off, a LOT of work has gone into this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198124666706', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4041, 'last_played': 1541264018}
review:
I remember playing the first and second EBF when I was like 10 or something and oh boy those were some good times.
(I haven't played the fifth game so if you can give it to me I would be pretty happy, wink wink)

as for this game, well, the game HASN'T aged that well be it storywise or gameplaywise (I wouldn't say it's bad, it's good but it isn't as good as I remember) but the ost's still a banger tho.
the story is funny and quirky and so are the main characters but it isn't the best thing in the world by far.
the gameplay is just like your good old 16-bit rpg's without the ATB system so if you're a fan of those (like me) you'll probably have a good time.

overall 8.3/10 there's more references than the end of a wikipedia's article

review:
A fun RPG which goes between making you laugh your ass of and focusing hard to win a fight.
Played tons of hours in EBF 3 and im planning to do the same in EBF 4, though probably wont take as much time in this since im more used to the mechanics and such.
Its a quite cheap game considering what it gives, and when its on sale its almost a mustbuy.

I really recommend playing EBF 3 beforehand since it give more to the story.
But its good as a standalone title aswell.
Includes alot of achivements to grind and equipment to lvl up (tho the latter is quite easy achive)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027958747', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1558869529}
review:
Spent far too much time with this back on Newgrounds. Still holds up. Wouldn't say it's worth 11 euros because it's now a five year old free flash game, but at the 70% discount I got it at it is definitely a nice indie title. 

It's a JRPG-style game that isn't at all serious, by the way. Nothing unexpected in terms of mechanics, it does what you'd expect and does it competently. Typically not a fan of the style and humor but gameplay is so good it still hooked me.

Bought it to give a little back for the Newgrounds fun and support his efforts in EBF5, really.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041794514', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4443, 'last_played': 1620426997}
review:
If you like franchises like PokÃ©mon, Dragon Quest and Final Fantasy, you'll probably like this. 
It's a typical turn based JRPG. Move around, battle enemies, find loot etc.
But the EBF franchise is a surprisingly deep in combat at times, and some battles on "Hard" or "Epic" difficulty can actually be a challenge. So don't let the cute cartoon graphics fool you.
While the game can be quite hard on "Hard" or "Epic" difficulty, Easy and Normal also exist if you want a more relaxing or casual time. There's something to be had with both casuals and hardcore RPG fans.

Your party in EBF4 consists of 4 party members, and they all have various skills, equipments and weapons. Each focusing on a different stat more than the other. Example:
Matt is the sword user with the highest physical damage and physical defense.
Natalie is the mage of the group and uses a variety of healing spells and magic attack, as she has the highest magic attack out of the group.
Lance is the gun wielder who plays a support role with minor healing and Dark & Bomb skills that the others lack.
Anna is also a support, and like Lance she performs minor healing aswell, difference being she has different type of support skills and she dishes out more Earth, Poison and Wind skills.

These are just minor examples to give you an idea how each character is different.
It's alot like the original Final Fantasy with how your team could consist of characters like Warrior, Black Mage, White Mage, Thief etc.

Each biome you come across are filled with different types of enemies and sometimes mini-bosses and at the end of the biome, a boss. All of these enemies and bosses have their respective elemental weaknesses and strengths, and status infliction weaknesses and resistence too.
Each biome also have hidden secrets like various loot and treasure chests that contain new weapons and such.

Both your party members and the enemies function the same way in terms of strengths and weaknesses. Obviously you have basic stats like Evade, Attack, Accuracy, HP etc. 
But depending what type of equipment you put on, including weapons, hats/helmets and outfits, you'll be giving yourself different sets of resistence or weaknesses.
Example: If you give a party member an electric type weapon, armor, pin and hat that boosts electric armor, then there's a chance your electric resistence is great depending on the percentage.
Here's how elemental resistence percentage works:
0% = Nothing special, normal damage taken.
+100% = No damage taken from said type of damage.
+Above 100% (such as 150%) = Healed from said damage type
Anything in the minus zone (-100% etc) = Weak towards it, avoid it.

Not trying to write a strategy guide here, but it IS quite in depth.

I've played all of the EBF installments, and I'm waiting anxiously for EBF5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048070670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1506952819}
review: This installment of EBF is just like the third one, you go around through different areas on a quest like a typical rpg collecting weapons, armor and getting people their much needed pizza in exchange for valuable materials. I think the music in the third game is much better, although there are a lot of new spells, armor, weapons and even a new character to play as. Give this game a try if you've never played any of the EBF games before, as you won't be disappointed!

review:
it's gud

For those wondering, "Why should I buy a flash game that I can play for free?", you get extra stuff. Also, you get to feel good about supporting a developer of a very nice game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970888298', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2558, 'last_played': 1628711609}
review:
First off let me say I may be a little more favrable to this game because I played the old ones on newgrounds years and years ago.
Now that that is out there, let's talk about the game.
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 brings you in to a world of slimes, dragons, and all kinds of wacky, fun, and down right challenging fights.
The game play is solid. A point and click where you want to go grid like system, turn base fights, and a pretty decent leveling system.
There are four characters in the game, but you can only have three in a battle at a time. The fourth one sits back as a back up in case one dies.
You can choose who you want as your back up at anytime in the game too.
I mostly found myself using three of the characters only, never switching the fourth one in to level him up.
Which is alright because if you are careful, you will only need the back up in emergencies.
The game has an incredibly silly story, that is over all fun to learn about.
So if you are looking for an alright length game that is pretty challenging at times, this is a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144332453', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5188, 'last_played': 1516086052}
review:
I first discovered Epic Battle Fantasy back in 2013, playing the first game on Armor Games. I was immediately hooked, and played through the first three on Armor Games. Not long after that, the fourth was released on Steam, and I bought it and loved it immediately. This turn-based game is one of my favorites and I will be following this series for a long while yet. 

There's also a fifth coming out. Check out kupogames dot com (the creator's webpage) to follow news and get some advance pictures and functions of the game.

review: EBF4 is an awesome turn based RPG. I've played every EBF since the first one (probably since newgrounds days), and it's been great every game since. This game invokes a sense of nostalgia in me and is definitely one of my favourite flash games to date. The story and characters takes a humorous approach and may not be for everyone. Though it's a fun, quirky, and fairly simple game. Highly recommend checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294806016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1519139967}
review: A very good game. Surprisingly well made, you can see the time and care that went into every single second of the game. An excellent but simple battle menu with nice skills and attacks unique to each character. With loads of equips to suit anyone's playstyle and situation. Despite being made in flash, it is very smooth and runs great with no issues. The characters are wonderfully made and I personally like their personalities. Though the humor can be funny at times, it's pretty hit or miss, so some of the jokes sorta land flat. The music is wonderful and fully suits the enviroments, plus the battle themes are pretty good too. All in all, a charming, near-flawless RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212231847', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1617066217}
review: This game is by far the best I've ever played. The first time I played this game I felt amazing just playing through the game from the first screen. I felt genuinly sad when I killed the final boss. Then I found the battle Mountain and that added a new and amazing challenge. This game is worth the 12 bucks I spent to get it. Highly recomend you guys play this game. Best RPG flash game/Steam game to ever exist.

review:
The gameplay is easy to understand, the soundtrack is decent and the graphics are amazing for a flash game.

The quests are not creative at all, one ommon idea for all quests. Moreover, the replay value is not worth it, only for the acheivements.

Overall, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a good RPG game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986527965', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 2895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2820, 'last_played': 1561578272}
review:
EBF4 is a great turn based RPG for people who are into gameplay over graphics.  The game's plot and dialogue are mostly there to be humorous.  Don't expect to see some intricate story or a bunch of character development.  The game's biggest strength lies in its deep combat mechanics.  The music is also pretty good as well.

The game starts with you in the first town and in control of the new main character for this game.  You'll eventually find the 3 other characters.  The map for the game takes place on a 10x10 grid.  The game consists of 3 towns, 5 main environments, a side environment, and a bonus environment that takes place off the grid called battle mountain.  You'll spend most of the game venturing through these areas killing enemies, fighting bosses, opening chests, and getting quests.  Each of the three towns contains a weapon/armor shop, forgeable item shop, and a health/status item shop.  Main environments contain enemies (all viewable) on a main path to that environment's boss that you will have to kill to get to it.  Once killed, these enemies stay dead forever.  Enemies off the main path usually guard chests and are optional to fight and respawn upon going to a new environment.  The side environment contains an optional boss and some items.  The battle mountain is a bonus area which contains all the enemies throughout the game, upgraded versions of each of the game's main bosses, and some unique bosses.  You get no exp/gold going through this area but do get item drops and access to unique equipment/skills.  All environments contain 1 or more quick travel points, so getting around quickly usually isn't an issue.  The game autosaves on every screen transition and can be saved manually any time outside of battle.

Each of the game's 4 characters have access to their own unique set of skills.  You'll be able to upgrade these throughout the game but unlike EBF3, you'll be unable to fully upgrade every skill by the endgame unless you feel like grinding, so you need to choose wisely when upgrading.  New to this game are equipable skills.  You'll find new skills (including limit breaks) throughout the game that 2-4 of the characters will be able to learn.  Once you attach that skill to a character, only that character will be able to use it unless you choose to have that character forget the skill (wasting spent skill points).  This allows you to give characters spell types that they normally don't have access to.  Each character can equip a weapon, armor, a hat, and 3 badges.  All equipment can be leveled up by forging.  Equipment works in a unique way.  Instead of giving simple stat upgrades, such as +30 attack, they instead give bonus multipliers to a character's base stats, such as multiplying health by 1.1, attack by 1.15, etc.  Each equipment gives different multipliers to different stats as well as different elemental/status defenses, and many of them have unique abilities attached to them such as automatically casting revive or dropping mammoths on your enemies.  This means that even your starting equipment can be just as viable to have on as something you find towards the end of the game.  What you want to equip will be based on what elements enemies are weak against, what elements/statuses you want to buff yourself against, what stats you want to buff, and what special abilities you like.  Badges are useful in covering weaknesses that your normal equipment didn't cover.  They do things such as give elemental/status resistances, special abilities, or buff stats.

The game has 4 difficulty settings that you're free to switch between throughout the game without any penalty.  I only played on epic difficulty (the hardest one) and I found the game to be very fair on it.  There was no point throughout the game where I had to grind levels at all to continue on, though I did have to skip 2 of the optional minibosses and come back to fight them later.  Combat with the regular enemies feels just right and the bosses are incredibly satisfying to beat, especially the more difficult upgraded versions on battle mountain and the final boss.  I got my ass handed to me several times, but changing up my equipment/strategy/tactics was enough to overcome any failures.  The only time I might recommend switching difficulties is when fighting the regular enemies on battle mountain.  These fights usually come in waves of 8-10 whereas normal battles are usually 1-3 waves.  I stayed on Epic throughout and some of those regular battles on battle mountain can take anywhere from 20-40 minutes to complete.  If you ever do feel a need to grind, you can always switch the difficulty to easy as enemies give the same XP no matter which difficulty you play on.

As for combat, there are plenty of enemies types and plenty of variations on those types, each feeling pretty different.  There are 10 elemental types and 12 status effects, so you can never cover everything.  Status effects and buffs/debuffs matter alot.  Bosses require both tactical and strategic planning.  You'll often find yourself in situations where you have to make meaningful decisions rather than just spamming the same moves over and over every round.  Combat animations are quick, so outside of limit breaks, you're not sitting around for 10 seconds watching characters cast spells or watching enemies dance around for no reason.  Characters can be swapped in/out during combat.  Only 3 of your 4 characters can fight at once.  I  wasn't sure I was going to like this as I thought it meant someone was going to get left out, but I grew to enjoy it.  All the characters are useful, so you will switch characters in and out based on various things.

I really don't have much of anything to complain about.  My biggest issues were occasional slowdown in some battles and I had the game freeze up twice, once halfway through the final boss which was real lemon timing.  Also, the spacesuit armor is pretty good but its special power can be annoying.  It calls in 'Scanbot' to scan enemies during battle and can activate multiple times over the course of a battle.  Once you've scanned an enemy, you retain its info permanently, so when it does it multiple times it's just wasting your time.

A great RPG, wish more of them were like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118823406', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1521562031}
review:
Really awesome game, a nice turn-based JRPG with a fair amount of strategy but not too much to make the game complicated, keeping in-line with its simple, clean interface. Also has a lot of witty dialogue.

I have a couple hundred more hours played online, so don't let me few hours on Steam decieve you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064054566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 3862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3836, 'last_played': 1548300106}
review:
Pros:
* Like the previous game, you can create all kinds of equipment setups to strategically defeat enemies. Characters also get three accessory slots this time, some of which have interesting effects like replacing weapon status effects.
* Some of the medals are more lenient this time around, especially the treasure hunting medals.
* Battle Mountain is a good way to test one's skills against equally leveled opponents.
* The skill system allows more element variety for the characters. For example, Matt can now learn thunder skills to take advantage of his Golden Dragon sword.
* The summon system adds more depth to the battle system, since it costs SP that's obtained from killing enemies.

Mixed:
* Like the previous games, the dialogue and story is funny, but not particularly deep. That said, the main antagonist of this game is more interesting than the previous one due to their motives.

Cons:
* There's currently a memory leak due to leftover status icons. The game has to be restarted every now and then to avoid crashes.
* No explanation is given for the party's level reset this time. Though Matt (the character) did mention that he didn't work out enough recently, which implies the old party is rusty.

Some features that would have been nice:
* Level scaled versions of the final boss and glitch boss.
* Resolutions that match Youtube's preferred pixel height.
* A backlog that records recent dialogue.
* A way to disable automatic attacks and counterattacks.

Tips:
* Finish Battle Mountain before fighting the final boss. Without the Battle Mountain equipment, the final boss is about as hard as the fourth boss rush. With that equipment, the final boss will be a lot easier to defend against.
* Take advantage of the tired and weaken statuses against bosses, since most of them have 50% resistance to normal stat lowering effects.
* Don't neglect stat items, since enemies gain more per level than the player otherwise. This is especially important in Battle Mountain, where enemies scale.
* For normal boss rush, beat the boss while they still have weak minions on the field. This will give you an opportunity to reequip and buff.
* Use the developer's kongregate guide to find treasures and secrets easily. http://www.kongregate.com/games/kupo707/epic-battle-fantasy-4-walkthrough
* When fighting the [spoiler]dark players[/spoiler], never take your eyes off the screen while a battle animation occurs. You need to keep an eye out for their limit break indication so you can be ready to defend with Ancient Monolith. On that note, never end your phase with an attack on them, since you could trigger their limit break before you can defend.
* You can't buy chilli sauce like with other rare items.
