author: {'steamid': '76561198068354211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3827, 'last_played': 1502752675}
review: This series of games has been a favorite of mine ever since I found them years ago on a flash game site. This game is more than just a simple RPG, it's an RPG that seems to be made of the entire internet, having references to things you enjoy every day, such as memes, bacon, angry feminists, and more! Honestly the intense boss battles are just bonuses to the great humor in the game and I cannot wait for a 5th Epic Battle Fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061272460', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1463809279}
review: I am more than happy to spend money on this game, it's overall a great game. Played it on Kongregate, got it on here. The combat is your standard turn based type, but this series is the only one that seems to do it right for me. Maybe it's the equipment system, maybe it's the way the skills are done, I don't know. I just know that it is fantastic. The story is kinda silly, and parody-ish, but it's funny and clever. For me, this game is in a similar class as Dust: AET.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081340622', 'num_games_owned': 5267, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 1583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1459781754}
review:
A game that doesn't look great but is rated 98% on Steam, uh..? Okay, let's try the Flash version... Ah, the agony, you have to point and click to move the character around, they're moving on a grid and you get ugly icons everywhere you point at... My, my. The character designs aren't exactly good... Okay, since these are both one-man projects, I'll at least say that it looks much better than Undertale. It also beats it in terms of laughs and overall complexity.
Really. It's absolutely hilarious, and also excrutiatingly overwhelming at the beginning of the game. Ah, those crafting materials...!

After an hour I decided to buy the Steam version, and couldn't stop playing it ever since. This is nothing like a RPG Maker game, it seems to use its very own engine (which, amusingly, is quite slow even on a high-end PC... Thankfully it's still playable). This has a lot of advantages.
It pays respects to its elders but never tries to be lazy about anything. My main complaint? It's a very difficult game... If you want to 100% it, you'll suffer. A lot. Be prepared to spend tens of hours on it. I'll just be happy with at least two thirds of the achievements. If you don't mind not getting everything, then... I get it's doable. But you'll still need to grind a lot, or use a money cheat to buy all of the items you need.

And this was my 42nd Steam review, a milestone for any self-respecting geek. Not my finest hour, though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055469309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 2236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1458769412}

author: {'steamid': '76561198128547625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3224, 'last_played': 1451007978}
review:
One of the best games in the EBF series for sure. It has everything I liked from EBF3 plus new stuff. I am definitely looking forward to playing EBF5. Don't forget to check out Bullet Heaven II; I haven't played it myself, but I've played the first one and I've seen all kinds of content & demos on DeviantArt so I'm 99% sure it is worth looking at (that is if you like Bullet H*ll genre games).
You should also look up his other games (and movies). You can find them on his [url=kupogames.com]webpage[/url] and you can also find them on [url=http://armorgames.com/user/Kupo707]Armorgames[/url], [url=http://www.kongregate.com/accounts/kupo707]Kongregate[/url], and [url=http://matt-likes-swords.newgrounds.com/]Newgrounds[/url]. You can also follow him on [url=kupogames.deviantart.com]DeviantArt[/url]. Great series!

author: {'steamid': '76561198272706412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1479160638}
review:
This game has to be one of my favorites, with its excellent soundtrack made by phyrnna, its extremely well stylized view, and its non-farming gameplay (On any difficulty other than The highest, which I've beaten on kongregate), this game is one of the best. 



Also props to Matt and Phyrnna for releasing this game with the soundtrack bieng for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030179694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 2261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1409, 'last_played': 1561549805}
review:
EBF 4 is a game about 3 kleptomanic heroes who accidentally endanger the entire world. Again.

This game features a very good artstyle, music and an excellent gameplay. 

The combat in this game is made in a early RPG fashion - 3 heroes out of the 4 available are in active combat and it's turnbased.

It also does feature a high degree of customization as you can select the combination of your party and some of their respective skills yourself.

So, for anyone out there who is a fan of good old RPG-fun ... I do recommend this game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084971140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1464243755}
review:
I was looking for a game to stray away from my action RPG binge in the last few weeks. I wanted something easy to play and comedic. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 was my pick.

This game concept is very interesting. It borrows a lot from the classical JRPGs of the old days, but it also adds its own flavor to the mix. The graphics are unique and are based on Flash animations, similar to lots of web games, which I loved.
The dialogue, and the battle system, is filled with humor, dark humor, internet humor, memes, references to classical JRPGs, etc.
This game was designed for internet-savvy audience to enjoy it. There is a lot to love about this game.

I never played the previous games in this series, however, I can not wait to see what is next. I am striving to have a 100% achievement score on this one. This feeling is similar to when I used to play Pokemon, and gotta catch'em all vibe, it was tedious to do yet fun and we wanted to do it. EBF4 is definitely in that category of games. Players will not only enjoy its humor and battle system, but also will enjoy being completionists.

I recommend this game to any RPG, JRPG, humor, internet, and anime fans. All of you will enjoy it.

P.S.
The "Pervert" achievement was the best!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970542273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1951, 'last_played': 1453982464}
review: Very pleasant game though I've yet to finish it. Combat is simple: choose attacks or spells, reorder your players, or change equipment. Weapon and equipment selection didn't matter much for me until the final area. Weapons and equipment are upgradeable so item drop become important. It features an area with difficult waves of enemies that don't provide experience, just items. Overall relaxing to play. This is the only one in the series I've played, so I don't know how it compares.

review: this game is fun and addictive when you are able to go to certain parts. battle mountain is hard but fun and it challanges those who are a weaker lvl. i've only played maybe ten hours and i'm only in the desert and jungle and my levels are all below 25 but higher than 20 and bosses and reg. monsters are getting smarter and harder. i love how you have to go back to previous areas and kill monsters for the items you need to upgrade your weapons and armor.      GREAT GAME!!! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198131108117', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2302, 'last_played': 1554752044}
review:
I played it through with "only" EPIC difficulty and it was quite nice to play a game like that again :)
With quite nice i meant it was hell to fight God Cats but after leveling 3 - 4 levels it was pretty okay .-.

I would say people that like RPG Turnbased fightings like in Final Fantasy should play this game :)
I played it on Kongregate and i felt like supporting Matt with his awesome creation

EBF5 confirmed, I hope its going to be out in this year :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198178280715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2335, 'last_played': 1467517275}
review: Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a fantastic RPG game that is very enjoyable for several reasons, of which include the large amount of customization that offers thousands of strategies, and the addition of destroying a whole lot of enemies. The aptly Battle Mountain contains battles that will test your strength, and reward you. I enjoy the series, and this installment is just about the very best so far, at least until Epic Battle Fantasy 5 comes out. If you enjoy a fun RPG game that isn't too serious, lots of ways to obliterate your foes and just a plain good time, this is the right game for you. Of course, the interface is not the easiest to navigate, and the lack of a tutorial is a bit messed-up, but before you try this game, you should try the Flash version of it, to see if you would want to spend money on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065757801', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1455734207}
review:
THIS GAME was one of the best memories of my childhood
wen i first saw it i could not buy it becaus i did not have enough money...
but i do now
i remember playing it on y8 it was a really fun game i was only allowd to play sertain levels and pre prepared items
so i could play a demo of it
and that was epic battle fantasy 3
i was looking all over the net for the fourth and i could not find it but here it is after a few years
im really happy to have found this and im not dissapointed on buying it its a really good game if you whant to hear my opinion
i still love this game and so should you 
ill give it a  9/10
the -1 is for taking sooooooooooooOOOOoo long to find it ;-;
enjoy the game :D

i love the part where every enemy is really cute in its own way (accept for the undead)
i like the idea of the item usag in this game and what i really love about the story is that they did not just kill the original old characters, they made them come back to this game with a new character and did it like pros
happy jewelry hunting i know i will

author: {'steamid': '76561198170706651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1534690443}
review:
Fun game. Continues the series. Same as the Flash game with the same name,

I have been playing this game for over 17 hours offline.

Pros:
- Great time killer.
- Gaming culture and fourth demension breaking gags everywhere.
- Interesting story.
- Some really odd quests...... women's underwear is a quest item.
- Got me to buy and play this game after I finished the Flash version.
- Great music.


Cons:
- Massive back track game, done somewhat well by restricting areas until the barriers are broken.
- A bit grindy sometimes. Take your time and bulk up.
- Music loops a bit too much in battle.
- Hard to think of cons for.
- Have I mentioned the back tracking? You have no idea do you?


Things to know:
- Most males will worship Nat, they will give all the buffs to her.
- Grind before obvious bosses.
- Go for normal skills over maxed out elemental skills.
- Save often.


Give it a go; combat wise it's better than Final Fantasy 13.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055172102', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1577, 'last_played': 1527518138}
review:
Well, this game is incredible. It shows what determined developer can do from little flash games. Third part was succes, but this one is even better and Kupo works currently on part 5. You don't need to play previous versions of the game (You can find them all on Kongregate), but it will help to understand some dialogues. Dialogues are super funny and filled with eastereggs. Like the whole game. I've lost count of how many easter eggs I've encountered. The story isn't complicated, it's funny and interesting. All game mechanics work great, every boss is well done and challenging (Especially on Epic difficulty, when you want to gain some achievements). If you aren't sure about buying this game, you can play it on Kongregate for free, but this one includes premium content (which is awesome) and supports the creators.

Also, take a note that only 2 people created that game, Kupo (Matt Roszak) as programist and Phyrnna (previously Halcyonic Falcon X / HFX) as musician.

I recommend this game for anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077708925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1469950841}

author: {'steamid': '76561198084395598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1451607371}
review:
A really fun, and funny game. I'm surprised by just how much I enjoyed this.
The skills are cool, and some are amusing (Like dropping a tank on top of your enemies), and I was playing simply to unlock more skills to see what they were like.

There isn't a lot of dialogue, and most of it's just random comments from the characters when you use new attacks are find something new, etc. Although not really bad in a game like this, it'd be better if there was more story to it, no matter how much seriousness said story lacks.

It's not all that difficult if you play on normal, most enemies are some kind of creature crossed with an element, and so have weaknesses, you get a scan bot that lets you see said weaknesses so honestly as long as you don't forget to keep your weapons and skills diverse you're going to be fine. Each area generally has a focus on one or two elements, so you can focus on those with your weapons as well.

The shop so far has been pretty pointless. I've not completed it yet, but I've literally only bought a few coffees from it before a boss, you don't really use items enough to use up the ones you find, and the weapons you find are generally good as well. Getting materials for crafting is simply a case of grinding as well.

Better quests would be good, it seems all the npc's just want food, even just a "kill n monsters" or something would keep it more interesting. Just going out and fighting is fun enough in itself though, so it's not really a big issue.

I feel like I've complained a bit about it, but despite everything I've said, the game is genuinly enjoyable, which is generally the biggest factor in a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036089174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3091, 'last_played': 1525807646}
review:
I played all of the previous Epic Battle Fantasies on Kongregate, and played through this one on Kongregate on Normal.
I still shucked out mo ney fro this game so I could own it, and play it on Epic mode.

9/10: would kill cute cats and get killed by insane monsters again.

Pros:
RPG game with masive arsenal of weapons, equipment, and spells.
Tactical gameplay in which careful use of Buffs, attacks, type advantage and resistance matter.
Viable and interlocking status effects (which work on enemies and allies alike)
Shoutouts and easter eggs aplenty

Cons:
I can't beat the final boss on Epic, and grinding up strength is difficult.

review:
Been a fan since you started the series way back when. Always wanted a game that pulled it all together.

I'm not a huge fan of the character design (at least for humans) outside of battles, as it seems inconsistent with the rest presented. A few of the inventories could stand to be combined instead of having a separate one for equipping and upgrading. Those are the only two glaring flaws I'd noticed

Excellent battles, characters, weapons, items. Oh and the art is gorgeous, staying true to the style but looking more clear and pretty than ever. Awesome game.

TL;DR 10/10 would earn "Pervert" again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012333497', 'num_games_owned': 840, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1481830306}
review:
Been playing the since the first Epic Battle Fantasy on Kongregate.com. Was not disappointed by this.

You will play as 4 characters each with their own themes and skills that match. You start with 1 and quickly collect the rest of your party.

Minor spoiler for party formation if you play previous games: [spoiler] You start as the new game character instead of any of the original characters. [/spoiler]

Combat is really simple yet can be indept. There are attacks and spells, buffs and debuffs, resistances and weaknesses. Enemies have attack patterns which can be predictable at times.

There are numerous pots. Equipment wise, you can equip a weapon, a headgear (hat), an armor, and 3 flairs (badges for small bonuses). While you can not craft any items, you can upgrade them to improve their existing stats and sometimes add new ones.

Story is cheeky and predictable. Humor is the same as previous games.

Overall buy it if you like a decent rpg.

review: A ridiculously fun game that will have you clenching your fists during the tough battles that make you want to pretend you are like the hulk and punch walls. However, then you quickly realize you are human and break your knuckles. Don't worry though, the comedy and parodies galore in the game will take all that stress away and make you crack up laughing. Has very nice customization, weapons, skills, and I love how the characters react to the battle and their own new skills. This game is a walking parody with a great storyline. 10/10. NO LEGS I CHOOSE YOU!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018595337', 'num_games_owned': 739, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3753, 'last_played': 1646124638}
review:
This game I bought because the different art styles were all cute and interesting. What followed was a shockingly good experience that I really didn't see coming.

This game is based on RPGs like Final Fantasy and Golden Sun, but where they can be very slow (the former, particularly), this one is incredibly fast paced. I've played a fair amount of FFxiii, but I managed to catch up to my playtime for that game in a much shorter span due to how enveloping this game can be; I've wiled away more than one night by just playing the story of this.

Grinding is possible, but wholly unneeded. It seems most of the enemies have some kind of scaling, but maybe I was just at the perfect level for everything... Not being able to tell which it is is a very positive thing.
It also has a Game+ mode where you just restart the story with all your levels, skills and equipment. This is a nice feature, but I wish it had asked first as I was close to a few end game achieves that reset with the story.

The actual gameplay is, as I said, fast and flowing. A little less dependence on the mouse would have been nice (you need to click to exit combat, for example), but I still love the way this game controls. Although the interface is mind-bogglingly complicated when you first see it, everything has its place and all fits together surprisingly well for a system as detailed as this. There're skill trees, equipment collecting, weapon and armour modifications, 'flair' trinkets, stat boosters, element resistance, buffs/debuffs... You get the point. But by a few hours into the game, I understood the majority of it.

Character balancing was a bit off for me... I dunno if it was bad use of stat items and skills, but my best fighter was also my best healer and had half the max health of my others. Due to the sheer number of options, I found it hard to keep it straight in my head which character should have which (I did consider making some kind of spreadsheet, but decided against it), but I managed to complete the game on normal difficulty without too much hassle. Don't think I ever lost a fight.

Enough about gameplay, what about the story and tone? The tone is brilliant. Spot on. Phenomenal. It'd be worth playing this for the characters' interactions alone. It plays beautifully with RPG and gaming tropes, references are everywhere and as I said at the beginning, the art style is amazing. Cutscenes are done in a felt-style looping animation, battles are anime and overworld travel are chibi things. They all work surprisingly well together and give the game a very lighthearted feel that becomes all the better when the team encounter horrific atrocities.

Also there's a little easter egg that I stumbled upon entirely by accident, but could NOT stop laughing at. I won't spoil it. But damn. It just epitomises the game.

Overall, this is a fantastic light RPG that is deep enough in gameplay to be elevated beyond the flash game it is and become one of my favourites. Resolution options are terrible, mind, and it isn't integrated with steam very well. Still. Amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087557914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1489345748}
review:
El juego es excelente. Ya lo habia jugado en newgrounds pero decidi comprarlo por lo mucho que me gusto y para apollar a su creador.
Tiene sus errores: 
*se crashea muy seguido (aun con los graficos bajos asi que hay que estar guardando a cada instante por miedo a que se cierre y pierdas lo que habias hecho) 
*Me surgio un problema con las partidas guardadas que luego de investigar lo pude solucionar.Pero estaba casi por el final y cuando vi ese error casi fue infartante. (Menos mal que lo solucione).
Y esos errores me pasaban a mi con una pc de escritorio de alta gama.

En conclucion: Lo recomiendo completamente 10/10 Este juego son horas de entretenimiento. Me encanto la historia, el final, su humor, los personajes (aunque Anna se siente muy de relleno), pero asegurate de guardar muy seguido (despues de cada batalla) ya que corres el riesgo de que el juego se crashee y pierdas lo que hiciste. Es dificil, en especial los jugadores zombis y los jefes del monte de batalla, (Â¡Â¡pero los premios que dan lo valen mucho!!) Â¡Ahora a esperar el estreno del Epic battle fantasy 5!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058838611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1426747706}
review: I love JRPGs. It's my favorite genre and with this game being turn-based, of course I love it. The humor and story aren't what you should play this game for, though those are big problems needing to be addressed. The gameplay is what kept me going, quite simple but enjoyable at the same time. I couldn't help but keep going when I was playing it. Though I did a bit extra, the time I spent is about how long the game is, maybe cutting an hour or two. The price is also not too bad, only being $11.99. Honestly, as long as you don't mind bad writing, this game will provide quite a bit of entertainment while scratching the JRPG itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970599891', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1448996265}
review:
This is...well...AMAZING. I'm not a big fan of jRPGs in general (although to be fair I like quite a few of the old SNES ones) and I bought this game during a sale. I wasn't expecting much. I was definitely not expecting to play nothing else for the weekend. The game is really, really good. I like its humor, its battle system and the design. If you like jRPGs (or RPGs in general) and don't mind the humor I heartly recommend buying this game! Right Now!

A few remarks:
- Good, if repetitive combat
- Funny dialog
- Good art / art design.
- Took me about 14h to finish it
- I didn't encounter any bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060587292', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1759, 'last_played': 1611886718}
review:
I've been playing the EBF series since I was a kid, and this one by far is the best

+ Awesome bosses
+ Interesting story
+ Hilarious dialogue
+ Great music (you get the game soundtrack free too :D )
+ References everywhere
+ Great combat system (Good 'ol turn based combat)
+ Tons of equipment, both clothes and weapons
+ Easy to navigate UI

+/- Block Puzzles
+/- Grinding and Backtrack

- May be a little confusing for new players, but you can get used to it (especially the inventory)

Definitely one of my favourite games of all time. ( and its cheap for the hours of gameplay and fun you can get with it)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119491016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1622328642}
review: I played this game for free on the browser, but so much content was missing from it, I spent the $15 because I really do love the EBF series, and I was so pleased with the purchase. You should seriously get this game. It's so much fun and is a nice challenge. The story is funny and kind of adorable. The achievements you can get are pretty hilarious as well. I hope there will be another one soon :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024883642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1467081975}
review:
First off, my hours are not indicitave of actual playtime, I played this game largely offline, not to mention several times online.  In short, this game is amazing - great soundtrack, tactical battles, and a fun world to explore.  It will take 20ish hours the first time through, which gets you your money's worth.

The different difficults matter quite a bit.  Easy is easy, epice requires a ton of planning and thought.  

The humon is great, bring that flash game interenet meme vibe that existed so much in 2008.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079608279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2528, 'last_played': 1492809534}
review:
This game is a joke, being a parody of Final Fantasy,
BUT
It's not a joke.

Not only does this include a difficulty system that actually tells you everything major that changes (Besides things like the Bomb Slimes and Purple Squids entering battle with nine poison stacks on Epic) but the game is still reasonably difficult without putting it on Epic, unless you're so used to Epic that in your second playthrough on on a sequential save half of the enemies one-shotting you in the power plant due to you being two levels underleveled feels normal. My first experience with Epic was nearly getting killed on the first battle in the game, gg. What truly makes this game difficult is Epic is insanely hard, but you can adapt to it. You can get hit by the enemies and survive, and most things that the enemies can do aren't out of your power, unlike a lot of games you see today. It puts the player and the enemies on nearly equal ground, but manages to still keep the game reasonably difficult. That is a sign that the game's difficulty is well designed.

This game contains parodic references to almost every game in the book that your childhood was composed of. My favorite cluster of references is the graveyard in Graybone Cemetery, there are many tombstones on one screen, a few of them are damaged, but the ones that aren't contain jokes that are mostly references of some sort. This is only a pinch of what is included in the actual game, though. 

The dialogue in this game somehow keeps a decent balance between "Absolutely hilarious and cannot be taken seriously" and "Deep storyline" despite the final boss being *SPOILER* a cat god.
I think my favorite thing about the dialogue in this game is either the fact that there is a one-liner for nearly every skill in the game, or the fact that dialogue can randomly trigger when walking around the map, and these times it's at it's funniest. There is one cluster of dialogue where Lance is staring at highschoolers and Natalie calls him a pedophile. Another is a conversation between Matt and Lance where Matt seems to be trying to explain to Lance that despite all the cameras he apparently has in his posession that he uses to stalk Natalie, it's still stalking and over the top stalking at that. The items even get some of this amazing humor, every one having a one-liner for a description. Achievements even get thrown into this bucket, there is one that nearly everyone knows about for clicking Natalie's boobs.

The only negative that comes to mind is the lack of an optimized full screen resolution and no access to STEAM features ingame, besides syncing, achievements, and cards. However this is understandable for a game ported from flash.

There isn't much to say about art style, it's not super duper flashy, and it definitely doesn't try to be edgy. It just tries to be cartoonish, cute, and funny, as it should. 

I can't say much about the music, purely because music is almost never my main focus. Although I can say the music is definitely catchy and worth listening too, HFX definitely did a good job in my opinion.

This game has very nice replayability too, but the story isn't really the strong suit. I personally replay for the comedy and the challenge, and I do NG+ to get gear and etc. I didn't grab the first time around. 

Overall, Matt deserves much more attention than he gets, but should never stop being a semi-solo developer. When you work with a lot of people and publishers, games like this are only dreams.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014013756', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2227, 'last_played': 1450010727}
review:
Having almost finished the game, I'm more ambivalent about it now than when I started. The fights are fun and the puzzles are simple but plentiful, which is good, but the game's humour rapidly becomes tired and obvious. Boob jokes and casual lechery aren't just sexist and stupid, they're also dull and show a serious lack of creativity.

I'm still recommending this game because the gameplay is good fun, but I recommend skipping through as much of the dialogue as you can, because it's just too boring to bother with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046353402', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3194, 'last_played': 1527363955}
review:
having completed this game on epic difficulty, its safe to say that this game is a very rewarding experince, and just beautiful. it's something i loved even fro mthe start, and thats hard to pull off with most games

the fighting, the items, the skills, the bosses

they everything is just very very well made

the story as well, is very fun and light hearted, despite the world ending. again.

i would most recommend this game for long time fans of the series, and fans of other turn based rpgs, like Final Fantasy, and persona. this game wont waste you're money. it will turn it into a wonderful experince.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084475701', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1527451710}
review:
Here's the short version: AMAZING. Buy it, you won't regret it no matter what!

Now here's the slightly longer, but still acceptable version:
EBF4 once started out as a sequel to a sequel to yet another sequal, all of these being flash games. This means the game can be a bit rough around the edges, programming wise. This fact makes it even more amazing that the game looks beautiful, has nice gameplay, incredibly short and few load times, and still manages to have a solid framerate, even on old systems. Then there's the humor... It has some dated jokes, but the fact that they're slightly dated only adds a bit of nostalgia to already great jokes. Also, this game has steam achievements, steam trading cards AND cloud storage! This easily makes up for the current lack of the Steam interface in-game.
Are you convinced yet? Because if not, I give up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999721855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2983, 'last_played': 1469103483}
review:
I'll be honest, after I bought this game I had a sinking feeling it'd be kind of a forgetable RPG, but as you can see by my hours it actually turned out to be pretty damn decent.

Weapons and armors are straight forward but have a lot of different combos you can use and switch out with

Humor is good

Combat is the usual you hit me I hit you and the visuals and utilities of the moves are actually something you'll itch to upgrade when you get the exp or points for.

Only irk I'd say is that if you're looking for an RPG with different things you can do asides wander around and kill things look elsewhere, this is basically a very well done flash  game that just does wandering, buy/trade/talk, kill and made me put it down now and then, but I always picked it back up for the great music, boss fights, and combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040457997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1448686258}
review:
I was very dubious about this game, mainly got this because of the positive user revews (and cheap sale price). I'm not a fan of jrpgs as a rule, I've played through FF7 and 8 in the past and liked them but mainly I find both the gameplay and storytelling to be really annoying them.

I was pleasantly surprised, this game is actually super fun. The UI is relatively painless to use for the genre, fights are fun (after the dull early game) and there is even a bit of character customization. I actually enjoyed the silly story and the jokes were mostly awful but.. somehow still work. 

I did dislike the constant backtracking. Also, I played on normal and the difficulty curve was a bit annoying. Like the first third of the game there was pretty much no change of losing, and the last third felt a bit tedious since even minor fights took a while to finish. Example: pack of dogs that each spam heal to full health every turn while preventing you from casting spells, and unlike most monsters have very little vulnerabilities. Really annoying.

And then there was the boss fight, which was stupid. I had one party member using resurrect consumable on another, damn near every turn. Because the boss oneshots, through stacked defenses. I don't know how the fight is supposed to be done, I just burned through my hoarded consumables. Other than that the fight was cool but.. yeah.

Anyway, good game, worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059880013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1480, 'last_played': 1492508235}
review: Ich finde das Spiel einfach genial und echt gut gemacht und es macht mir sehr viel SpaÃŸ. Ich kann es eigendlich jeden empfehlen dies zu spielen wenn es sein Genre ist. Die Charaktere sind echt gut gemacht und witzig und auch die NPCs und die Gegner sind auch gut. Es macht SpaÃŸ das zu spielen und ist meiner Meinung ein echt gutes Spiel hier auf der Plattform.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049215528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2588, 'last_played': 1558798208}
review:
This, in my opinion is an awesome game.
Nice atmosphere, the graphics soothe the eyes, and overall, the humor is just enjoyable.

Now, there are people on here who would dare give negative reviews about this game, calling it childish, or just terrible, and that might just shake your decision on whether to buy this game or not.

There's a solution for that: There IS a free version of this game, but it lacks a certain replayability that the premium (this one) version does. So you could go try that and decide for yourself if you want to buy this game and support the maker at the same time.

Heck, or even try the prequel you can find for free online as well! Or even the rest of the series! All the way from Epic Battle Fantasy (the first one). Though the game plays more like an exploratory RPG from the third game forth.

So why would you buy this game if you can play the free version online? Well, in my personal opinion, it just doesn't feel complete unless if you have the entire thing. Like the Battle Mountain, where you can test your abilities, skills, and equipment against some of the most difficult enemies in the game despite your level or difficulty. I also followed the creator's games ever since Epic Battle Fantasy 2 came out on Newgrounds and just want to support him and his works. And also I wanted to make my achievements public because I'm like that.

Also you'll be a filthy casual if you don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212448015', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1709093874}
review: Every time you're hit for half your health you almost kill the enemies and you keep seeing monsters spamming moves to instantly kill all your party members while you rely on a random cat with no legs, a tank, a dog, coffee, tactics, and reviving to survive the rest of the battle. That's only a typical battle in epic mode, but this is a great game overall. you can change anything you do, whether you grind or not, use the best skills or not, upgrade your weapons or not, fight optional bosses or not. You can do almost whatever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070682954', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1447387191}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069726635', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1603, 'last_played': 1452348938}
review:
EBF originates from a internet flash game which I originally played years ago on Newgrounds. It's a turn-based adventure RPG with elements from its counterparts in both western RPGs and JRPGs.

As far as RPGs go, it has a relatively small amount of gameplay, making it a short (but in my opinion sweet) play. Most of the fun will be had in battles, where diverse enemies and an easy-to-understand element system make it a strangely relaxing experience. The art is nice, the moves are diverse and there are references everywhere to almost anything.

Its cheap too, so thats a plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028054269', 'num_games_owned': 1296, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1460039370}
review:
This series has long been a staple of flash gaming, and with good reason. It's a totally solid JRPG-style game. It's easy and intuitive to play, well-written, and a great way to waste five minutes or five hours. It plays equally well in short bursts as it does long sessions.

About the only criticisms that can be made are that the game can be a bit anime-fanboy-crude, with emphasis on fan service with breasts and scantily-clad females, but the actual characterizations of the female characters are well-done, so if you can look past the lewdness, it's really not bad in that regard. The other thing is some battles can get a bit long and repetitive. Most of the time, combat can be over quickly if you're paying attention to your elemental damage, but then sometimes you'll be up against an enemy that has a ton of health, and while the enemy doesn't pose a huge threat to you, it takes a long time to kill. Still, a few battles turning into a bit of a slog isn't that big an issue, either.

Overall, it's funny and well-written and the gameplay is just an absolute charm. There are a lot of elements between the equips and elements and consumables and upgrading of items, but none of these elements are overly complex to the point where they become annoying. It's easy to find almost any piece of information you want, and the game doesn't penalize you too heavily for forgetting to attend to any of the ongoing tasks.

A solid installment in a solid series, heartily recommended to anyone who enjoys RPGs, anime style, humor, or casual gaming experiences. Not that the game is overly casual, but it's so easy to learn, it's a great gateway into RPGs for the casual gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042544936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2841, 'last_played': 1447028006}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000585758', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1663423113}
review:
This game sat on my wishlist for quite some time while I hemmed and hawwed over whether or not I wanted to buy it.  Reviews were good, I've just had a not-so-great streak of games I've tried out lately.  But I figured what the heck, it looks like something I might like.

And let me tell you, it is!  This is a light-hearted 2D old-school style RPG that makes light and silly fun of many of the tropes we all know and love when it comes the the RPGs we've all played over the years.

The gameplay is very simple to learn, but you do sit and strategize a little bit when it comes to the attacks you want to use and what to equip for the best results.  It is very forgiving and easy to pick up for the casual player, you can save at any point you want and there is no rush.  You can go back an unlock previous areas you've been to for more exploration or items.

And of the items, there are a great many in this game.  You will find an upgadeable crafting system here based largely upon random drops from enemies and chests.  There are also some that you can buy.  Weapons and armor are all fairly unique in the things they do an attirbutes that they have.

This game doesn't do anything especially new or different.  It is a comfortable and well-executed little game that you can sink hours into without realizing it has gotten dark out and you ought to make dinner or at least let the dog outside.

The $12 full price is not bad, I felt it was a reasonable cost for the game.  But if you can pick it up on sale for less, I highly recommend you do if any of the above rings your bell.

review: I've been playing the series since I was about 12 and all that existed of it was the first. I've loved them all and kept up with the side games. The references are great and the humor is amazing. I'd gladly pay for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213121957', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5465, 'last_played': 1531608940}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a great mix of RPG, lewd humor and Turn-based Strategy. EBF4 was also Matt Roszak's first game he published on Steam platform and, boy, is it a grand entrance.
Outstanding soundtrack, cute anime graphics and an epic story - what a great combo!
The story is a direct sequel to EBF3, continuing the tale of three heroes that defeated the ancient evil and saved the world, as well as starting a new tale for another hero. The world needs help once again, this time the party has to face even more powerful foe. Can they do the deed again?
Join the party for a brand new adventure with deadly foes and great treasure!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116870043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1511644930}
review:
This Game was everything that I like about RPG, easy to understand, choosable progression, and over all replayability. 
I first fell in love of this game when it was a flash game, but it still has the flash but with the ability to loot more and customability that you will love. There are many choices to to choose from. The attire you wear dictates what enemy you will be able to defeat easily. There is no learning curve. It is truly a good game for RPG beginners, or the lover of any RPG for sure.

review: An awesome RPG. Battle system is complex enough to be rewarding yet simple enough so it's not overwhelming. The art is cute and fun, and the music is extremely good. The writing is lighthearted, and the game is full of jokes and references to other videogames, movies and anime. It's not a huge game, but it's definitely worth it if you are a fan of turn-based RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038669516', 'num_games_owned': 1850, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1444609620}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 es mejor juego de lo que a simple vista uno puede creer (su porcentaje de positivos de Steam invitan a darle una oportunidad, pero intentare evitar decepciones con esta reseÃ±a).

Si uno no es muy amigo de los jrpg de estilo clÃ¡sico no tiene ni que ojear el juego, pero a quien le gusten y sepa pasar por alto su aspecto grafico simple (herencia de ser una saga de juegos flash que ha ido a mÃ¡s hasta llegar a Steam, en parte por el buen hacer de su creador pero tambien por el humor que el juego lleva incluido) puede resultarle entretenido un titulo tan ligero como este, no tiene una historia elaborada ni complejisimas misiones secundarias pero se deja jugar muy facilmente y suple sus carencias con momentos comicos y referencias a otros juegos. Tiene todos los elementos de un jrpg clasico y hay que poner en valor dos aspectos como son la musica y las animaciones (ambas buenas para lo que se podia esperar de entrada en un juego indie asi). El unico punto negativo es el mapa de juego, variado en localizaciones pero con unos personajes de diseÃ±o inferior y movimiento casi ridiculo.

En definitiva, si eres anti jrpg o catador exclusivo de AAA no hace falta que mires nada de este juego, pero si aceptas la humildad desde la que parte el titulo puedes pasar un buen rato jugando con mecanicas de rol japones clasicas y, lamentablemente, algo olvidadas hoy en dia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 3718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3572, 'last_played': 1643038849}
review:
Tags: Topdown - Party RPG
Note: Epic Fantasy Battle 1-2-3 are freely available on Kongregate if you would like to experience the earlier games in the series.

TLDR: Solid all around. Good featureset. Not much replay value. Almost only battles with very little story. Was improved on for the sequel but worth a revisit for chill battles.

The game is well structured in sectors on a grid map that you traverse with an endearing but not very deeply depicted party. Good itemization and good choice of abilities. You can scale your party very high and work on synergy but the game is forgiving enough for a blind or clumsy play. Clearing a section of squares in the grid will often unlock shortcuts and ways to quickly traverse entire regions which helps offset the lack of a fast travel in some areas.

I really liked the banter between the characters and the few cutscenes and wanted more of that to help with immersion.

The audiovisual presentation is solid enough. Music was good and the idle animations and combat animations were pretty nifty for what they are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040820850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1553, 'last_played': 1442430119}
review:
It's a very good game for it's price if you don't take it too seriously. 

The game is very easy (specially if you compare it to some old rpgs) but the gameplay is fun with no random encounters (you can still powerlevel by leaving the area and coming back).

It has a simple UI, easy to understand and allows you to battle faster than in other turn-based rpgs.

Nice crafting system, very simple but effective, only really needed to play on max difficulty (where you get most steam achievements)

Don't expect too much from the storyline though.

Fun game overall to spend some hours. (I'd recomend using some sort of speedhack like in most rpgs if you plan on powerleveling)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048785147', 'num_games_owned': 1629, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1969, 'last_played': 1426366324}
review:
Wow, this game is fun... and big! I'm amazed it's just a Flash game. If you're a fan of the old-school Final Fantasy games, this game is for you, especially if you like cats. :3 It's very rewarding, too, since the visuals are fantastic, the writing is fun, and the battles are tense (especially toward the end). I can't count the number of times when I was sure I was going to lose, but I somehow managed to get it together just enough to crawl to victory.

The final boss is the most tense battle I've ever fought in an RPG. The game does its best to kill you, but there's this tiny sliver of hope, and every turn feels like it will be your last. When victory finally comes, you will know it's because you tore it from the the maw of defeat with your bare hands.

At least, that's how I felt. Hopefully, I'm not just bad. :P I'm sure I could have leveled up more, but the pacing of the game made it feel like this was where I was supposed to be, and that feeling persists through the entire game. Grinding is minimal, and I only did it when I just felt like bashing some heads in for fun.

Get it. Get it, now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019154898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3642, 'last_played': 1526337235}

10/10 You have to play it, just quite good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025334646', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1497849256}
review:
TL;DR: A well done JRPG styled game, with a focus on adjusting your gear and tactics for each group and boss to hit weaknesses and exploit status effects. Requires a bit of strategy for optional things, but no too deep if you just want to enjoy it.

I've actually played all the EBF's so far, and you don't need to play the others to play this one. Technically, you can play it for free on the website, minus some features, but the creator has done some amazing work on this title, so he deserves the money if you want to purchase it.

Epic Battle Fantasy has always been about adjusting your tactics to your current enemies, and 4 is no different. The game boils down classic turn based combat into a purely fun formula. Each battle, even bosses, you can run from at will, so if you find new enemies you can scan them, then flee to adjust your gear if you like, or just hammer on through if you can. Most enemies can be beaten by using gear with no downsides and the proper elements, but obviously you will get much better results, especially against bosses and larger enemies, if you adjust your gear to hit their weaknesses. Unlike most JRPGs, status effects actually matter alot in the game, and alot of them work well in conjunction. One of the best combos is the darkness status effect decreases stats over time, and increases weakness to holy...and the holy status effect reduces the other stats over time, and increases weakness to dark. This leads to combos, such as having an accessory that gives the darkness-only debuff to your weapons, and using that against dark enemies so they receive even more holy damage. The game is all about finding those neat combos and useful effects, and using them well.

The story is bare bones, but it doesn't need to be too epic (Despite the name), the summary from 3 to 4 as told in the intro is 'the heroes saved the world, so they thought they were entitled to everyones stuff, so they took it...that made people mad, insert new heroine'. The game makes light of typical JRPG tropes, without being too caustic. It also introduces new elements as you run into them, so it avoids any sort of tutorial. Sidequests are nothing more than gather materials, give to NPC.

The game has many things you can do to improve your characters besides levelling, optional skills that you can only give to one character, upgrading weapons/armor (of which there are plenty), accessories, permanent stat boosting items that can be hoarded through numerous NG+s, etc. While you can go through it on easy, the game does reserve the boss achievements only for beating them on the highest difficulty, which is an effort no matter when you do it. The optional area, Battle Mountain, is even tougher for it, as the enemies level up with you, so you have to rely on strategy (and maybe some stat boosting items) to win. Still, every group of enemies is unique in structure, and the difficulty ramps up well, a very well designed curve for the game. There is some backtracking as you gain new items, to collect old stuff, but you don't feel too put upon to do so.

Overall, I highly reccomend this game if you like a good turn based RPG that requires you to think about how to handle each encounter, without getting into a mindless slog through weak enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983833408', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1467570355}
review:
crazy good game considering it was developed mostly by one guy. has everything that makes indie rpgs good including:

[list]
    [*]rad music straight outta newgrounds
    [*]clever references to games as old as ff1 and as new as minecraft
    [*]really good animation and art everywhere
    [*]gear upgrades from loot
    [*]enemies are very well designed and its easy to tell their strengths and weaknesses just by looking at them
    [*]grind/gear curve is perfect
    [*]very easy to influence game difficulty
[/list]

it does have its problems though, mostly due to being ported from flash. moving the mouse anywhere on screen drops the FPS to 1 (known bug) and the game starts dropping a bunch of frames after playing for a couple of hours (only fix is restarting game). there's also no controller support which is sad but still not a gamebreaker.

if you want a fun indie "by weebs, for weebs" rpg that doesn't require much commitment (and you've already played neptunia), support scottish developers and get this. it's a good deal at the base price and at 50% off you're robbing the poor guy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072094419', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3012, 'last_played': 1500080240}
review:
A more lovable RPG that you can play whether you're a casual or an insane (wo)man. Great gameplay, there was nothing horribly bad I had to glare at. It's not overly dependent on the trendy stuff like pixel-y graphics particularly, or MMORPG transactions but it's fun. 

Keyword: Fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034604362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2863, 'last_played': 1476669380}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a game that you can easily get pulled into and find yourself awake till 3 in the morning playing, not realizing what time it is.
To put it bluntly, I have beaten this game twice before it was on steam, then found out it was on steam, bought it, and have 45 hours played (As of this review).
Anybody who enjoys rpg style games and has played many of them will easily be able to figure out where this game gets its ideas from, yet they all meld together so well into a fun and enjoyable experience.
EBF4 isn't a game you can't really just try to fire through quickly, because while it is rather simple in terms of an rpg, if you don't approach encounters cautiously you will be heavily punished.  At the end of the day, it is a grand experience most anyone would enjoy.  With an incredible soundtrack by HalcyonicFalconX that is somehow even better than the previous games in the series it is easy to get sucked in.
Stop reading this and go play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141243504', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2359, 'last_played': 1658717536}

review: Este es de esos juegos que no debes juzgar hasta conocer, si eres fan del rpg clÃ¡sico seguro te enamoraras de Ã©l, tiene un sistema de combate clÃ¡sico pero profundo, un sistema de equipamiento que convierte a los objetos en Ãºtiles por toda la aventura, magias para todo tipo de situaciÃ³n lo que harÃ¡ que cada combate sea una experiencia distinta, tiene ajuste de dificultad para todos los pÃºblicos, desde los novatos hasta los veteranos de guerra, en fin, una joya, su unica pega es que esta programado en flash lo cual limita mucho ciertas funcionas del juego ademas de que su rendimiento no es el mejor para un juego de este tipo, por lo demÃ¡s, cuando se trata de jugar, es una maravilla.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153149144', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1581680061}
review:
Well, EBF4 is a great game.
there's lots of reasons to play this game:
its a turn based RPG, has alot of humor, has refrences everywhere, and the battles are much more rediculus than other games.
just an example: emagain a team of 4 poeple, trying to kill the last wooly mammoth, and the first guy says: "oh wow! the last wooly mammoth! i cant beleve we found it!" and suddently, a mamooth litteraly falls from the sky, hits the mammoth, and then you summon a sword out of thin air.

so poeple, buy this game! its 12$, quite cheap!
10 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198097457671', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 2356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2189, 'last_played': 1506138648}
review:
Such an underrated gem of the turn-based RPG genre. It's humorous, it's challenging, it's fairly long if you compare it to the average AAA game, and it's worth the twelve bucks.
Two things if you're not sure: Epic Battle Fantasy 3 is free on Steam, and this is an expansion to a free game on Kongregate if you're a cheapskate.
4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198021656095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 2445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2445, 'last_played': 1439243805}
review: One of the best JRPG-style games out there. It's funny, and cartoony, and well animated, and the plot is interesting (albeit not explored as extensively as it could be), and unlike most other JRPGs the gameplay is actually pretty decent (though it does get a little repetitive by the end)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079776356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2870, 'last_played': 1535847047}
review: Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is easily one of my most favorite games I have played. It has over 72 hours worth of game play(which is becoming more rare in newer games) and four difficulties for even further challenge. There are many skills you can learn in the game and some are character specific while some can be learned buy multiple characters to add strategy to the game. In addition to many skills, there are many different types of equipment, each with their own special effect and stats. Aside from the excellent game play, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 has great music that really sets the tone for the game in each area. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is definetely worth the $12 since most games that have 24+ hours gameplay cost 5+ times as much. Very excited that the developer will be making an Epic Battle Fantasy 5. Will definetely buy that when it comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025403989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1437737946}
review:
[B][U]Epic Battle Fantasy 4[/U][/B], terminato finalmente.

Il gioco Ã¨ alla Final Fantasy (anche se con incontri NON casuali) di derivazione Kongregate/Flash (ovvero lo hanno impacchettato per venderlo su Steam) ma merita, soprattutto se trovato a basso prezzo.

In pratica c'Ã¨ una storia di base, poco emozionante (i gatti sono degli dei e bisogna affrontarne due, ma alla fine...), e si controlla un party di 4 personaggi, di cui solo 3 sul campo di battaglia. Mentre si combatte se TUTTI E TRE sono messi KO, allora entra in campo il quarto, che puÃ², se puÃ², resuscitare i compagni (o meglio, due degli altri) e proseguire la battaglia.

Purtroppo le battaglie sono un pÃ² il punto debole del gioco, imho. Come detto, non sono casuali, ma i mostri sono presenti sulla mappa e si decide se affrontarli o meno. Spesso sono a difesa di bauli, per cui bisogna per forza affrontarli per ottenere il contenuto di questi ultimi. 

Inizialmente gli scontri sono abbastanza divertenti. Sono a turni, con i nostri 3 protagonisti che a turno fanno la loro mossa e poi aspettano con pazienza le mosse della CPU. Fin qui abbastanza ok. 

Il problema sono alcuni scontri che 

-si dilungano su ondate successive di nemici: ovvero, alla prima ondata ne stanno 3, li ammazzi e vi Ã¨ una successiva ondata con un altro gruppo. A volte le ondate si ripetono anche per 3/4 volte o piÃ¹. E questo un poco rompe gli zebedei.

-ci sono nemici particolari, come i boss o nemici piÃ¹ forti in un dato gruppo, con DAVVERO TROPPI punti ferita. A volte scarichi il tuo arsenale per 3/4 turni e scalfisci la loro corazza di pochissimo. Bisogna metterci pazienza. Anche se si arriva con armi ed equipaggiamenti/magie giuste. Semplicemente imho hanno calibrato a cazzo alcuni scontri. Il combattimento con l'ultimo boss mi Ã¨ durato mezz'ora tra sbadigli e solite mosse. Non capisco cosa trovino di divertente gli sviluppatori, se non la loro inutilitÃ  di pensiero.

Anche la gestione di equipaggiamenti ed armi e il loro livellamento: ad un certo punto ci saranno cosÃ¬ tante cose che non si riuscirÃ  piÃ¹ a capire cosa si sta facendo per upgradare qualcosa. Lo stesso per le magie, una confusione di numeri, finestrelle e simboli runici.

Io sono andato sempre abbastanza a caso, e l'ho finito, per cui Ã¨ chiaro che anche qui la superficialitÃ  Ã¨ lampante (a che serveperderci ore a migliorare di un millesimo, se poi avanzi lo stesso sbadigliando?)

VabbÃ¨, mi Ã¨ durato una ventina di ore, con il 60% di achievement trovati, ma a leggere gli altri li lascerei appunti agli stessi sviluppatori, che forse non hanno un cazzo di altro da fare nella vita (finisci il gioco 3 volte? Mavvaffanculo).

Divertente, ottimo a basso prezzo, ma anche abbastanza ingegnuo su scelte di importanza elevata, trattate invece con superficialitÃ .

Pollice su, ma con riserva.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980564223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1900, 'last_played': 1464414384}
review:
I've had nothing but a good time playing this game.

It's a JRPG style turn based combat game, with an overworld map exploration aspect to it (secrets to be found, items that open up new areas and paths usually to treasure in old areas).

There are no random encounters, and only optional enemies respawn; once you clear a 'path-blocking' encounter it remains cleared.  Turn-based combat with a focus on using skills/spells that the enemies are weak to, with a party-wide 'summon meter', lots of items and equipment to be had all with varying effects to them such as "randomly summons a wooly mammoth to fall from the sky onto an enemy each round", "randomly blesses the character", "counters attacks with xxxxx skill" things like that.

The humor in the character/NPC dialogs is light hearted if a bit geared towards a younger crowd (not kids though).

Fans of turn based RPGs should give this one a shot, it's very easy to play in short bursts when you feel that RPG itch, or you can get 30+ hours out of it like I have so far!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132577701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2462, 'last_played': 1475639498}
review:
One of my childhood games, on steam... imagine the excitement felt!

The game is really good if you like crude humor, epic skills, and big twists in battle. It's as much stratagy as it is action. With the multitude of skills available and diffrent weapons and armor, No battle is ever the same. Any battle can go from a walk in a park to the most intense feeling of  "oh we're srewed" you have ever felt, just because one enemy decided to de-buff you.

That being said if you dont like unreasonable amounts of damage, or instakills, or the table turning battle, and prefer a slower paced, reasonable damage, and no doubt what so ever. Try for a diffrent gsame. Otherwise give this a shot.

You should try to play all the other games before this one. Because there is a bit of a story line. 

Rate 10/10




All Hail Godcat

author: {'steamid': '76561198065996678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1454524644}
review:
( Review from a guy who usually play in French, sorry if this is hard to read )

Really thought that the 3rd one was the best??? That nothing could have made this game any more perfect???
Well here's the 4th game or this amazing serie.

EBF4 is a classic-styled RPG : Turn by turn combats, Ã‰quipments, Magics, Element system, ALL the Items, Aventure!!!
The game's tags already spoil it all, nothing new.

There are only 2 things you find less often in that one game tho' :
- Grinding.... ooooooh the grinding... very glad you didn't corrupt this game.
- Random battles. Yes yes! YOU decide when the action scenes starts!

The musics are amazing, so much i'm currently listening to them from the in-game gallery. Amazing idea to have more than one battle theme too, it prevents them to get repetitive too much.

The game is funny and you might need a second playthough to spot and/or get all the references mentionned in the short but frequent character's lines.

The game difficulty can be changed at will in the game's settings, so it's hard for me to give a negative point by saying that the Epic difficulty mode really can make you remember to save after every fight. Of course you could flee the battle and come back later if they are too strong for you... but really sometime you simply don't see the insta-death attack coming. 

Except for the bosses, the first 10 levels gives you short and enjoyable battles with basic tutorial windows that pop-up so new players aren't too lost. After you get to level 20-22 tho', battles can sometime get long and repetitive, especially with a high difficulty setting. Because the enemy monsters usually matches the current place you are in, it can happen that you just want to see some differant landscape in hope to see the foes also change accordingly... as you will stay in some specific 'biomes' for quite a few battles. 
The generous amount of ready-to-be-opened-gold-trimmed chests usually help you to not get too tired of these long 4-waves battles. 

The playable characters slightly lack some personality and backstory, yes, but i guess it's the perfect occasion for the 5th title to be even better that this one. Those who already played ( and loved ) the 3rd game should not see any problems with that tho'.

The price is fair, and the game deserves every single of the 9 points I can give out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060187747', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 8258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7987, 'last_played': 1710351872}
review:
If I didn't like this game, then I wouldn't have over 100 hours on it, now would I?

A lot of people like to disregard this game as a "glorified flash game" and tell you that that is why you shouldn't pay money for this game, but there are many other games, such as a lot of modern fps shooters that charge you well over $50 for something that is barely any different from any of their prequels, and call it "a new game". 

You can also think of this as a donation, rather than a price. Matt Roszak has done a lot on this game, and there is [i]a lot[/i] of content that many other flash games do not have. He definitely deserves way more than what he is getting. I would gladly donate more, if I had any more money (sadly I am a poor man).

I highly recommend this game to any RPG lovers out there. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198210437740', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1453527951}
review: For anyone who liked classic JRPG, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072897164', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5925, 'last_played': 1672014038}
review:
Look, if you've seen this game's trailer, and seen anything you liked, or even just had the time to look through the screenshots and said "Hey, this game looks like it might be good.", please just go and buy this game. If you love Final Fantasy, or Chrono Trigger, or Golden Sun, or really any rpg ever I almost guarentee that there is something here for you. The story, while geared more toward the 12-25 age range, is still an enjoyable, simple story that lays itself out nicely throughout the story. The gameplay flows very well, and it is very easy to notice that there was time put into making the characters and abilities balanced and scale throughout the game. While the game can be very easy when using the corresponding elemental rock,paper,scissors equipment to fight enemies, the battles can still be very long and challenging, making the title of "Epic Battle" very evident, especially on epic mode. The art is very well done, and the music fits the game incredibly.

It's also important to note that the other three games in the series are FREE online, so if you want a primer to what you will be getting you can go play those aswell, which I would also recommend.

All in all, this game, and this series, was a great effort by Matt Rosak and HalcyonicfalconX. Fantastic job, and can't wait for Bullet Heaven 2!

Seamless, fun,  and addictive JRPG style combat
Beautiful animation
You can collect panties
You can click on the hot girl's boobs to make them jiggle (and get an achievement for doing so!)
Great sarcastic sense of humor
Upgradable armor and equipment

Cons:
You can't click on the other girl's boobs to make them jiggle
All of the cats are trying to kill you
Lots of stone sliding puzzles

If you like turn-based, JRPG style games, buy this. This is my first review and I decided to write it because I love this game so much. It's worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166410562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2816, 'last_played': 1518903176}
review:
This latest installment in the EBF series does not disappoint. Beautiful animations, great bosses, and fantastic Limit Breaks.

While at first it may seem like a cookie-cutter RPG, this Flash game has things that other RPGs fail to deliver. The characters are - admittedly lecherous - but lovable, the storyline is satirical and fun, and quite obviously, the game doesn't take itself too seriously; all the reason why this game is suited for children and teenagers alike.

If you're like me, and want a challenging experience whilst chuckling at the jokes and smiling at the anime references, then EBF4 is for you. 

NOTE: After playing this game you most certainly will hate cats with a burning passion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153410311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1533830331}
review: A seriously underrated game. It's funny, it's enjoyable, and as many others will point out it doesn't take itself too seriously. You'll find dozens of easter eggs as you guide your four heroes on an adventure across the land, slaying monsters adorable and ferocious alike. If the game is too hard, you can always turn it down to half difficulty at any time, and if it's too easy you can set it to the highest difficulty for an awesome challenge. And that's not even mentioning the soundtrack!

review:
IncreÃ­ble, hacia mucho que no me divertÃ­a tanto con un juego. 

Lo que mÃ¡s me ha llamado la atenciÃ³n es que el sistema de combate es muy divertido. 
Hay una gran cantidad de cameos y parodias entre los enemigos, habilidades y equipamiento que te sacarÃ¡n algunas risas si sabes de ese mundillo. AdemÃ¡s el combate es bastante complejo, consigue que los combates sean mucho mÃ¡s que spamar el ataque mÃ¡s poderoso y curar todos los turnos.

Muy recomendado a todo aquel a quien le gusten los rpg de lucha por turnos.
