author: {'steamid': '76561198071042705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1429959331}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a light-hearted game with a lovable cast of characters. The relaxing nature of the game carries over into even the more intense battles, and the music sets the atmosphere well.

A great experience that I would reccomend to anyone, casual player or advanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981356193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1426049198}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is by far the best parody games I have ever played.  It pokes fun at a lot of classic console RPGs, but the real heat of the game is the way they combined what made so many other games so memorable.

The game is a simplistic true turn based RPG on the outside, but stesses a depth of strategy with a wide variety of equipment and monsters that have elemental strengths and weaknesses.  There isn't a single weapon or piece of armor in the game that is optimal for each and every battle (there are some that come close to defying this though).  You strenthen your weapons and armor through a basic crafting system that requires a hunt of scarce materials, but offers an item shop near the end of the game where you can buy the materials you might need at a hefty cash price.  There is even a achievement for poking...  Uh...  Nevermind.  The storyline and plot is pretty flimsy, but on the flip side, there isn't a need to grind to complete the game.

I strongly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys console RPGs of the 90s, even if they didn't grow up in the 90s.  There isn't any need to play the earlier iterations of the games to keep up with the jokes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048451386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1445104181}
review:
There's an achievement for clicking Natalie's breasts and making them jiggle, stealing underwear, and leaving a character dead at the end of the battle. 

So, basically, you are rewarded for teasing a busty girl, running away with her intimate clothing and leaving her dead in the end. Just like real life. 10/10





But here's the real review.

Originating from a browser game, the fourth installment of Epic Battle Fantasy is on Steam, and for a very good reason. I haven't seen a lot of turn-based fighting RPGs like this one, but it really hits the spot.

It has excellent humor, and I often find myself laughing uncontrollably as I press space to advance through the chatting/cutscenes, seeing hilarious lines being announced by the characters, either in the arguing present everywhere in the game (because Natalie's boobs/Matt being a disgrace/Anna living in a tree/Lance having microcameras stored in his armor to "look" at Natalie's boobs), or in the battling of hundreds of enemies (because they are too weak/strong/disgusting/cool/tasty/scary, or because they resemble Pok*mon too much).

The characters are beautifully designed, and their personalities are constantly clashing with each other due to their differences, creating a constantly interesting atmosphere to get your mind off the battling and strategy if you're playing on Epic. There's things to like in all of them (and if you look at my profile you MIGHT find out which one is my favourite), and the soundtrack is amazing as well.

All in all, it sounds like I'm reviewing a GOTY title. And I can't say I don't love Epic Battle Fantasy the Fourth. Thank you Matt Roszak for making this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972391438', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 5139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1458758621}
review: I've been playing EBF on the web for some years now and I never thought to buy it on Steam until today. I love everything about this series and this particular installment. It has everything the first three game had and more! You have an extra amount of everything in this Steam version of EBF4 and that makes it worth it's $12.99 price tag. You have at least 3 playthroughs for increase replay value and you've also got EPIC mode which delivers an intense challenge for the daring and grizzled veterans of the series. This game boasts a lot of content, witty writing and that trademark turn-based RPG goodness we all know and love. I recommend this game at it's full price and if you see it discounted I would double recommend you to buy this, it's a wonderful RPG!

Conclusion: amateurs de RPG tour par tour, d'humour gentillet et un peu gras, d'optimisation, d'effets visuels, FONCEZZZZZZZZ, ce jeu est gÃ©nial!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045442671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2573, 'last_played': 1408576633}
review:
This game is undoubtedly one of the best flash games I played. The amount of work done to this game is phenomenal. I remember playing this on Kongregate and enjoying the hell out of it. Once I heard that the full version of the game was selling on steam, I told myself that I had to buy this. AND I played through the whole thing, including through all of the additional contents with Battle Mountain! Here's why this game is worth a look!

POSITIVES:
- HOURS of content
- Not so serious story with humorous elements of characters
- Four characters to play as (Each with unique skills)
- Many ways to customize characters (Skills, Costumes, Badges)
- Several areas to explore and tons of foes to face!
- Game presents a challenge and difficulty scales gradually
- Many RPG elements that people who are familiar OR new to them will love
- Many rewards, many prizes!
- Don't need to grind this game in order to beat it. From what I remember correctly, enemies scale to your level.
- SOUNDTRACK IS AMAZING!
- Art design of world and characters are attractive
- Can save your game anytime
- ACHIEVEMENTS!

NEGATIVES:
- No gripping or remarkable story
- For people who do not like casual RPGs, this is not your cup of tea

Overall, I enjoyed playing through this game again and experiencing the challenge of Battle Mountain! Hope this review helps make a clear picture of Epic Battle Fantasy 4!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086395513', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4046, 'last_played': 1709478711}
review:
There is an achievement for stealing panties.
10/10

Edit: In all seriousness the humour isn't the only thing great about this game. Epic difficulty is very difficult and rewarding at the same time. There are some difficult puzzles. Late game (on epic) has some 30 minute+ fights which are all or nothing - very tense, and very rewarding. Because of the way skills work there are some which you have to choose which character to take them on - i.e. revive which is only way besides using an item to actually revive a dead ally (which is pretty important since most attacks in the second half of the game are one shots).

The only bad part of this game is the first boss where you have limited options because you have no skills yet :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198043935082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1699258972}
review:
So Captain, what's your opinion on this game?
...
Huh? Sorry, I was too busy playing EBF4.
Anywho, EBF4 is an RPG where you control 4 characters but you only have 3 at once. That 4th character is your backup, so you're thinking "Oh I have to take a turn to switch out and now it's going to get mulched by the enemy, great." but nope! Totally free, just take that action and you can still attack! (You can do this multiple times as well...for fun I suppose?) That's the thing with this game, it leaves out all the bull**** (Pardon my French) and leaves all the fun, such as no random encounters. But doesn't that make the game too easy? Ha ha, no. If the game is too easy, you can easily take on the upgraded bosses in the bonus stages but the normal bosses are hard enough. Considering that I always make sure to be two levels above the current boss's level, it's easy for me but I figure if I didn't do that, it'd be a challenge. A fair challenge, but a challenge nonetheless. The game is exciting and fun to play, there's always things to look out for such as hidden items, enjoyable character banter (Your mileage may vary, obviously), and so much more. It's only 5 bucks due to the sale but if it was priced on merit, I'd say it be 40-50$, 60$ would be stretching it but for a game like this, I sure won't mind coughing up the dosh for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072174860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2081, 'last_played': 1457291324}
review: A unique, well-thought-out RPG featuring a classic battle systesm. With 4 difficulty options that can be swapped at any time, the game has appeal to all fans of the genre, whether you're a hardcore power leveler or just rushing through the mandatory battles, the combat is simple and with many skills to level at your command, battles become more reliant on your own decisions. The dialog both in combat and in the field is witty and surprisingly well written, though some dialogues can be misplaced if missed in an earlier fight. The art in the game is fantastic - the character and enemy models are well-drawn and all have a distinct EBF artstyle. Each piece of equipment modifies the character models enabling the player to decide what their character stats will be and cool or cute they look. The story mode is fairly lengthy, taking anywhere from 15-25 hours on a normal difficulty run depending on completion and grind and features several optional challenges, with massive replayability including New Game + and Battle Island. Last but not least the music, by HalcyonicFalconX is not only great, but each piece fits amazingly with the nature of the battle or field, making the entire RPG experience phenomenal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060302913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1475, 'last_played': 1610678079}
review: Epic Battle Fantast 4 is what most RPG's today lack. a focus on battle, skills, gear and just plain fun, exploring a vast land with as many side quests as you want without gunking up the main plot of the game. unlike other games where finishing side quests and gridning for level seams more a chore then anything EBF4 makes it all worth it by showing a clear advantage against lower level enemys as well as making the items from side quests worth the effort and back tracking some require. over all if your looking for a fun respin on clasic RPG's i highly recommend this game to anyone looking for some quick pick up and go fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198034635154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 6098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5311, 'last_played': 1449778934}
review:
Alright, to begin with let's get the tricky stuff out of the way. 

First of all, this game is cheeky and doesn't shy away from cracking jokes at everything, itself included. If you're easily offended, you might want to keep that in mind when making your decision, but ultimately it's all light-hearted and carefree. So don't make it a political thing, it's not. 

Secondly, while it's true you can play this for free on Kongregate, the Steam version (like Kong premium version) adds extra features (including new game plus), an entire new zone with bosses on illegal stimulants, supports more resolutions and you get the entire soundtrack, which is, might I say, really, really good.

Now with the disclaimers done and over with, let's get to the actual game.

It looks old school and cartoony, with turn based combat in which you slash, hack, blast and nuke your way through loads upon loads of critters, ranging from cute bushes (never thought I'd use that phrase seriously) to intimidating elementals. Elemental strength/weaknes system is in play, and there's plenty of elements and status effects to play around with. There's a lot of room for experimentation with gear and skills, and even bosses can be beaten through different approaches.

The soundtrack, as I said already, is AWESOME. No really. Just listen to it and appreciate it. It does a lot to round up the game experience. HFX has done an awesome job yet again (the only kind of job she ever does it seems).

It's not a hardcore RPG, even if it offers its challenges, but that makes it no less fun. Just a word of warning: If you decide to play this, better wear a helmet, because those shards of the fourth wall are going to be a-flyin' all over the place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045056189', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1477305939}
review:
I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy since I first found the original on Newgrounds five years ago. Seeing the series evolve as much as it has, finally reaching an actual release on Steam? It's a great sight.

I've never been a fan of JRPGs, but I never found EBF to be frustratingly difficult. It requires the right enough amount of micromanagement, planning, and strategy to appeal to both casual and hardcore RPG players. It's also got a very parody-minded sense of humor that's usually quite fun and rarely runs dry. One example in it's favor is South Park: The Stick of Truth, which I did like for it's humor, but the tongue-in-cheek delivery kind of killed it for me halfway. EBF doesn't do that, and I'm glad about that.

While my only real complaint would be the relative lack of backstory to cover the events of past games for those who might be new to these games, it's never so drawn out and overly complicated to not pick up on quickly. If you're looking for a new RPG to add to your library, I'd definitely make no higher recommendations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043244199', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1509455077}
review: Personal Rating 10/10 - If you like Turn-based, if you like pokemon references, if you like CATS... then this is the game for you! A turn-based adventure through a square world where you choose 3 of 4 adventurers then neglect the fourth, this game allows you to become a master at whatever you work towards, become a deadly opponent who has OP fire attacks, or go completely Holy and own everything! Anyways its a great game, good job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067312337', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2154, 'last_played': 1511864557}
review: Cute, fun, and epic. Easy to learn the ropes, yet still provides a worthy challenge for the daring. I love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073549061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3029, 'last_played': 1603669959}
review: Jouissif, addictif, avec une bonne rejouabilitÃ© et une prise en main facile, voici un RPG tour par Tour digne d'intÃ©ret, ce jeux ma laisser une trÃ¨s bonne expÃ©rience et je le recommanderai Ã  n'importe qui, de plus l'humour et les rÃ©fÃ¨rences vidÃ©oludique sont omniprÃ©sentes, achetez ce jeu et soutenez Matt Roszak et Kupo Games parce que ce jeu mÃ©rite de ce faire un nom

author: {'steamid': '76561198026434075', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1418424386}
review:
Are you a fan of Jrpgs? Proceed directly to the checkout page. Do not pass Go. Trust me on this one.

Are you new to the Jrpg genre? This game makes a truly wonderful starting point for you. Proceed directly to the checkout page/ Do not pass Go. Trust me on this one.

Do you prefer your RPG action to be grim, bloody, realistic, and devoid of subcultural references? Nothing to see here, move along.

Buy it. Play it. Laugh. Love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040621452', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1416850975}
review: Really fun game. Lots of refernces to internet/gaming culture and a fun battle system. Graphics and sounds are not the best, but you get use to them (I actually quite like the graphics now). A game with some replay value and not too much grinding, despite it being an RPG. Defintely recommend, especially if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000694192', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1596312280}
review: While it's true that there IS a free version of this game over on Kongregate, the Steam version has more content (More skills, Equipment, a new dungeon plus other things I'm sure), plus you get the soundtrack with the purchase and you support Matts development of more games. This game is a LOT of fun, looks really nice, and can be funny from time to time with the dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001915955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2134, 'last_played': 1416989107}
review: Best game I have played in a long time. I look forward to EBF 5 :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198086419417', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1410569714}
review: I remember playing 1, 2, and 3 on Newgrounds a really long time ago, it was litt. And now the 4th one is on steam and its pretty fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198041798621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2991, 'last_played': 1411546311}
review: Hilarious dialog, smooth gameplay, awesome music, what more could you ask for? Recommended to anyone that likes a good RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079432078', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1543823330}
review: Outragouse comedy with a great story, awesome soundtrack and gameplay. And just an all round fun game especially for those who like that Final Fantasy feel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094057037', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1622407183}
review: Rarely do i find a turn based RPG so interesting! Guaranteed, manyhours of playing without getting bored. Excellent scenario, Magical Graphics and awesome characters. For all tbrpg fans out there buy it. You won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020789829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3268, 'last_played': 1416010015}
review: Amazing game. Light hearted-humor, tons of breaking-the-fourth-wall moments. Great combat system with good item and skill level ups. Story is decent, no surprises but keeps you entertained. Fantastic music both when walking and while in combat. If you are a fan of turn-based RPG games, definitely get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071778168', 'num_games_owned': 2060, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4765, 'last_played': 1710558480}
review: A fun but tedious 100%. As usual in rpgs...

author: {'steamid': '76561198064445036', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1415964010}
review: Was ist Epic Battle Fantasy 4? Ein RPG das versucht aus Pokemon, Final Fantasy, Zelda und anderen RPG Meilensteinen das beste aus all diesen Welten in einem Spiel zu vereinen. Gelingt es diesem Spiel das zu schaffen was Sie sich auf die Fahnen geschrieben haben? Ja auf jedenfall, man erwartet es bei der Optik und dem Namen auf keinen Fall aber dieses Spiel ist gut, verdammt gut. Ich habe dieses Spiel jetzt 6 Stunden gespielt und habe wie es aussieht nichtmal die hÃ¤lfte geschafft.Unglaublich ist auch das Ihr ausser den Charakteren auch alle Waffen, AusrÃ¼stung, SpezialfÃ¤higkeiten, Items, etc. Leveln kÃ¶nnnt. Es besitzt zudem noch verdammt viele Anspielungen auf andere Spiele und hat trotz des billigen looks auch ein gutes Kampfsystem welches Ã¤hnlich wie bei Pokemon ( Wasser ist gut gegen Feuer etc. ). Zum Abschluss kann ich nur sagen das Epic Battle Fantasy 4, obwohl ich keinen anderen Teil kenne, ein verdammt gutes Spiel ist welches man auf jedenfall mal gespielt haben muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065385006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1425339196}
review: Fun, great, and good old turn based play. It has a lot of fun jokes inside of it, as well as a very interesting story. The gameplay itself can bring back nostalgia to those of us who prefer the old final fantasy like turn based games. I highly recomend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995174461', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1800, 'last_played': 1415908359}
review: Very fun game, with a lot of visual variety and with enemies and bosses so that you frequently need to rethink your strategies and not just spam the same attacks every battle. Also has a lot of content, with optional extra hard content which is also quite enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057696107', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3054, 'last_played': 1531178902}
review: One of the best RPGs on here! A must play for fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043988207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1458831596}
review:
It's a great game. I've played all of the Epic Battle Fantasy games, and this one is my favorite. Despite my dislike of uncouth humor (and there is quite a bit of uncouth humor), I find this game to be quite enjoyable. And there is also humor that I do like, so there's that. There's more content here than you can get play in any short period of time.

It's a FInal Fantasy-esque game, so if you are familiar with that, it is easy enough to figure out. Click on this, click on that, enemies get exploded/shot/sliced/arrow'd/. Level up skills with skill points. Use items. 

If I were to make one complaint, it would be that it doesn't have a Mac version. The dev said that it won't be happening for a while, so if you don't have a Windows computer, you might be out of luck.

Matt does, in fact, like swords. Even if they aren't actually swords.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045309473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1422, 'last_played': 1603541596}
review:
Really good game indeed!
As a big fan of Turn based RPGs and RPGs in general I would really recommend this game. With it's great mix of commedy and references as well as some strategy for the harder battles on epic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997103678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1406180196}
review:
Was a great buy on sale and heck of a nice surprise.

The gameplay is simple, but very enjoyable in that "old JRPG meets quirky environment" kind of way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029939961', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1706080550}
review: This game is a funny joking, breaking the forth wall, RPG. It's all good fun in the world of EBF4, with jokes coming left and right, and all being masterfully crafted so that none fall flat you won't stop laughing. Enough about how funny the game is, let's talk about gameplay, the game focuses on the goal of collection and completion rather than harsh and numerous battles, the creator has also made it so that character's not battling will also gain experience so that you won't have to grind for any other character at a later time. The collection will included things such as: chest locations, random drops for armor and weapon upgrades, those weapons and armor  themselves, certain creatures to fill that damn bestiary, ect. All battles are fair and equal as long as you do a little side searching here and there to gain a little extra exp. Jokes, fair battles, and no grinding sounds like a good game to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079777264', 'num_games_owned': 2802, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1524395408}
review:
Randomly found this game and seeing that it had JRPG elements, i investigated further. I Watched a few gameplay video's, read the full description, but i found myself still not convinced that it was of worth. I Thought to myself, " just go for it".. i did not regret it one bit. I Am so addicted.

How this game was created, was so thoughtful to details in the terms of gameplay. From witty dialog that pops up but does not get in your face, the excellent setup of the battle system, puzzles, loads of achievements to keep a player occupied, to even the collectable elements. The game is just so thoughfully pieced together.

I Would recommend this game to anyone who loves the JRPG genre, and everyone else alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077233479', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1549857151}
review:
This Game series to me atleast has been the best on newgrounds its always brought me back for more.
This one is no different ive put 320 hours into the newgrounds version and 221 hours in the Kongregate version and bought the prem on there, so when I heard it was on steam it was a no brainer to get I havent actually had time to play it much since I bought it buy it was well worth it and I look forward to seeing if there will be a EB 5.
If you love Rpgs look no further this is the game for you.
Possibally the best feature of this though is the ability to play offline so if ur on a road trip with your parents or camping out and you got your laptop just load steam offline and play away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095054340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1998, 'last_played': 1421060360}
review: Ayyy 10/10 2 edgy 5 me.Play it now or i will kill ur doge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079351998', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1419528086}
review:
I liked the part with the bouncing boobs.

But seriously, I've been playing this series since it's 1st release and maaaaan! This is one of the best old school RPGs i've ever played. The game may not take itself that seriously, but there's a lot of strategy in almost every single aspect: weapons, armor, accesories, crafting, buffs, resistances and weaknesses... thare's a lot going on in a single fight, so you can either plan your moves acording to every situation or just don't give a shit and start using finishing moves all over the place. Solid gameplay, solid experience, pretty darn funny!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050766032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1403490302}
review: I wish i could say how much I love this game! It has amazing battle system and it has alot of old concepts that game developers have just thrown away in exchange for newer ideas that are less developed, BUT (And this is a big but) I'd have to say every character in this game is forgettable even the people you play as are very forgetable even though there is alot of character development. I feel if you go through the game being all "who is that again?" to your party members it is just not worth it. 4/10 GG no RE-match...

author: {'steamid': '76561198012872917', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1454480371}
review:
You can still click on Natalie's boobs to make them jiggle

10/10.

No but actually if you're like me and grew up with cutesy japanese rpgs and mmos, just get this game. It's exactly that but minus grinding and it's funnier. If you must, consider the free prequel on newgrounds a free demo which might I add has less features than this version.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998533684', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1415156926}
review: This game I got on sale for 6.49, but I would probably be willing to pay 15~ for it.  Fun and challenging battle system with casual - hardcore difficulties, and seemingly lots of endgame content.  It's a lot of fun, and pretty strategic.  Commentary in the game definitely makes the whole thing that much more worthwhile :D

review:
Pros:

This game is...

This game has...
...a Great Soundtrack
...an awesome battle system
...a Glitch in the Matrix

Cons:

I really can't think of any

author: {'steamid': '76561198058018411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1527980516}
review:
First and foremost, this is essentially an upgraded flash game. If you dont want to pay full price (which is understandable for some people) then wait for a sale.

This game brings back the classic feel of a turn based rpg system in a warm, fun filled cartoony format. It is not a childish kind of fun, but is still best left to those who like games that are not even close to serious and are meant to just screw around with. That being said, it is possible to either breeze through the storyline or sit and grind for god knows how long on achievements. Either one works.

If anyone were to ask me if this game is worth getting, I'd respond with "Do you like cheesy, fun games that arent at all serious? If so then yes."

author: {'steamid': '76561197997505096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5330, 'last_played': 1527451135}
review:
When you first look at this game you might judge it too quickly and believe that it is not worth it and you will be doing the biggest mistake in your whole life... okay I am exagerating here, but trust me. I have played this game when it only had the flash version and I played most of the previous versions too. It has a fun and cool story, the artwork is pretty cool and the soundtrack is amazing, I get the feels just by listening to the soundtrack while not playing the game at all.

Another thing is, you might expect it to be just another simple RPG game, but this game has a complex system with many stats and elements and you might find a great challenge while playing in the EPIC difficult, but you can also just go for the casual or normal difficult.

You might find yourself enjoying playing this game much more than many AAA games out there.

I would like to thank Matt Roszak, Halcyonic Falcon X and everyone else who helped to make this masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104514925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1488, 'last_played': 1527372656}
review:
Excellent game. Best indy rpg I've played, and definitly one of the best jrpgs I've tried(up there with Golden Sun and Dragonquest)
It has remarkably detailed combat, and usign weaknesses and resistances is about the only way to take down some of the tougher foes.
It also has a lot of hidden items ^w^ And many easter eggs.
It also uses an unusual system for encoutners, with most battles only happening if you target the foe and start it yourself, with most batles having preset compositions(a nice change from the usual random encoutners of jrpgs).

author: {'steamid': '76561198051488426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1513198571}
review:
This game has boobs. 10/10.

But seriously, if you've ever wanted a freaking awesome classic-style RPG this is the thing. The soundtrack is SO GODDAMN EPIC. Like seriously, Epic Battle Fantasy 3 and 4 have my two favorite soundtracks among video games I've played.

The mechanics are standard fare, but there's nothing wrong with that. Character designes are very memorable, especially things like the slimes, NoLegs and GodCat. 

If you're looking for a short RPG to play, this should be your first choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063336245', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1557176360}
review:
Well first let me tell you that I have followed the series on Kongregate while it had only released Epic Battle Fantasy 1 and to be honest the first and second game wasn't that great but then the third instalment came to the series and it changed everything becouse it had absolutely everything an JRPG could offer for a flash game.

I played Epic Battle Fantasy 3 about 5 to 10 times and when beating the game it gets a bit repetative so I usually came back for it every other month or so. Even when I had played it 9 times it was still as fun as it was the first time I started the game. But years passed and one day in 2013 just before I was about to turn off my computer I just wanted to check my Kongregate and there it was, Epic Battle Fantasy 4.

I played the game 2 times or so on Kongregate but never really took the time to beat it but then a half year later when it got to steam I instantly bought it and played it through. I'm currently at my second playthrough and it has been some time since I bought it now.

Lets get into the game shall we

Art and Graphics: (10/10 absoultely love the art style)

I personally love the cute anime based art style that the game has and the effects are well animated aswell as the world and items and don't forget all the monsters and characters all have high detail. You may wonder why I say that they are detailed while their not having that mush details like shadows and particles but that is becouse it has a perfect balance between being cartoonish and detailed so i would say that this is a kind of masterpiece.

Sound and Music: (11/10 its my favorite game music and I listen to it all the time)

I think that the sound effects in this game fits perfectly with only some few improvements coming into my mind sometimes but thats just if I'm picky.
The music which is written by HalcyonicFalconX is absolutely stunning and as it changes from every region you visit it also changes the games atmosphere. From relaxing in the forest to intense in the factory aswell as epic while in the volcano. All I can say is that without the music the game wouldn't have such an impact on me as it had.

Gameplay (combat): (8/10 the combat is great but can sometimes get a bit repetative)

The combat system is that of any JRPG just that it is simple, highly detailed and fun but it does get repetative when going through an older region or before you unlock multi target skills. Anyhow the combat can make you quite impressed sometimes as some skills/attacks is simply epic.

Gameplay (exploration): (9/10 the world and exploration is so relaxing)

With a bunch of puzzles, easter eggs and a large variety of biomes to explore the exploration gets quite relaxing and at the same time interesting as you never know what you will find before uncovering the map.

Content: (8/10 very mush content for having one developer)

There is a large variety of quests, skills, items and monster but its not as mush content as you will find in an AAA game but thats obviouse that it would not have as mush content. I'm not saying that the game is low on content of items etc. but when you reach high levels for example you might have acctually leveled all skills to max and uppgraded every piece of equipment to the max. There is still enough of content to satisfy any player but I'm just saying that you might end up with nothing more to level up other than the characters levels but you wont reach the "no more upgrades" untill your in New Game+ or New Game++.

Story: (7/10 even without any focus on the story I still like it)

The game focuses on exploration, upgrading and combat but still offers a small story and its quite lighthearted and ammusing but still every time the game reveales a new part of the story you really feel like you are there in that offten wierd situation.

Final Score: (9.8/10 this game is a must buy)

Why such a high score well here is some ups and downs:
+++ : The music is absolutely amazing
++ : The sound fits very well with almost everything within the game
++ : Exploration and puzzleing is very fun and can get you obsessed to clear everything to a 100%
++ : The combat system is very strategic and interesting but its still simple enough to be played by a child
++ : The sudden notices from the characters can get quite hilleriouse
++ : The games easter eggs makes the game quite fun if you try to notice them all that is
+ : The game offers New Game+ aswell as a large variety of items to use
+ : Some skills/attacks can only be described with one word only: EPIC

- : There is a large variety of Skills and Equipment but after starting New Game+ it feels like you found everything
- : Going back to an older region does not provide with any supported combat untill you reach the next New Game+

This is a must buy for all RPG fans aswell as to all Fantasy and Comedy fans so I hope this review helped and that you might buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069685070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1403603411}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996633876', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 370, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1451766530}
review:
Eh.

I liked EBF3 better.

I've been following this game series for a long time now, so when EBF3 came out it 'wowed' me in a way that EBF4 simply cannot - being that it's exactly the same game, but with a new character (who doesn't add to the max count of players on the field). It feels like a new game. But, at the same time, I suppose instead of innovating, it's simply... more content. Coupled with a map that's of a decent size, yet feels surprisingly small. That, and of all the swords that we've got still in the game even from EBF1, no Soul Eater. My absolute favourite sword is not here. That makes me a very sad cookie. Soul Eater, featured in every game up until but excepting this one. Very fun because of the drastic reduction in survivability stats, but a huge increase in damage.

I'm only 17 hours in, at the final boss, and I expect to be here for a while longer, simply because I'm gonna need to grind up a whole bunch more XP off... something, and a whole bunch more money, off... something, since I expect I am going to need a pile of it to upgrade every piece of equipment I need so I can finally beat the boss.

Now let's get something straight. I don't mind grinding. I play Disgaea 1. Yeah, play. Not played. I'm still going.

But in EBF4... for some reason, I'm not really enjoying the grinding. I'm not really certain why. I spent hours upon hours finishing up EBF3, and it was incredibly satisfying to finally tick every box, but with EBF4, I'm struggling to work up the effort to beat the final boss.

Why do I recommend this game?

I recommend it because it's a good game. It really is. It's a $12 JRPG-type game, it's great fun, and it's terribly, wonderfully simple in scope. It's exactly what it looks like, a turn-based JRPG. If you like turn-based JRPGs, you will like this one.

If your finger is hovering over that 'Add To Cart' button, and you're just not sure, then give Epic Battle Fantasy 3 a go. It's free, and a good representation of what you're going to find if you purchase EBF4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066219042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1576, 'last_played': 1427727165}
review:
If you like the first three Final Fantasy games, you'll like this. It is originally a Flash game, but evolved to become what I think a great classic. It's combat in particular is what I think a high point in the game, the graphics and especially those auto cast skills that appear at random to bombard your enemies will always make you smile. You can have a hat that randomly calls in a tank to blast an enemy with its cannon, or a shirt that calls another tank to rain down machine gun fire to enemies. There's even an attachment that randomly calls a cat to charge at enemies, or radio in airdrop to give a medpack to someone, or cast some random element skills like poison gas, or even an airstrike that drops random stuffs, like a nuclear bomb.

Of course, many boss units have some OP skills as well, like an orbital particle cannon, or some insane defensive skill that switch profile whenever hit by a skill. It is much more variable and over the top than the early FF games, yet maintains the same light heart atmosphere. Your characters will even chatter whenever something interesting or over the top happens. What's more, nobody will disapprove of the ability to summon a blackhole that can suck everyone, good or bad, in.

Light hearted RPG doesn't get much better than this. If you like this type of game, this is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041160665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1515201661}
review: A lovely parody of classic RPGs like Final Fantasy, done in a memorable way. The dialogue is hilarious, and the art is wonderfully cartoony. I'm constantly discovering new things to do. And the story is surprisingly long for a flash game. I'm 10 hours in, and I haven't completed the game yet, having only just reached the final area. I highly recommend this game for any fans of RPGs, as well as anyone who loves a good laugh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043729104', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1683678639}
review:
8/10

This game is fantastic, with clever humor and engaging gameplay that puts an interesting, unique twist on turn-based combat. Many times I find myself yearning for this game solely because of it's amazing soundtrack and humor that continually evolves into.... Far more interesting things. Let's just say the giant squids need to be left to sushi, and not as a small area-boss. 

Definitely recommend, spent a little over 20 hours on it (half of it is just my game left running though) and I can't say it ever bored me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025552313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1410722788}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 7125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1553968909}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 has the best turn-based combat system I have ever played. That, by itself, is enough to warrant playing it. That it contains copious secrets, varied dungeons, good music and a great sense of humor is a bonus.

There's a wide variety of skills and items for every party member, including skills you can only give one person and permanent percentage stat boosts to help "customize" your team. Your equipment and skill selection have a profound impact in battle, but they're all balanced against each other. Every one is useful in different situations, so you'll still be using some stuff from the beginning of the game by the end. Status effects are powerful and varied, and vital to many fights. The "swap in the fourth party member at any time" mechanic is odd at first but actually comes off really well. And if you crank up the difficulty to Epic, the game provides a mighty challenge indeed--even by the end of the first level.

As for whether you should play the free version or the paid one? Well, aside from rewarding creativity, the bonus area is everything you could hope for. You unlock it piece by piece as you progress, and it offers lots of brutal fights and unique items and skills (including rematches against alternate versions of each boss, some entirely new bosses and waves of tough enemies). But best of all, it scales to your level so you can tackle each part whenever you want to and cannot beat it by grinding.

Either way, free version or paid: If you've ever had fun playing any RPG at any point in your life, you should play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032155951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1565621379}
review:
Step 1: Stop reading this.
Step 2: Scroll upwards.
Step 3: Buy the game.

In all seriousness, this is a great game.
The graphics are not lacking in any way.
The sound is probably the best of any game here on steam, courtesy of musical genius HFX.
It has smooth gameplay that doesn't require grinding even on the hardest difficulty (Unless you suck).
It features a lot of humor such as: "I call upon mother nature to destroy my enemies! I always recycle so I think I deserve this favor."
The story continues from where the third game left off, and it is as good as you would expect from a fantasy RPG.
Nothing is too easy or hard, the difficulties can be changed at will mid-game.
All in all, a great game worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070664972', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1903, 'last_played': 1677848453}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008880527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1452570648}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy as a series is, in my opinion, the one of (if not) the best indie RPGs that I've played in... quite possibly ever.

The game is well done and there are countless different ways to build your characters early on, though this drops off a bit due to being able to get everything later (bar a few spells/abilities that are 1-person only). The combat system, while basic, works great with very little errors outside ones made by the player.The maps are also well designed and often have more secrets in them than meets the eye, in many cases either requiring a return trip or waiting for something to flash upon the screen (though block puzzles, in my eyes, are unforgivable!).

The 'many ways to build a character' is even more evident because of the inclusion of the 4th character (fitting that you get the 4th member in the 4th game), meaning that someone is back in the sidelines ready for action should you need to swap one of your (three) party members out.

Cleverness and hilarity is also abundant in EBF with countless (sometimes censored due to copyright) references and/or memes.

As I write the review, I have not actually gotten to any of the 'Premium' (Read: Pay for) part of the game, as I'm doing an Epic difficulty playthrough and have not started the Battle Mountain or Survival battles.

If you're looking to try the game, go to some place like Kongregate and play it there to see if it's to your liking.
If you're looking to get the game (and support the amazing developer), buy it.

Don't anger the cats by the way; they tend to bring about the apocalypse in the form of elder gods when you do so.

November 2015 Edit: Still amazing, though I forgot to mention (long ago in the original review) that this takes an obscene amount of comp usage for no real reason, so don't be surprised with large amounts of slowdown!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065037140', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1413087306}
review:
This is Just a Fun game.
If you like Turn based RPGs, You will LOVE this.
And it has a new mechanic I've never seen in an RPG before:
There is no super Sword. Ultra guns don't exist. No peice of equipment is best. They are all equaly upgrade-able. Every Peice of equitment has ups and downs. Every one has it's use. NONE are useless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059166065', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2862, 'last_played': 1535384812}
review: In a world where FF dominates any rpg players hopes of a new series they had better relize there is a better series on the internet. The whole point of this game other than fun is to point fingers and make fun of all the obvious and not so obvious things in todays rpg. There are pros like good characters, fun and unique gameplay, interesting concepts, good graphics, and a soundtrack that could sell millions if real. The cons too hard sometimes (i.e almost every battle mountain fight on epic), fights might take awhile and so much GOD FORESAKEN POINTLESS ITEMS (and backtracking). Above all i give it a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032023836', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1506289660}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999963540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1521689747}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy has always been one of my favorite parody series, which is itself one of my favorite genres. But unlike your average "take that, Final Fantasy!" mimicry affair, EBF stands on its own in every regard:
Colorful art design, imaginative enemies, and I can't think of an adjective for the writing that quite encapsulates the unique blend of self-depriciative humor. The protagonists have a "band of idiots" shtick that in any other parody would just come off as mean, but EBF manages to convey a genuine sense of chemistry, that these idiots have been working with and through each others' eccentricities. The humor really comes alive when EBF satirizes not just the genre but also its players, with Anna playing straight man to a trio of 4th-wall-breaking powergamers.

It wouldn't be a Japanese-style RPG without a story, and where the first three EBF games went for the "here is a villain go fight him" excuse to skip to the action, the fourth instalment has tried its hand at some actual worldbuilding this time, though at the cost of assuming players are familiar with the events of the third game. Returning party members Matt, Natz, and Lance are quickly discovering that the various save-the-world plots aren't as standalone and isolated as they assumed, and larger forces have been resetting their little pawns whie they were busy level grinding the Pickpocket skill.

As for gameplay, EBF is quickly recognizable to anyone who has ever touched a Square Enix RPG, and at the same time found its own way to keep the turn-based combat fresh. Not content with just elemental rock-paper-scisors, EBF ensures stats buffs and status effects/ailments are incredibly critical during the late game, but thankfully the player is slowly eased into it all. There's a great deal of customization, especially if you want to eek out every precious damage point from your foes, but if you feel that you're stopping too often to fiddle with menus the game leaves open the possibility of overleveling yourself (to a point). If you know what you're doing the game will be happy to throw you enough curveballs to keep yourself from feeling overpowered but never tries to make you entirely helpless either.

The only real thing to watch out for is possible slowdown. Might wanna check how your computer handles Flash, since that's what this game was originally built in, and large numbers of vector images, since that's what the original Flash engine rendered in. My other main complaint is that late-game bosses can be a bit of a slog if you aren't an absolute min-maxer, but in a way that's sort of the point.

Overall, EBF4 is a happy, charming little affair from start to finish. Matt Roszak has stated that he made the series so he can see a game with everything he likes in it, and the level of love put into the product from start to finish really shows through. If you like swords, sorcery, slimes, and squishing the latter with the former, I recommend giving Epic Battle Fantasy a look; chances are there will be a lot you will like as well.

review: Absolutely amazing jrpg style game. Turn based FF style with excellent creative customization options with a well balanced element based battle style. Difficulty is changable on the fly and higher difficulties also features unique enemy behaviour instead of just a flat number boost. Story isn't very deep, but rather fun and charming. So many great little details and some game and anime references. Menus are easy to navigate and the game is animated extremely well. There's much more praise I could give the game but I don't wanna potentially spoil anything. Definitely a must buy with it's price.

Sus puntos fuertes siempre fueron su sentido del humor estilo manga una jugabilidad simple pero muy divertida con una dificultad que te permite disfrutar del juego sin tener que agobiarte con tener que entrenar para seguir... pero tienes que currarte los convates.

 Si te gustan los rpg este viene a ser uno simplificado pero con mucho mÃ¡s sentido del humor. 

ComenzÃ³ siendo un juego que usaba para descansar de otros pero rÃ¡pidamente se convirtiÃ³ en el "Ãºnico" con el que jugaba.

Me encanta, esperando el prÃ³ximo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050589707', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 3083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1535950371}
review:
First off, Yes, you can play this game on Kongregate or Newgrounds (or possibly Matt's DA), however the version you play will not be this one. 

In other words, No, this isn't the same game you can play on the sites I previously mentioned.

What you'll play is indeed an RPG akin to the old days of Final Fantasy, when Combat wasn't real-time combat with before-use cooldowns.

To those unfamiliar with the Epic Battle Fantasy series (namely the ones with actual story elements) This is an RPG game with tons of funny things here and there, self-referencing humor, and things that reference alot of other things.

So basically the story so far is there's 3 heroes.
One is Matt, who jsut wants food, like swords and piracy... He's also a pirate.. Did I mention he has a guitar and likes Death Metal? I jsut did, you're welcome, reason 1 to buy this game.
There's Natalie, whose powers are in her awe-inspiring magical powers, witty remarks, different mindset of the others, and her boobs. No seriously she's kinda the "Big boobed girl cliche" of the series, though she's hilariously not jsut eye candy,  dishing out the sage advice and owning remarks. But even more seriously she's literally the only one who can decently heal and revive party members. She's kinda the most important character combat-wise.
There's Lance who is a military guy.
In a world filled with big demons (like the last villain you kill in #3), sapient cats with no limbs able to wield weapons via unexplained telepathy powers, elementals, magic, Lance is the one who kills things with overwhelming firepower. Seriously though, he melts those who are weak to bomb-type attacks and even has decent fire and electric attacks.

There's a 4th character, a huntress druid girl for Natalie to relate to.

This game also has achievements alongside the medals of the game, giving you elevated bragging rights.

Your progress on this version won't be wiped by clearing your cache or cookies.

There's what I call a Shamievement, an achievement that's more or less a badge of shame like Duke Nukem Forever's Turd Burglar. You'll be rewarded for being a perv by this, though it really could be worse, so in terms of them, it's really not bad.

Here's the part you care about though... The exclusive content.

This version has more weapons, and more items in general, save for crafting materials (i think) and this game has an entire area called Challenge Mountain. This area is literally filled with enemy encounters which all have 8 enemy encounters each and stronger versions of the bosses in the game which are WAY harder to kill.
Every enemy in thise area scales with level, which means you can get past all enemies at level 1, though you do need quest items like the axe or battery to get past some bits.

How does this game fare? Well for someone who played the first half 3 times on Kongregate, I can say the game fares really awesomely. I mean... never did I once say "Oh god not this part again" or the infamous "Why can't I just skip this" and I'm one of many who found Diablo 2 monotonous after Normal difficulty.

This game is very fun, has some funny elements and even gets challenging properly without feeling unfair. This game doesn't have any difficulty spikes... until the final area, but around then you're ready for it. This game is simply a blast, the only thing stopping me from playing it is just the simple fact I'm feeling a bit bored of RPGs in general.

Alongside such big titles like Final Fantasy, Diablo, Torchlight, and even anything else you could really think of, this game holds it's own ground. The game is honestly fairly unique in my opinion.

This game in my books gets a 7/10. It's pretty good honestly, and I'd easily recommend it to anyone who likes Turn-Based games and RPGs, Despite the fact you can play the game on Kongregate with 30% less content for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040270911', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2336, 'last_played': 1659175655}
review:
EBF4 is a solidly built RPG with turn based combat reminiscent of Final Fantasy with a dash of self referencial/ 4th wall breaking humor thrown in for good measure.

The story is simple enough that you don't need to play the previous three installments. But if you wish to they're easily found online for free.

The combat largely revolves around equipping your characters with the proper equipment prior to the fight so as to exploit the enemies weaknesses and bolster your own defenses against their attacks.

It's not overly long, and maybe not worth the full $11.99 price tag, but it's definitely worth picking up when it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146785902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1500639014}
review:
If you love old school Japanese RPGs I strongly recommend that you play this game. If the price tag isn't wroth it you can find the free to play version of the game on Newgrounds and Kongregate. The steam version to my knowledge has a few extra features like more equipment and the new optional area. All in all it's an okay game to at least play through once if you're not into the idea of paying for extra features then I suggest you play the free to play version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114563643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4871, 'last_played': 1708918823}
review:
How have I not reviewed EBF4 yet? Whatever, I guess I'm doing it now.

[h1]Game was recieved for free because I did a fancy Let's Play of it when the Flash version came out in 2013.[/h1]

Yes, this is (almost) the same thing as the game you can play for free on your favorite Flash hub (assuming Flash hubs still exist as of your reading this :( ). So why should you pay money for a game you can play for free? Because it's a damn good game in the first place that's better than half the paid stuff on the Steam store.

*goes through my notes to see what I've written about the other EBF games*

[h1]Good[/h1]

Like EBF3, it's a silly Flash game, it looks like a silly Flash game, it sounds like a silly Flash game, it's written like a silly Flash game  and it has boob jokes like a silly Flash game. But like EBF3, it's all put together extremely well. If you looked at the graphics alone you could probably guess what the gameplay looked like, and if you read a text file containing the game's plot you could probably guess what the graphics looked like, and if you looked at both you probably couldn't guess what the music sounded like because the music is freaking amazing. The plot is silly, but not stupid or forced [spoiler]cats are the villains because Kupo has a vendetta against cats[/spoiler] and the fourth wall breaks are only used where appropriate.

To boot, the world art, character art, UI art and pretty much all of the rest of the art have been seriously refined and no longer look like recycled assets from a high school animation class.

The battle system is pretty much exactly the same as the battle system in EBF3.

[quote=me]The battles themselves are a turn-based system where you get to attack first every turn, there is no "speed" or "agility" stat, so I guess it doesn't toe the JRPG line [i]perfectly.[/i] Anyway, there isn't too much to say about the battles except that they can easily fall into the "Fire attack, heal and repeat" pattern and you can probably beat Easy and Normal modes that way, but if you want to strategize a little more there is a bit more you can do with playing with status effects and changing equips mid-battle.[/quote]

Also, in this game you can change difficulty anywhere on the overworld, not just at the start of the game, so if you don't want to spend eleven hours on grunt enemies you can dial it down to Normal and then back up to Epic for the bosses (and the achievements that go with them).

[h1]Bad[/h1]

If anything this game suffers from the "there's too much" syndrome that, honestly, afflicts a lot of RPGs. There's realistically way too many equips, consumables and (depending on the way you play) spells and not enough time in the game where they're all useful. Consumables that aren't Revives (coffee) or Full Heals (garlic) and maybe the Super Rares get outclassed by everything else in the game pretty quickly, and even on Epic you're probably going to pick a favorite five or six equipment sets that cover pretty much all in-battle circumstances and never change them.

Also MP is useless because there's so much of it that it's highly unlikely that you'll ever run out, even against the enemies that drain your MP, unless you're doing something seriously wrong. (This will be fixed in EBF5!)

[h1]Stuff that isn't in the free Flash game[/h1]

An optional dungeon where you get some god-tier loot for winning preposterously difficult fights, some new equipment, some new summons, Steam achievements, Steam trading cards, the knowledge that you're helping a highly skilled game designer pay the bills.

There's a full list of features somewhere but I can't find it =/

[h1]tl;dr[/h1]

If you remotely enjoy JRPGS or even just games where numbers go up in a satisfying manner, buy this one. If you don't want to spend money, look up the online version.

[h1]I've always wanted to do this[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198059745819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1772, 'last_played': 1534810624}
review:
Honestly one of the best games I've ever played. The items are great, the gameplay is easy to understand, and the character interaction is hilarious.

Each weapon/attack/item has it's pluses and minuses. What may be great for one battle may be awful for another. This is nice because you actually need to pay attention to equips, not just get "the one armor set." You actually have to use your brain a little bit to play, but not so much that it's exahausting (for example, you wouldn't go into a battle with light creatures wearing only darkness armor, you'd be screwed).

In terms of gameplay, you can switch between using your mouse or your keyboard, an option that other games lack. Also, in terms of battles, you have plenty of time to think and do what you need. While some may like time-constraints, Epic Battle Fantasy 4 provides for a more stress-free type gameplay. All your abilities and options are easy to navigate to, and thus far I have not run into a single glitch.

The characters are great. That's something that could be said about this entire franchise, but especially this and EBF3. There is so much interaction between the characters, enemies, and the environment. Battle after battle can get boring, but the witty dialogue balances this out nicely.

All-in-all, this game is perfect for those looking for a relaxed RPG experience: no time-constraints or reflex-speed battles, vibrant colors that don't strain your eyes, and lots of easter eggs from Minecraft, PokÃ©mon, and more just in case the fantastic characters didn't already have you hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034199687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1407255565}
review:
Great fun->
I usually skip over all types of round-bases-battle-RPGs but I'm glad I made an exception here. EBF4 is a tongue-in-cheek RPG with hilarious characters who dress as stereotypical pirates, rangers or red mages. On the over-world map you collect hidden goodies, explore branching ways and follow the farce of a storyline. If you choose to bump into an enemy the fighting starts, no tedious random encounters after any x steps. Also heroes slowly heal after battle for convenience and most creatures respawn.

The battle system isn't boring but really fun with lots of different skills, weapons, equipment, usable items. 
Skills are unlocked and upgraded with skill points. Levels are gained by experience. Weapons and Armor are found or bought in shops and upgraded with items. There are also summons usable by anyone, limit breaks and "specials" which are skills you can assign to complement a characters skill set like a fire attack or a heal spell.

You may try out the EBF game series on some websites for free to understand how the game works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081821094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1813, 'last_played': 1407079430}
review: I loved this game! Epic Battle Fantasy 4 (or ebf4) is a Strategy RPG similar to Final Fantasy 6 and below. There are Four main characters, Matt the theiving, high attack high defense tank, Natalie, the good natured mage, Lance, the phsycotic, perverted gun freak, and Anna, the tree hugging goody two shoes with a bow. the game starts off with you in the overworld, and when you enter a hostile area, you'll notice the enemy sprites. Yes, the creator got rid of random battles. Thank Christ. when you enter battle, you control three of the four hero's attacks and strategies along with equips. for strategies there is "benching" a character for another, there is switching turns for a character, surrender, and block for the most part. equips follow the rules of, you can change wepons, outfits, flair mid battle, but it costs you a turn, same with consumables. attacks are the highlights of the game. each character can learn their own special set of "skills" for them only, but you ccan find "specials" out in the feild usually after boss fights or quests. theses "specials" can be used by any character provided they meet the parameters. overall, the game is fun, some very small tech bugs, good design and a wacky story. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057424551', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1619325474}
review:
Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is an incredibly fun adventure roughly based off of games such as the early Final Fantasy games. As its title implies, there are also three entries before it... there are also two spin-offs. EBF4 has a flash version that's free to play, but you will have to pay for the Battle Mountain zone regardless, and the flash version tends to be rather laggy at times. Unfortunately, due to the earlier three games containing things that would bring its developer, Matt Roszak, into legal trouble (most notably the first game having a few pokemon for summons, and the final boss of the first game being Goku), they will not be appearing on Steam.

[*]Plot
In between the events of the third game and this one, the heroes, Matt, Natalie (Natz for short), and Lance, turn to a life of crime, since they lack the funds to buy food. They think that this is justified due to them saving the world before, although this is a rather flimsy excuse. They finally go too far when they steal an important jewel from Greenwood Village, causing her to seek them and finally deliver justice to them... only to learn that they did not steal the jewel. Anna must team up with the heroes, and track down the thief before he/she/it/they can steal the other two jewels and summon forth Godcat, who will destroy the world.

...It's rather bare-bones, and can rather easily be ignored in the favor of picking fights with wild animals. Aside from a few rather minor references to the third game, you can easily jump into the game's plot without playing any other games in the EBF series. Interestingly enough, the entire series runs on the plot structure of "Stop this thing by beating it to a pulp," although this game diverges itself from this plot a little more.

[*]Gameplay
Gameplay is split up into two areas: The overworld and combat.

In the overworld, you can walk around, accepting quests to get items for complete strangers with the promise of some stuff in return, harrasing the wildlife, stealing items from treasure boxes, and buying items to prepare for combat. When one wishes to enter the combat phase of gameplay, one simply clicks on an enemy on the map. If one goes to the options tab, one can switch between using the keyboard and the mouse to travel on the map.

In combat, you have a myriad of standard JRPG skills, including several that are based off of elements. As one of the game's tips says, attack enemies until they die. If red numbers appear, that means the element of that attack is pretacualy effective against that foe. If grey numbers appear, that means the foe is either immune or resists the attack. One can also use the Scanbot summon to reveal the weaknesses of these enemies, revealing their weaknesses and stat totals for all enemies of that type. Battles may be split into multiple waves, too. In one of the lower points of the game, your party's turns are not refreshed at the start of each wave, which can result in up to five enemies getting free attacks if you use your last action to kill an enemy. This is especially bothersome with the final boss, who will "kill" itself after a few turns on the waves where it's invulnerable, giving its next phase free, powerful attacks.

After winning a battle, one is rewarded with Gold, EXP, and AP, all used outside of combat. Gold is used to buy new equipment, items to upgrade your equipment with, things that hurt enemies, and items to heal your party members. EXP will make your characters stronger. AP can be spent under the "Skills" screen to unlock new skills, or upgrade ones you've already learned. Any skills under the "special" tab can only be learned by a single character and have to be forgotten if you wish to teach them to another character, adding a layer of strategy as to who gets what skill.

[*]Difficulty
EBF4 is divided into four difficulties. In order from easiest to hardest, they are: Easy, Normal, Hard, and Epic. The difficulty can be changed on the fly, so unless one is having trouble on Easy, the difficulty can be lowered with ease. By default, the game is set on Normal. If one were to select Hard or Epic, enemies will also recieve bonuses that aren't directly stated, such as some enemies that absorb fire damage entering battle with a status that deals fire damage every turn, or fire-weak enemies starting with a status that lets them resist fire. Bosses that are defeated on Epic difficulty also give medals, which directly corrolate to Steam Achievements.

In short, do I recommend this game? Yes. I am aware this type of game isn't for everyone, especially considering the rather cluttered interface, but it's a damn fine one. Also, to those who ask where the other party members are at the start of the game, you'll find them as you progress through Ashwood Forest, before finally finding Lance after defeating the Mighty Oak and entering the Crystal Caverns. Each party member also has a different role, which should be relatively obvious looking at their stats and personal skills they can learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023105909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1405676728}
review:
I love RPGs. Jrpgs, western rpgs, they're both awesome.

I saw the trailer for this game, read some reviews, and I was sold.

Unfortunately, my first (and last) impression of the game was so bad, that I regret having paid for this title.

The interface is terribly cluttered, difficult to use and understand.

There is NO tutorial in the beginning. None. There are some vague hints here and there about minor aspects of the game, but that's it.

How to fight? How to find your way? How to manage your inventory and skills?

Not explained in any way. Hell, I even had a hard time figuring out where the hell I was supposed to go to begin with!

I'm all for games that don't hold your hand (God bless Dark Souls), but this game, despite being a Jrpg, seemed to make it obscenely hard for me to even start going somewhere.

Unless you have the patience of a saint and the willingness to figure where the hell you're supposed to go to, and how to do ANYTHING, I recommend staying away from this title.

I regret buying it.

Les dialogues sont drole et bien Ã©parpillÃ©s afin de ne pas casser le rythme du jeu. De plus l'univers fourmillent de rÃ©fÃ©rences au monde du jeu vidÃ©o en gÃ©nÃ©ral, qu'il est trÃ¨s agrÃ©able de retrouver. Pour n'en citÃ© que quelques uns, on aura l'occasion d'affronter un raflÃ©sia, on rencontre un bonhomme de neige ayant la forme d'un djinn de Golden sun et lorsqu'un personnage meurt il est parfois Ã©cris "brb" sur sa tombe.

Gameplay : simple et Ã©fficace on va gÃ©rer un groupe 4 personnages, trois Ã  l'Ã©cran et un remplaÃ§ant, qui peuvent avoir des compÃ©tences et Ã©quiper des objets, quelques invocations cachÃ© au fur et Ã  mesure de l'histoire et les "limite break".

LÃ  oÃ¹ cela devient gÃ©nial c'est la gestion des Ã©lÃ©ments et altÃ©ration d'Ã©tats, pour cela trois points importants : 

 - TOUS les Ã©nnemis on des forces et des faiblesses par rapport aux Ã©lÃ©ments et altÃ©rations d'Ã©tat, y compris les boss. Vous vous souvenez de ce sort "Cyanure" qui ne sert Ã  rien car tuer des Ã©nnemis au poison est trop long et les bosses y sont immunisÃ©s, et bien lÃ  ce ne seras pas le cas et pour certains boss c'est mÃªme particuliÃ¨rement conseillÃ©. De plus tous les ennemis sont analysable et un fois fait vous aurez toutes les informations permettants d'Ã©laborÃ© une stratÃ©gie.
 - TOUTES les attaques (ou presque, on va dire 95%) sont Ã©lÃ©mentaires et bon nombre d'attaque on un Ã©lÃ©ment qui dÃ©pends de l'arme Ã©quipÃ©e.
 - TOUTES les piÃ¨ces d'Ã©quipements sont plus ou moins aussi bonnes lorsque l'on prend leurs caractÃ©ristiques en compte, elle deviennent donc toutes occasionnelles (sauf le chapeau qui multiplie par deux les soins lancÃ©s, celui lÃ  j'ai du mal Ã  m'en passÃ© tellement c'est bien). On choisira donc souvent une piÃ¨ce d'Ã©quipement pour son/ses Ã©lÃ©ment(s) que ce soit en attaque ou en dÃ©fense.

Ces trois points font que pour rÃ©ussir Ã  avancer (je conseille de jouer en mode difficile dÃ¨s le dÃ©but, ce qui reprÃ©sente un challenge correct sans Ãªtre franchement difficile), il va falloir prÃ©parer son matÃ©riel judicieusement en fonction des Ã©nnemis qui arrivent, voir fuir le combat une fois le boss analyser pour revenir aprÃ¨s une mise Ã  jour.

DurÃ©e de vie : En prenant mon temps (j'aime bien farfouiller partout) et sans finir Ã  100%, il m'a fallut plus de 50h pour finir une premiÃ¨re fois le jeu. Le jeu propose des modes new game plus, mais je ne suis pas fan, je relancerais plutÃ´t ma sauvegarde juste avant la fin, pour faire les challenges et bonus qu'il me manque.

Conclusion : Un bon RPG qui certe n'est pas trÃ¨s ambitieux au niveau graphisme et profondeur, mais dont le fun de l'univers et des dialogues ainsi le gameplays trÃ¨s centrÃ© sur les Ã©lÃ©ments et altÃ©ration d'Ã©tats rendent l'expÃ©rience trÃ¨s agrÃ©able.
